description:
I should give them one star because Nizario's is for sure the reason I'm fat...

But oh my goodness the guys who work here are SO  f*!%ing sweet, the slices/salads/garlic bread is bomb and its open late (hallelujah!) Praise Nizario's for being the late night neighborhood staple. 

(Please tip them, they deal with hella drunk shit and they really deserve it.)
author: Reishi A.

description:
Served hot! We got the one with three meats on it. 

Definitely a great drink food. The portion is big and the pizza is fresh.

Shop: pretty small but here are seatings.
author: Yuan Z.

description: Love coming here after a long night of drinking. Workers are nice too. Nice yummy big slice! Great alcohol food!
author: Christy V.

description: A great place to go after a happy hour event. They server hot pizza anytime you go which is a win. The customer service is very friendly, and will let you use the restroom. It is small there is not much seating but great to grab and go.
author: Poonam M.

description: My heart will always go on because of Nizario's Pizza...the Castro location has saved my life multiple times at around 2 am on weeknights. When the pizza comes out hot and fresh, it's bomb diggity good! Wifey likes the Castro or California special and I like the super combo. The slices are pretty large and filling which is great when you can get filled up for around $5/person. We stopped here because we were on our way to Marin and needed something quick and easy. Thank you for being there, we always appreciate you!
author: Guisela L.

description: Good. Ive gone to pizza heaven.this pesto special slice has some serious taste and nice  nice ingredients. Very fresh and garlicky the pesto and spinach was fresh and yummy.
author: Selby C.

description:
Nizario's is my go-to restaurant for late night pizza when I'm out in the city. It's located right on Geary in between 2nd and 3rd ave so it's pretty easy to get to -- parking isn't always the greatest but people who ordered their pizzas to-go double parked in front of the restaurant at the bus stop and were able to run in and out with their pizzas without a problem. If you don't have a car that's not a problem either -- as stated before there's a bus stop right in front so if you hop on the 38 it'll bring you right to where you need to be. 

The restaurant is really tiny and not to prettiest, but it's interior does not affect the quality of the pizza in any way. My favorite pizza to get there is pepperoni with pesto. It's not on the menu but you just order it and they can make it for you; it comes out to $4.50 per slice and one slice is decent sized. It may not be as large as a costco slice or anything like that but one slice is good enough for those late night munchies. 

I personally think Nizario's pizzas are really tasty but I find them to be on the heavier side -- both with the pizza crust/toppings and the oil it comes with. My pizza in particular may be more oily because it is topped with pesto, but in general I always have to dab a few napkins on the top to get rid of that upper layer of oil. One slice is incredibly filling and right after you finish your pizza, if you're craving some sweet stuff there's a boba place right next door. 

I'm giving this place 4 stars because of the price and the cleanliness/size of the restaurant itself. Since my pizza is technically not on the menu, it's always a tad bit more expensive than whatever else my friends to get that is on the menu. In regards to space, sometimes the later you go the more crowded it is, especially on weekends, and since the interior is so tiny it only has 2 round tables and a bar -- maybe 10 high chairs max. My group of friends was quite large so only 4 of us got seats while the rest crowded around. Eating in may not be the best option for large groups! Overall, I enjoy the pizza from Nizario's and I will continue to come back for those munchies/drunchies.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Five Stars for service-just friendly and helpful+they also seemed like really kind people (also noticed how the work crew just seemed like family).

My family and I ordered a large half Hawaiian and half Veggie-both toppings were delicious and filling (and each slice was thick and melting hot). The Veggie had a lot of fresh veggies on it (sounds repetitive, but it's important)! The Hawaiian had a good ratio of bacon and pineapple (might have enjoyed more pineapples though-maybe a preference thing). A half-and-half large came out to be around $27. And it took around 15 minutes to get our pizza.

The exterior and interior of the pizza joint is bleh (really small and no effort in decorations/looking appealing it seems), but the service and pizza were what made me give 5-stars. This place is literally a hole in the wall, but it's a hidden gem!
author: Christine H.

description:
Amazing pizza joint! 

They are a very small pizza joint, but super busy. We were hungry late night and wanted to eat something so this place popped up! 

It smells sooo good in the store, limited seating. 

We ordered the Chicken Pesto Pizza small size and the total came out $17.50. The wait time was 10 mins and we got it in 10 mins! Which was amazing!
author: Laksh M.

description: Shady store.  I asked for a large 16" pepperoni pizza, which is 10 slices.  Medium 14" is 8 slices.  He had one in a box ready to go so I asked if it were fresh since I didn't have to wait.  I specifically asked if this was a large pizza and he said yes.  I found out he gave me a medium.  I think he just wanted to get rid of his medium pepperoni pizza in the box.  When the customer asks for a large, just do the right thing and make a large pizza, even if it takes longer.  Don't sell a medium and say it's a large.  That makes your store look shady.
author: K M.

description:
Honestly, if you are looking for pizza past 11pm, Nizario's is the best way to go. They have five locations: The Richmond, The Castro, North Beach, The Mission, and SFSU campus.

I usually get their California Specialty pizza. That comes with Spinach, Feta Cheese, Pesto, and Chicken. Seriously good. The prices used to be cheaper, but this is San Francisco so a size is now about $4. Depending on the location there are different varieties of menu options. Unfortunately they do charge for ranch now (omg 25 or 50 cents, yeah I know!) but what's a pizza without some ranch? (bad pizza!)

Anyways, would definitely recommend to anyone who just wants to quickly go and grab a good, filling slice of pizza!
author: Kassie E.

description:
Went to Nizario's. few nights ago after driving for UBER. Meant to write this up a few days ago! I ordered their combination pizza I believe and it wasn't bad. Not the best by far! Last week some passengers during one of my UBER rides... picked me up a veggie slice from here. It was a lot better!!! I would have ordered it again but it was all gone. Being as it was 1:30am... it's to be expected. I was starving... so I stand by the 3 Star rating! 

I would love suggestions for better places to grab a slice or the whole pizza! Good pizza is worth finding and enjoying!!!
author: Matt C.

description: I love Nizario's!! The pizza is delicious, I recommend a pepperoni, mushroom, onion pizza :) I also recommend dipping it in ranch, so good! Pretty good prices for the city too, and they're open till 2 am, so let's go
author: Yasmin K.

description: I love Nizarios! It's by far the best pizza in sf! The mushroom, pepperoni pizza is the best with ranch! Go here when you're turnt and hungry but also if you're not I promise you won't be let down!
author: Shaanel B.

description: Delicious! Slices start at $3.50 and so worth it. The crust was, crunchy yet soft and flavorful. Good place!!
author: JamesAndTeresa M.

description:
Small little restaurant serving $3.75 good-sized slices of pizza.The pizza was filling and good! If I lived there, I'd see myself getting takeout from here quite often.

It is a small place; instead of eating inside, I'd probably just order for take-out.
author: Nishi S.

description:
I love that this is fast, easy and you can grab pizza by the slice. The slices are pretty big too and one was enough to satisfy me. I got the chicken pesto, threw on some extra parmesan cheese and red peppers and it was a delicious meal. There are few seats there, but it was pretty empty when I went. If I had more of an appetite, I would have grabbed another slice. 

Overall, I would definitely come back to this place for a meal or if I'm craving pizza.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Got some late night pizza here around 1am, had the pesto slice that comes with spinach and feta in it and it was pretty bomb. Had the garlic cheesy bread too which is basically a mini pizza with garlic and no pizza sauce but it was good too. 

Would get 5 stars if they had their own ranch instead of a packet of some generic ranch and if the indoor seating was a little nicer, but it had a good standard hole-in-the-wall pizza place vibe. I would definitely be down to go back for that pesto pizza again.
author: Holly H.

description:
Called in for a pickup pizza on our way to hang out at the beach. 
Pizza crusts were pretty thick and toppings were generous. 
Slices are also cut pretty big here. 
Combination was our group's fav. I personally thought the pepperoni is a bit too salty but everybody scarfed theirs down with no prob. 
2 large pizzas fed 8 people in our group with extra slices leftover.
author: M H.

description: This place is awesome, the pizza is really good. Originally I only wanted one slice, but ended up getting five slices with friends. The guy behind the counter was really nice and super friendly. I would definitely come back again.
author: Ai C.

description:
Nizario's has good pizza and great customer service. 
They got my order wrong and offered up a new pizza. 
Easy peasy. 

That is all.
author: Judi L.

description: The garlic bread was okay, but the wings and ranch dip need some major help. The ranch wasn't as creamy or savory as it should be, it was actually kind of sweet and vinegary instead, which was really weird. It definitely threw me off. Furthermore their wings were so fatty and mushy we couldn't eat them. The ratios were 30% bone, 50% squishy slimy fat, and 20% meat, which I'd attribute to them not using a proper fat-rendering cooking method prior to baking. Based on their garlic bread I think we'll give them one more shot before calling it quits, but we'll be using a different ranch sauce for dipping in the future.
author: Virginia J.

description:
I just order a pizza and I spoke  the person in charge today and he was not a very nice person. 
I being ordering from nizzarios for at least 25 years 
And telling you if this man with man continues to work there I will never order a pizza there again
Horrrrrrrrible customers service 
And he told me that their pizza can take up to 1:50 min
That is crazy 
Don't order from them
author: A. M.

description:
We bought 2 slices of Hawaiian to-go. The size was huge, the pizza was thick, and the taste was great. Price? Very very reasonable as well.

Great place to get pizza by the slice if you're looking to grab a quick bite!

Customer service is also great, such friendly & kind workers!

Parking: street parking
author: Jen S.

description: Only reason why i'm giving 5 stars is due to price and speed and their hours which are all amazing. The quality is meh but I love that my late night cravings over the years plus their low cost has fulfilled my pizza cravings. Plus the fact that FINALLY they have an option to straight up buy a Pepperoni Pizza! Yasss!!! Quality sucks tho so just expect a basic a*** pizza. It gets the job done though! Have been in-person once and there was a line but it was during USF's senior bar hop so it was all good. Crap quality but convenience and proximity to the bar were perfect.
author: Rose E.

description:
Probably my favorite by the slice place in the city. I try to visit when I'm around golden gate park. Unfortunately on weekends parking is a pain. I usually order ahead and pick up the slices. My favorite is the California special. I think they call it the Castro special at their Castro location. It has chicken and pesto.

Not much seating. But quick service makes it easy to get in and out. I'm also a fan of the garlic cheesy bread. It's fresh made using their dough. Not a roll of bread. 

The price is average. Not too cheap or too expensive. Also they have all beef pepperoni and sausage. So if that matters to you, it makes a difference.
author: Noor A.

description: What a disappointment. Nizario's is right in my neighborhood and I thought I'd give it a try. Not only did it take almost an hour and a half for delivery, from less than half a mile away, it was cold, and didn't taste any better than the frozen pizza I get from Safeway.
author: Katy S.

description:
Blows my mind people think this is good pizza. Honestly, it reminded me of the square cheese pizza they served in school cafeterias in the 90s. Or crappy frozen pizza. Flavor was bland and very one note. Boring. Cheese wasn't melty, but rather like biting into a layer of squished white rice - it just stayed in place and didn't have much flavor. Sauce was devoid of seasoning. Anyone who thinks this is stuff is great CANNOT be trusted. 

Disclaimer - I'm from NYC. I know good pizza. And the closest thing to good pizza you'll find in SF (that I've found, anyway) is Arinell's in the Mission, Avelino's near Presidio, and Victor's on Polk St.
author: shannon m.

description:
Wow senior stumble is in full force. Its Thursday around midnight... expect a 20 minute wait to get your pizza. This is the goto place for midnight munchies in the area besides burger king. And BK is just sad.

To give an image of the scene: A couple steps away toward the Scion or I guess now Toyota dealer (Scion RIP) a young girl is on the phone crying. She's on the phone, "why didn't she leave with me? How do I know shes safe?" Shes obviously just left Kama or the bar next door to that and her bestie probably left with a boy. 

The pizza: solid. I'm sure it even qualifies as the best if you've had a few.
author: Stefan T.

description: I tried this place for the first time, and my thought were that it was a nothin special pizza place. You get to order by the slice where prices are fairly low, ranging from $3-$4 ish dollars per slice. They give you a big slice and have about 6-7 different pizza combos. I ordered take-out since the place is fairly small and I live around the area. I got 2 pizzas (Hawaiian and Combo) and an order of their baked chicken wings ($7). The total was around $15. So pretty decent to feed 2 people. Overall, both pizzas were pretty doughy with a thick crust but both had a fair amount of toppings. The wings where tasty but had a lot of fat on the skin.. it also came with a packet of ranch! Def would go here for a quick and cheap bite, but again, this isn't your high end pizza store. On the brighter side the service was very friendly, kind, and fast which makes me more inclined to wanting to go back if ever craving a slice of pizza.
author: Anna L.

description:
Came here for two quick slices. 

Very fast and okay prices ($3.75 for a mushroom, $4 for a veggie). But the pizza was barely warm and very dry and the cheese wasn't very good. 

It was fine because I was looking for something cheap, fast, and filling, and so it hit those marks. This pizza is similar to--if not worse than--frozen pizza from the grocery store. 

If that's what you're looking for (which I was, it was fine), then this is your place.

But if you're looking for anything better, I'd go somewhere else.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Late night grub? You can always count on Nizario's to save the day! 

I have never eaten here just because it's kind of a hole in the wall. My friends and I would either order delivery or pickup depending how busy we are. It normally takes around 15-20 minutes if not less, which is great when you're starving. And why not grab some milk tea while you're at it next door. 

A small is actually a good size to share between 2 people! I like the fact how you can split it in half just in cause the person you're eating with is picky or has weird combos (that friend would be me). I get pepperoni with pineapples! I don't even know how I came up with this. I feel that the pineapple balances the pizza! And of course, ya girl needs her classic pepperoni. But you do you, go crazy with it. 

Nizario is cheap, quick, and delicious. Don't want that hangover after a night of drinking on Geary? Grab a slice!
author: Breanna N.

description:
WHY WE WENT HERE:
- drunchies from a party around the corner that had no food

THE LOOK (FROM THE OUTSIDE):
- not as poppin as the Castro location

THE LOOK (FROM THE INSIDE):
- a bit small, but not as cramped as the Castro one feels

THE MENU:
- pizza
- drinks
- appetizers
- salads

WHAT WE ORDERED/THE TASTE:
- I ate whatever my cousin ordered for me and wasn't disappointed

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
- since I'm not the one who ordered (or paid attention) I don't know how the customer service is other than right after our order was placed our pizza was served fast and hot
author: Sarah-Lorraine L.

description: I've ordered this pizza 3 times now and EVERY TIME I get it, it's cold, dry and meh. Surprised this place is rated 3.5 stars.. Not worth it.
author: Alicia M.

description: I've had better. But for a late dinner, it was ok. Originally wanted to get something else in the area but they ended up being closed and being in a big group (12+) we just decided to eat here instead of driving around in different cars. The pizza was very dry, and tastes like cardboard. The chicken was dried up as well and I didn't like that they mixed both tomato sauce w pesto. I thought it was a straight up pesto pizza. Most likely won't be back since it is a drive for me, but it was mediocre at best for a late night thing after drinking. Be sure to bring cash because they make you spend $7 before using card. No bathroom in this tiny place either :(
author: Lihz P.

description: I forgot to get my before and after pics for this spot. I devoured an entire pizza all myself. Can't complain about much other than the slightly extended wait time but I guess that's understandable during the weekend. Overall really awesome pizza. I recommend getting a whole pizza. Customize as much as you want :)
author: Kevin J.

description: I went in here around midnight on Thursday and got a slice of pizza. I was with my friend who is vegan and so I asked if they had one with no cheese and they said they could make her one but it would take about 10 minutes so we said ok sure. He custom made her an individual pizza and even cleaned all their surfaces and knives to make sure there was no cheese at all in the pizza. It was one of the nicest experiences I've had with a food joint in SF and especially for a pizza place. Hands down my favorite pizza place in SF.
author: angela l.

description:
3.5 STARS

I've had Nizario's many times throughout the years. After drinking at the former Alpha, I'd stop by for a slice to soak up all the booze.

Last Friday, July 3rd, I got home a little late. Around 10pm. The roommate and I were lazy so we ordered pizza for delivery through Eat24. Nothing like pizza as a late night dinner option.

*Chicken wings ($6.50): 6 baked wings with ranch
We got 2 orders as 6 wings is never enough for 2 people to share. Tasted like standard chicken wings. Reminded me of the frozen kind from Costco (which I like). It fulfilled my wing craving.

*Cheese garlic bread ($4.50): 8" loaf cut in half with garlic-spread and cheese on both sides
Some subtle garlic flavor. Nice amount of cheese.

*Nizario's special pizza ($20 medium): pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, red onions, bell peppers
This was the roommate's pick. I liked the toppings, but I found the crust to be way too thick and bready.

*Garlic chicken special pizza ($14.48 small): garlic, chicken, pesto
My pick. The garlic could have been roasted a little more as it was a little harsh. But I liked the thinner crust on this pizza. The chicken and pesto had great flavor.

Good late night pizza delivery option. I remember loving their pesto and pepperoni slices back in the day. 3.5 stars rounded up to 4.
author: Elena N.

description:
A night drinking or a night of smoking many blunts and joints, this place can do no wrong.  

I used to love the California but my main staple is the super combo.  Place does get packed after the bars close though
author: A L.

description: This was my late night college USF life line. Amazing pizza and open super late. They serve by the slice and fair prices. It's a small little room so not the type of place for a sit down meal. But perfect when you have to have pizza at midnight and refuse to settle for a subpar piece.
author: Angela D.

description: Ordered delivery from this place and the pizza was delivered fast, about 30 minutes to arrive.  Ordered the veggie combo w/ garlic and jalapeños added.  It was truly a veggie pizza.  There was heavy veggie toppings, nice thick crust, and decent mozzerella. Overall if order here again whenever I'm in the mood for good pizza.
author: Dan O.

description:
Got munchies? Go here!
Big slices? Yes!
Cheap? Yes, under $5! 
Do they only serve pizza? Nope, they offer salads & chicken wings.
Open late? Yes!
Also.. I recommend getting the pesto!
author: Vangielynne P.

description:
Pizza is ! The slices are huge and sold at a decent price!! You gotta try the California Combo and put some of their buffalo sauce on it.

This was a great place to come to after the bars, especially since they're open late! Came here on a Wednesday night around 1 or 2 am and the place wasn't packed. So if you got them munchies late at night, this is definitely the spot to come to during the early part of the week cause I can only imagine this place gets crowded on weekends.
author: June F.

description:
This is my go to spot when I needed some late night pizza since they are open later than a lot of the other places in the area. 

This was where I first sampled and got hooked on the Hawaiian slice (Canadian bacon and pineapple topping). It is one of the few spots in the area that sell pizza by the slice. 

The employees are usually customer service oriented. They have many varieties of slices that are already prepared.  Popular slices include Hawaiian, Pepperoni, California and Super combo.  It is only a short wait for them to be heated up. 

The sitting area is not too spacious yet most customers like to take their slices to go. They are a popular late night spot on Geary Blvd. 

People that live here already know how good this place is. If you happen to be visiting you will most likely need some late night pizza.
author: Gregory C.

description: 5 stars for the cheesiest, tastiest late night pizza we've ever had. Thank you guys so much for being open on New Year's Eve, and for being fast and delicious on one of the busiest nights of the year. We really appreciated you!
author: Convict T.

description:
It's open late. Like way late. And after a night of drinking, it was an awesome save. That dream was somewhat fleeting though.

The place is tiny, standing room only with tables to boot but people really go in just to grab a slice n go, or stand and eat before piling into the car again. The service at the front is curt and to the point. For this type of business it works perfectly unless you want to be catered to. I wouldn't see why though considering you're probably there for the same reason that I am at this hour; attempting to avoid waking up drunk in the morning.

The pizza itself was not my cup of tea. Well, it wasn't terrible but made me wish I could find a Blondie's nearby instead. I got a super combo and a chicken pesto. It wasn't anything amazing per se. The crust was crunchy which was nifty since it held up well. Drunk proof practically in my mind. Knowing me if it was a sloppy affair I'd drop so much stuff off of it during my meal. The toppings were okay with not much sauce to speak of. I didn't get a feel for the taste of the ingredients which was kind of a let down. Usually everything tastes delish after a long night playing the lush, but I couldn't really say that here. I'd say it was probably because the pizza was dry unfortunately which would explain a lot about what I had experienced from it. Should've stuck with a classic pepperoni or mushroom had I known. I tried a sauce on the side thinking it was a spicy sauce and would save the pizza a bit. To my dismay it was buffalo instead. I should've just stuck to some crushed red and parm in retrospect.

Well, I'd stop in again for a late night fix. Can't really ask for the heavens at certain times of the night unfortunately.
author: David C.

description: For after midnight pizza, Nozario's is the way to go. Done even bother going home below stopping here to soak up your regrets of the evening. Staff is always very nice!
author: Brianna S.

description: best authentic pizza in the bay!  we've been coming here for 3 generations: my pops, my wife & i + our kids.  you must try the super combo & hawaiian w/extra bacon.
author: Salman T.

description: Average pizza but don't ask them to deliver. I'm 1 1/2 blocks from their Geary location and when we opened the box, the pizza was barely warm. There are plenty of other pizza option in the inner Richmond.
author: Edgar W.

description:
The night is young.  I hop on Yelp (as I always do) and look for the nearest bar scene.  Call an Uber because I'm there's no way I'm driving home tonight.  Find a quaint little neighborhood bar called NorthStar Cafe in Telegraph Hill.  Dance battles occur and witty banter with the locals.  Lots of drinks happen...tequila shots, beers on draft, Guinness, more tequila shots.  It's getting blurry.  Get to the jukebox, throw on some Journey, Don't Stop Believin' of course.  It's closing time, super wasted.  Jump in another Uber,"take me to get pizza..."  He drives 2 blocks down, lol.  Drops us off on a corner and points to a flickering neon light..."Nizario's Pizza By the Slice".  

Ninja Turtle Pizza

You can't go wrong with it.  It's so perfectly greasy to cure my drunkness and soak up the alcohol.  Cheese oozing off of it just like in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.  I take a bit out of it and pure bliss.  Hardly hold my hand steady enough to take a picture.
author: Alex P.

description:
3.5.

Russian roulette dinning anyone?

All of you out there with kids, or a significant other that acts like a kid...let them do the ordering just one time and see what hot mess they come up with.

Well I'm game so I put a bullet in the dinning chamber and let the youngin make the choice.

Whatd I get.....the Tijuana Pizza from Nizarios.....yeah I know sounds like a donkeys involved.

Pepperoni, Pineapple and Jalapenos is what this bad boy is all about  really didnt sound good ....and was okay...but I would def not order again.

Nizarios is an okay pizza place. The crust is okay, toppings are okay, and overall build was fine. Would I go out of my way to dine here...probably not. But if you coming out of buckshot hammered.... you could do far worse than this place.
author: David G.

description: This is a hole in the wall pizzeria that offers thick slices (think Costco thickness but half the width). I feel really guilty eating all those carbs but man was it good. So while I want to give 3 stars...I'll give 4 stars due to the $4 slice that happened to be really good even though I was full. Nough said.
author: Joshua F.

description: Nizario's Pizza has the best pizza in North Beach Area. We usually go there when we are on the way home from work on Thursday night. We usually order the chicken pizza which we both love.  Yesterday we tried veggie pizza, ohhh it's as delicious as the chicken ones! And the waiter there is always very friendly!
author: Zexian L.

description:
I've given this a second thought, and while the price is high they make a good pie and their delivery folks are solid. They are the nicest dudes. I feel my original review (below) was too harsh. Retracting it and upping the stars. 

--

I've been a huge fan of Nazario's for years. 

I ordered their largest pizza with chicken and pesto sauce. It was $35. The other pepperoni pie brought the total to $66. $80 seemed like a fair tip. 

$80 for two basic pizzas? Insane. After a at least 50 orders over the past few years this will be my last. 

I don't mind indulging for good food but I think we can all agree $40 / pizza is absurd at any size.
author: Trev C.

description: Pizza here is meh. Not anything delicious to my standards. Even as drunk food, this was still meh. Ordered it a few times after going out, since it is one of the spots open in my neighborhood during late hours and I think the 3rd try will be my last. Hopefully I can find another late night pizza spot, though.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Bready, doughy, but decent. This is a good late night option if you are out at Ireland's 32 or are in transit from downtown to the Richmond District. There is minimal seating - just a few high tables and stools. This gets a lot of the student crowd.

They also deliver quite late and have always been speedy.

Nice veggie slices with greek toppings. Friendly guys.
author: Carole B.

description: Great pizza!  Ordered 2 XLs and they were big slices.  You pay more for the real authentic pizzas but it was definitely worth it.  Lots of toppings and good sauce!
author: Jim C.

description:
Good pizza, no complaints. 

Its not the best pizza there is, but its always good. 

Its a staple of the Inner Richmond. Medium thick crust.

Especially if you are out at the bars, I would stop in for a slice. 
I also order delivery from them, they do a great job.
author: Jeremy B.

description: One of the better pizzas in the bay.  Open late, cheap pizza and it taste great cant beat that.
author: Jimi Y.

description:
This place is a close walk from my apartment, so I figured I had to try it sooner rather than later. 

Their menu is pretty unique and they deliver. The chicken pesto is delicious as is the Nizario's special. Overall a very good pizza joint in Inner Richmond.
author: Nico C.

description: I participated in Senior Stumble, that's how I ended up here. I got their "California", and MY GOSH not only was it a large slice, but the crust was so nicely toasted, the favors were freakin awesome, and I was blessed with a short line. Being tipsy, this pizza was dank so I would definitely go back sober lol. Highly recommend!
author: Trisha C.

description: Just got delivery of two pizzas, had a slice each and that was it, no more. Very very poor. Thick soft very bready slices. Overall tastes cheap. Not at all what we expected. I've gotten single slices from the other Nizarios on Valencia which were lovely. This tasted like a completely different pizza altogether. Won't be ordering again.
author: Emma G.

description:
Small place,but  quality People.
Open late.
They singing "Happy Birthday " for my Son and he Was So Happy!!
We was here at 10:47PM
author: Macario M.

description:
I like the idea of eating a greasy slice of pizza after a long nite of imbibing, but nothing sounds appetizing when I'm in that woozy condition, thus, leaving me a famished mess the following day. 

That's how I ended up here, at one of my favorite local pizza chains, in the middle of the day, inhaling root beer & a mushroom slice, & taking a Greko slice home for when I got hungry again (you know, in two hours.) I love Nizario's perfect proportions of cheese, sauce, & toppings. Chewy, not-too-thick, not-too-thin crust. Delicious! 

(Only reason for 4 rather than 5 stars is the location; too much of a trek to be my usual haunt, but make no mistake, their pizza is top notch.)
author: Fancypants X.

description: Came here on a rainy evening and ordered pizza for pick up. They told me the order would take 20 minutes and sure enough my pizza was ready for pick up when I arrived. I ordered a half combo and veggie pizza and it was flavorful. The thickness of the pizza was good too.
author: Tiff H.

description: This is the typical drunk pizza place for the area. It's not somewhere you go when you're looking for the best pizza you've ever had. That having been said, they're always nice and courteous in their service. Open late and pizza always hits the spot when you need it most. Gets my seal of approval.
author: Donnie M.

description:
This place is ok. I am a huge pizza fan, and ill be up front and say i there is a fine line between deep dish and thin crust, and our beloved in between. 

I like a little more bend in my dough and crunch. The ingrediants are good, sauce is good, and the service was fine. Just not type of pie due to the crust. 

good work though guys. I can see why those who have a love for a more thicker crust go crazy for this spot.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
This is my favorite pizza to order-in when we're deciding to relax at home. 

Nizario's does a regular crust on their pizzas (not too thin or too thick, my favorite) and I find that their toppings are good for a regular pizza joint. I usually order a plain cheese or pesto pizza. Their pesto pizza is awesome and is highly recommended by me. You wouldn't be reading my review if you didn't trust me, so take my word for it! Their cheesy garlic bread is also delicious. Their menu is pretty straightforward: pizzas, garlic bread, wings, and salad. They don't dabble in sub sandwiches or pasta, so you know the focus is going to be on their other dishes.

We order in from here 90% of the time, and orders are quick and delivery folks are nice, especially when they have to walk up three flights of stairs to get to us (thanks guys!). You can also pickup your pizza or stop by for slices (especially recommended if you're next door at Buckshot and need a munchie).
author: Liz G.

description: Fast, cheap and yummy! Thought I was going to need two slices to fill me up. Wrong!!! One slice was super filling and for the price of 4 bucks, that was a steal! Cashier was very nice too. Will be back!
author: Meggy C.

description: 2 AM. Post wine and whiskey. Delivery. Pepperoni, jalapeno, and pineapple.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: This pizza is garbage ! There is way too much dough on the pizza and not enough sauce. Look, i get the quickie meal after a night out of drinking at the local bars but man, this is pushing it. Drunk people still have taste buds and there is nothing to feel here. Pizza cost too much and its served like we were in prison. San Francisco / Richmond district deserves better. GET THIS GARBAGE OUT OF HERE !
author: Chris A.

description: Workers are awesome and polite, interact with customers well and make you feel welcome. Pizza is really good and cheap! No slices over $5 and the slices are good sizes.
author: Sierra S.

description:
It's 2a.m. and insomnia torments you like an itch spot you can't reach. Dependence on ambien isn't really the way to go. Side effects include dizziness, nausea, and a variety of things they don't want to tell you on those pharmaceutical ads. What you really need is a good old-fashioned FOOD COMA. 

Fortunately for you, Nizario's got your back. They serve thick slices of hot pizza deep way past Cinderella's curfew. Several bites of these bad boys and the food coma will knock you out like Kimbo Slice (they should really name their pizza that). Imagine the cheese, pepperoni, and doughy crust all sitting contently in your tummy. And you, my friend, will be laying drowsily on your bed. 

Is the Pizza hella good?

No. The cheese doesn't stretch and the pizza isn't always fresh. And even though each slice packs enough flavor to bring back Flavor Flav, the old school rapper would probably decline a bite on the grounds of sodium overload.

But does it matter?

Hell naw. It's 2 am bruh. Beggars can't be choosers (actually i've witness some who can...). For $4 a slice, you can't do much better and you can do a lot worse. The only thing that matters is that Nizario gets its job done as a late night pizzeria: To feed the drunk and to help the insomnia peeps. 

So stop counting sheeps and start counting dollar bills. When you get up to 4, head down to Nizario's and grab a slice. 

Good night and sweet dreams.
author: Ringo M.

description: You can't really go wrong with some late night slices. It's easy to miss this hole in the wall pizza place during the day, but if you've had a long night of drinks that neon sign calls out to you. Each slice is decently priced at around $4-$5 and they're well-sized. Sure, it's not the best pizza out there, but if you're going to Nizario's for the reason I think you're going to Nizario's you probably won't mind.
author: Justin P.

description:
TOTALLY.HITS.THE.SPOT.WHEN.DRUNK.

~$4 a person bought us each a piping hot slice of pizza with a crisp doughy crust slathered with melted ooey gooey cheese. Canadian bacon and pineapples topped our first slice giving it a deliciously savory sweet combo.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cYRTXu7jknjwW7w0mEUpmA?select=I8ZY-tufpIqLc6AE64Zi9w
This was just enough carbs to soak up all copious amount of alkie we just consumed.

~$8 a person bought us a second slice each topped with chicken, pesto, spinach and feta cheese. Meaty, salty and herbaceous goodness.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cYRTXu7jknjwW7w0mEUpmA?select=I8ZY-tufpIqLc6AE64Zi9w
This was enough to make me want to bash my head against the wall the next morning for being such a drunken heffer.

The look on our friend's face when he found us inside Nizario's hovering over a pizza box, a slice in each hand dipping into a mound of ranch sauce and ravenously inhaling the pizza with Parmesan cheese and tomato sauce plastered on our faces...PRICELESS.

OTHER NOTES:
*Closes at 2 AM everyday
*Fast and friendly employees
*Counter area for eating but no chairs
*CC's accepted
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I suddenly had a craving for a cheese pizza when I was on the 33 coming from the Mission... The only place on that route that offered cheap pizza close to home was Nizario's.

It's a small shop with friendly gents. It's where you can get a quick bite, watch a game, and go. I got my slice and it was pretty big for $3.  Luckily, the sliced it down the middle so I saved half for the next day. 

The sauce was sweet, and the cheese was gooey. It was what I wanted and I was satisfied. 

This place is open late, so if you're having late night munchies but don't have a lot in your wallet, Nizario's is the place to go.
author: Vira P.

description: Just a quick A-OK slice of pizza. Came out in just a few minutes and it tasted like pepperoni pizza. Not much else to say about it. Seemed like a reliable joint and it was cheap too. Gonna definitely keep it in mind if I'm in the area.
author: Sean H.

description: After having an underwhelming experience at the North Beach location, I told myself that I probably wouldn't step foot into another Nizario's location again. a couple of years later, my boyfriend was craving pizza while I was at Little Sweet next door, so Nizario's it was. The employees at Nizario's are really friendly and absolutely great as they make you feel like you're a longtime friend immediately as you step in. Nizario's space is very modest, but they have enough seats if you want to grab something quick. My boyfriend and I shared a slice of pepperoni pizza and it was one of the best slices I've had in the city. I'm no pizza snob, but I do, however, know when a slice of pizza is great and Nizario's has some really great pizza!
author: Joyce E.

description: We just moved in down the block, and we needed some heavy midnite grub. This place was great, 20$ got us a big, yummy, loaded pizza. It's exactly what you would want from late nite pizza- tasty, quick, and friendly staff. We will be regulars I'm sure!
author: Kayla P.

description: I love Nizario, he is the best guy and is extremely nice! I have come to know him over the past 18 years I think it has been that I have been ordering pizza for delivery or coming in and getting pizza.  It has been so long I lost track of how many years I have been coming here.  I order the mushroom, hawaiian or the chicken garlic and pesto (California Special) all great choices! I can eat pizza for a week and not get tired of it ha! Nizario always asks me how I am doing and how is my mom and brothers.  The place is small only 2 tables and a counter along the wall.  Nazario's is the best pizza in the Richmond district and the only pizza I like! The prices are inexpensive $3-$4 per slice and free delivery for pizzas.  All the guys who work there are extremely nice.
author: Alix J.

description:
Oi! It's pizza. If you're waiting for your milk tea from Little Sweet, chances are, the heavenly smell of pizza will arrive at your nostrils, and inevitably, you may think what I thought at near 1am: "Okay, maybe pizza and milk tea IS a good idea. Just one. Just one slice. Good."

Tiny place and will help you get your pizza fix all fixed up. It's no Costco pizza, but it is open, which is awesome enough in itself. It's forgettable, but hey, it's pizza!
author: Robbin A.

description:
Quick, cheap, thick crusted pizza!

Can't go wrong with any slice! California and the Tijuana are my favorite. 

Order a side of ranch and an ice cold soda.

They take card but I think there's a $5 minimum. No worries though, just order another slice!

PS don't hog all the condiments at your table
author: Sheena W.

description:
Quick delivery, fresh pizza, really nice family owned place. 

Only gripe is that my order was slightly wrong - they switched a couple toppings on the pizza I ordered - but no harm no foul, it was still delicious.
author: Nadine H.

description: Nice slice of pizza for a last minute bite to eat. Staff was super friendly and the pizza was piping hot, slightly crispy and delicious!
author: Krissy A.

description: Best pizza in the neighborhood! The dudes that work here are the real MVPs
author: Tyler W.

description:
The pizza was pretty good - I got the california which has feta, chicken, pesto and other toppings. I'm pissed because the employees were rude and after I paid $4 for a pizza slice wouldn't give me ranch for free. 

It's next to a bar called Buckeyes and is open late which is how I imagine they get most of their business.   I recommend this place if you're out late and in the area but I wouldn't make a special trip here.
author: Erica C.

description:
I don't know if it is because it was late night or if it is that I haven't had a slice of Nizario's pizza since middle school days, but it seemed to hit the spot. I got a slice of California (pesto chicken, spinach and feta), hot out of the oven with gooey stringy cheese. Self service to napkins, parm, chili flakes and oregano. 

Quick service, hot pizza, good price = great late night food!
author: Kelly C.

description:
I have been eating Nizario's for the past twenty years! 
Best late night pizza in San Francisco. 
Try the Combo! 
The owner is a gentleman and scholar, who knows over four different languages. 
Great service! Friendly Smiles!
author: Mitch L.

description: Once again Nizarios did not fail me and my girls.  We had lots of fun last night and of course Nizarios saved us at the end of the night.  Combo special for life l.  Love u Nizarios for ever.
author: Maria M.

description:
I have been a loyal customer of nizarios since when I was in high school in 1997 but as  much as I love nizarios they really disappointed me with their delivery.  

Usually they take about 40 min to me even though I'm 7 minutes away I'm used to it . 
But this time they took over an hour, I called to complain and they told me to wait 4 minutes after 10 minutes Still no pizza . If they owned up to it and told me the truth the first time I would've been cool but giving me a run around is what pissed me off. 

I will prob not be eating here anymore :(
author: DOM d.

description: This is ridiculous. We order one and a half hour ago and called twice. The driver is at Noriega and 48. We live three blocks away!!
author: Massimo M.

description: Pizza was decent, but filling the sriracha bottle but some crappy watery alternative really annoyed me. At least put it in a blank bottle so I don't drown my slice in lies.
author: Jack J.

description:
Another typical pizza joint in San Francisco.  There's probably one in every street corner on Geary Blvd.

This place was about to close when we got there.  This place tastes just like any other.  I don't see how a person could screw up cooking pizza besides burning it.

They were about to close when we got there.  The server asked if we wanted to buy a whole pizza instead of a slice.  He asked for $20 but I offered $15 since they were closing.  Yes, he sold us a whole pizza for $15.  I could have gone to Dominoes Pizza and bought a better one cheaper.  The fellas were probably a bit tired from a long night. So I don't believe he would care too much about his last customers.  

At least this place was cleaner then the other ones I have been to before.  But again they are getting ready to close.  So they're obligated to clean up.
author: ED L.

description:
Total wait time of 1 hour and 35 minutes for delivery.  Drive time to my house? 9 minutes.

No courtesy call.  

Just a bullshit excuse of "we had a busy night" by the driver.  Driver offered the pizza for a modest discount upon receiving my inquiry of "how much for a pizza that's 45 minutes late?"  -- I paid the full amount, less tip.

I don't care that you have a busy night.  We all have busy nights; if you are busy, don't estimate a 45 minutes wait when it ends up being twice as long.

Nearly-cold pizza delivered 50 minutes later than expected.

Useless.
author: Serge S.

description:
Ok don't me wrong I used to luv eating here. The slices and whole pizzas were good. But over the years I have found better and it seems their  pizza and service has gone down hill. I used to consider this a go to spot but now, not so much.

Slices seem like there is less of the usual toppings and when ordering a whole pizza it sometimes comes back soggy on the bottom, WTF! For a whole pizza Id rather go to the Round Table on Arguello St. and slices Id drive to Senor's. 

I can't rate this a 2 because of good memories coming here but man not that long ago I would have said 4 or 5 stars.  I hate when places go down hill after recommending them for so long.
author: T C.

description:
Not pleased!

We held a huge event in which we ordered about 25+ extra large pizzas.  Just as we do every year.  Well, we were overwhelmed with folks coming to this public school event.  And we were in need of more pizzas.

We make another call to them for an additional order of pizzas. (Not sure how many but it was probably about 12 more extra large)

Well they refused deliver them to us.  I realize that we are about 4 blocks out of their delivery zone.  But for crying out loud.  Its the Sunset. We ordered 35 extra large pizzas!

I'm surprised that they would not help us out.  
We were unable to leave the event. 
We gave refunds to the guests.

Thanks Nizario's.  That was totally messed up.
author: Miguel C.

description: Pizza slices were absolutely delicious, reminded me of  NY. $8.75 for two huge slices and a water.
author: Cory M.

description:
I just moved in to the area and thought I might go check out one of the pizza places nearby.

This place did not disappoint. The ingredients are good and the pepperoni pizza was baked just right in my opinion. Gooey cheese and a nice crunchy crust! The staff was also very friendly which always makes the experience more enjoyable. Overall a decent place at a decent price. I will be back soon.
author: Idean M.

description: After all the rave about this place, glad I tried it one lazy Sunday. Delivery was fast! Got to us within 25 minutes (granted we don't live far). The pizza tastes exactly like old school Dominos, before the flavored crust/revamp of the brand. I would probably give 3 stars since I don't like Dominos very much, but quick delivery and nice employees are worthy of an extra star!
author: Louise Z.

description:
We got the nizarios special. We got the 14" and it  had plenty of slices 8 I believe. 
It had a ton of toppings! very delicious. Delivery was quick! and the
pizza was still hot :) we also got the garlic bread, I would skip that
next time.
author: Yessenia O.

description: My friends and I ordered pizza from this place on the evening of 4/28.  The gentleman that delivered our pizza was timely and friendly.  The Taste?  Pretty standard and up to my expectations for this type of late night pizza joint.  The problem?  I had the runs the next day.  Talking to my friends, it turns out just about all of us who ate the chicken pesto pizza had a bad case of the runs.  This was ruled out to be the root cause because it's the only food in common that all of us ate that day.  Who would have thought that our pizza would come with an all day pass to Diarrhealand, the unhappiest place on earth?
author: Christopher W.

description:
Nizario's is one of my favorite places for a slice of pizza. The gentleman working the register is always super friendly and the slices are massive. I highly recommend going with the Pesto Special (cheese, pesto, spinach, and feta). It's delicious especially with chili flakes and hot sauce. 

Side note: I sometimes make my boyfriend take me here after we've had dinner elsewhere :-)
author: Grace C.

description: While the delivery was fast, and the pizza tasted ok at the time, it did not do very well on my bowels and four of my other friends the following day. Not sure if the chicken was not cooked thoroughly enough or there was some food prep contamination. We ordered a chicken pesto pizza and a Nizarios' special pizza.
author: Lawrence E.

description: Kind of tasted like Papa Johns or something. I was not a fan. However, that is not to say that it was bad pizza. Just not my cup of tea.
author: Vincent M.

description: I love this pizza place more than secret pizza in LV. We visit San Fran once a year and have Nizario's pizza once every visit. Can't wait to come back!
author: Li I.

description: Great pizza!  Thats all that needs to be said!  Been going here for years.
author: Kenneth G.

description: This was way worse than frozen pizza.
author: Morris R.

description: I've experienced a lot better. This is only good when you are really, really drunk.
author: Justin S.

description:
People love this place.  Even drunk I think this place is meh.  Yes it will satisfy an inebriated and or blazed individual, but there are plenty of late night pizza joints close to bars that do the same and do it with more panache. 
I like the menu with the feta options but when you actually get the pizza, it is sloppy, half way cooked, goop, that takes too long and is too expensive for what it is.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I live down the street from Nizario's so of course when I need a late night meal after a night of drinking I turn to their pizza menu. Granted, it's not the best pizza I've ever had in my life...but the fact that they are open until 2am, always get their pizzas ready within their time frame (I think it's 30-45 minutes) and have always been consistent, I can't complain! 

The pizza parlor itself has only about 4 or 5 small bar like tables to sit at so most people grab a slice and chill outside, especially those just getting out of the bars around 1:30am. 

The crust is a good thickness and the prices aren't bad. I've never paid more than $18-20 for a large pizza. They also offer single slices if you eat in. 

The staff is always nice and have never made any mistakes with my credit card or order like other places I've been to more than once.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Nizario's is great when you're drunk and fine any other time. It's not bad pizza, and there's some decent variety, but it's overpriced and the slices really don't seem big enough to justify it.

The crust is a little too... something. It reminds me of Domino's, which isn't much of a compliment (and at least with Domino's you get what you pay for).

Still, I like the toppings and they're open super late (hence the drunk crowd, myself included).
author: Jiordan C.

description:
Nizario.. the years has not phased you one bit.

I have always lived a block away from Nizario's and I remember back (when I was in middle school), their slices were only $2, tops! But of course times change and everything gets more expensive here and there but this is still my favorite spot to grab a great fat slice of pie.

NOW, each slice is between $2.50-$4.00 but their legendary portion size remains the same. 

My favorite is the Combo (pepperoni, salami, and mushroom) and Pesto. After two slices, I'm set for the rest of the day. They also added the new Californian! [http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/xmlGPGa0FyJa83gn3BDkPg/l.jpg]

BTW This spot is mad busy at night though due to all the local bars next door so just a heads up.
author: Albert L.

description:
If you have the nerve to say "Ranch-like" when you're asked what sauce comes with breadsticks, you've won the fight against totalitarian linguists. And, you won me over.

Steadfast delivery. 'Til 3am. It's not like I'm in the food for anything that comes close to anything real when I call this place, so when they say ranch-like, they could by all means say "what's the pizza like? Well, it's pizza like," and I'm sold.

Note: the garlic bread is the frozen style baguette and the breadsticks is a pizza without tomato sauce, loaded with cheese which comes with a side of We Make And Call Our Sauce How We See Fit. 

Double note: I'm not seeing the breadsticks cooked with cheese on top on the menu... but they definitely exist. And I definitely need them.
author: Jon A.

description:
This place is our go-to place for late night pizza fix. 

Called Nizario's because my friends and I were hungry. The guy who picked up the phone was incredibly rude. Okay, I get that you guys are busy. But we are your customer. You are picking up the phone, you gotta have good manners. Definitely disappointed tonight.
author: Thai C.

description: Got the super combo and the californian. Both excellent, but the Californian is a must try! Potatos galore :) I love the spicyness of the super combo too. Can't go wrong with pizza by the Slice from Nizario's.
author: Daniel T.

description: My girlfriend and I took a trip to SF and stayed in Russian Hill for a four day weekend. It was our last night there and we didn't want to go to far from the motel so we hit this place up. We got the veggie  and added pineapple and it was ready in about 10 minutes. This pizza was off the chain! This pizza was so thick and filling. We got a medium and between the both of us, could not finish it. We played it smart and saved four slices for the ride back home to LA. We went to Muir Woods and hit the 7 eleven on the way down to warm them up again.. . We will be giving these calls again next time we head up.
author: Sean H.

description:
Been coming here forever...the best pizza slices in the city!  I love this place, and now that I have kids, my family agrees.  It satisfies our cravings everytime, whether it's 11 a.m. in the morning or 2:00 a.m. after a date night with hubby.  When my kids asked for pizza Saturday morning, we came here with the intention of 2 cheese slices, but somehow we ended up with 7 different slices off their menu.  Their pesto pizza is da bomb!  The staff member had us try the new pesto/spinach/feta cheese pizza, and gave a couple of free slices to the kids.  I learned that the other Nizario's off 18th & Castro closes at 4:00 a.m.  Good to know, as I will drive to get me some Nizario's pizza...delicious!!!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/nizarios-pizza-san-francisco-2?select=TVE-yd5sOv95_9P_7XMuDw
author: Christine R.

description:
This is my favorite pizza place in the neighborhood!! 

The delivery is always fast. And I LOVE their pesto special pizza. The pesto is delicious, they put the perfect amount of cheese and the crust is crispy....just the way I like it! And only $15 for a large? I'm sold!
author: Sierra B.

description: Most people go here when the bars are closing so you can't blame the employees for hating everyone. But...... When you aren't drunk and then go in to order and pay, yet come back to pick up the slices 5 to 10 min later , then have to argue that you didn't pay- it's a bit too much. They are rude and the pizza is gross. Walk a block to Giorgios for a slice / but unfortunately not at 1 a.m.  So I give the device a zero and the pizza a zero but yelp says that is a 1.
author: Me M.

description: Got the pepperoni pizza. Pretty decent price, the cheese and sauce was good. Didn't like the pizza dough too much, it was thick and doughie. I prefer NY style, aka escape from NY.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
The pizza here is pretty good and they are open really late. 

You can normally get in and get a slice within minutes.

I rated it for because of the combination of convince and taste.

I also like the hot sauce they use there.
author: Ryan S.

description: I love Nizarios their California special is my favorite! The employees are always very nice whether I'm dinning in or getting it delivered! One of my favorite pizza spots in the city
author: Snow P.

description:
Alright, who am I kidding, I need to bump up my review here because Nizario's is amazing and I cant find any other fast food pizza place in SF more satisfying than it. These guys are always so amazing about adding whatever toppings i want. 

I LOVE that the toppings are always diced so I never end up biting into a giant tomato slice and pulling it out of the pizza slice altogether. (don't laugh, this is important stuff when it comes to pizza.)

Also, get jelapenos on your pizza, never too spicy and never too bland!

Note: I've never tried meat pizzas here, just the veggie ones. The veggie slice is so full of veggies it puts a smile on my face every time.
author: Neeharika B.

description: Not bad! I placed my order through Eat24 at 7:05, had pizza in my hands by 7:45. Decent pie, it got the job done!! Super friendly delivery guy, too!
author: J W.

description:
I lived in the Richmond from 1995 to 1999.  I was working full time in downtown SF and doing my MBA school at night at Santa Clara Univeristy. An hour away with no traffic.  I would get home from class at 11:00 at night. They would be nearly closed sometimes but would always find a way to deliver me a pizza after a 15 hour day. I absolutely love these guys.

Not to mention it is the best pie in town. Pesto, sausage and extra cheese was a favorite. (Guys, Kenny from 551 6th Ave if you remember me)

I live in San Diego now but try to stop by for a slice anytime I am in town.
author: Ken R.

description: As a student, I love Nizarios. A small pizza is about 8 slices for 15$! Definitely in my budget and lasts a few nights for dinner. My favorite thing...delivery was so fast! Eat 24 said 45-60 but it came in about 20 minutes max. Definitely my go-to delivery.
author: Taylor D.

description: This is my new favorite spot. Something about the dough they use is SO much better than anywhere else in my area. Open late, quality is awesome, and the delivery guy was super nice and thankful which is always a plus!
author: Colin L.

description: Love this place. Great service & pizza by the slice.  Each slice is a meal but I get two.
author: John M.

description: This place is dope the crust is dope the pesto special is dope. Open late and takes credit cards.
author: Phoebe W.

description: I'm real picky with pizza and was happy they make it just how I like it. I would eat here again.
author: Leslie D.

description:
A lot of places I hold in high regard are due mostly to the fact that I have fond memories there. Nizario's is one of those places.

The pizza is good, at best, but having spent many a drunken night here or struggling to dial them to make an impromptu 2-3 AM order, I find it disrespectful to go without mentioning them. 

I've never had a negative experience here and the staff are always chatty and friendly. Deliveries are prompt, and hassle-free. 

To be honest, I'm partially convinced they had our address memorized by the end of our college career.
author: Nicole I.

description:
Fast. Got a quick dinner here tonight with the girlfriend. There is a level of importance when rating a pizza... Dough, cheese, sauce, toppings.

The dough was awesome on both slices. Very light, yet toasty. I think toasty is a very good description of it. Not crunchy, but toasty.

The cheese is great. Do you know how to tell good cheese from bad cheese? Oil and if it falls off your pizza. A good one will not be oily and it will no fall off your pizza. Nizario's is a good one.

Tomato sauce was good too. Not tangy and a tad on the sweet side.

Toppings are rated last because no toppings can save a pizza with the previous three sucking. We got the pep and the pesto. Pep was peppy. Pretty standard. The pesto was just right! Just a good quick drizzle and not doused. I applaud you for that, Nizario's!

Overall, I'd see myself coming back here again and even ordering pizzas for larger gatherings :) They could use some work on their logos and typography though haha
author: Timothy L.

description:
Came in for the Pesto Slice, $4, a few times - and have been delighted each and every single time. It's a decent sized slice cooked to perfection with just the right amount of pesto sauce. 

I recommend it if you are in the area.
author: Brian D.

description: On yelp it says this place is open. It's 3:21pm now and it's not even open. I drive all the way here so I can have two slices of pizza...  I like their pizza. But how can I enjoy it if the business isn't even open? They should just advertise that it'll be open when there are crowds of drunk people looking for food.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Service: 3/5
Food: 5/5
Wait: 2.5/5
Price: $
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3.5/5
Overall: 5/5

The BEST pizza I had ever had, it is my ALL TIME favorite. I wish they had a location somewhere in the Mission!
author: Eva H.

description:
Nizario's sells affordable pizzas by the slice, is open late, and delivers till 2:00am.

That's What's Up.

Nizario's is simple and basic in all respects. They don't have a vast supply of pizza options, and their place is tiny and bare. But their pizza is hot, tasty enough, and at 3.00 a slice - a cheap dinner. 

After the kitchen closes at Buckshot - come here for a hot pesto slice. Or pop in a movie late at night and just speed dial Nizario's.

Reliable hot late night eats can be few and far between in this city  - so I highly suggest bookmarking this one.
author: Jessica T.

description: I like them because they have decent pizza, quickish delivery, and deliver to my house near Outer Richmond. I will usually order from them unless someone visiting requests somewhere else. Nizarios is my go to.
author: Kayli B.

description: Good pizza for the price, open late what else do you want!? Kind of a puke fest next door tho, I recommend this spot as a last resort! One of the best!
author: Nathan B.

description:
Best post drinks/late-night pizza spot.  Just the right amount of grease.  Thick crust.  Ready to go or ready in 1-2 minutes - so speed is on your side if you need a quick bite.  

Proximity:  Geary bars and around the corner from Clement spots

Everything in this area is a no-frills, border line dive establishments.  OK to be in jeans, tee, and flips.  Everything is neighborhood around here which I love.  

If you're driving to get a piece of the Nazz- note that this area is not the best parking situation.  I suggest coming in 2's so that someone can go around the block while the other grabs the pizza.
author: Deanna A.

description: I'm a vegetarian so I found their pizza good but nothing amazing. I've heard good things about their meat options though.
author: Nguyen K.

description:
My boyfriend used to live along Geary Blvd. and this place was one of our favorites. Nizario's  is one of our favorite pizza places in the city and I'd totally give them the thumbs up on their speedy delivery as well.

Yay! For Nizario's! I miss it.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Really great pizza, but calamari took forever to cook. Great location. I wish the was more/better outdoor sitting.
author: Juliana B.

description:
We stop here when we're in a rush, and/or broke.   Decent slices with a nice crisp crust, fast friendly service.

It's a tiny place, but the guys working here always have a big cheery welcome and thank you.

Once the counter guy even went outside and asked a motorcyclist parked right in front of the door to please stop revving his bike because the noise and fumes were bothering customers.  I thought that was really nice.
author: Meg W.

description: I used to drive to SF just for their pizza before moving to the Bay. The Richmond Dist. and Castro are the BEST! I love their pizza it is good & everyone is really friendly! They're open late so its always my stop after a night out.
author: Vash D.

description: The pizza is always waiting and they have some decent selections. Pizza is good in a pinch, it's fairly tasty and the staff are really nice. I probably wouldn't order a whole pie from them.
author: Travis B.

description:
I don't think these guys give a ship about pizza. I like getting pizza here when all else is closed and this is literally a 4 minute walk from my door... so that earns em 2 stars... 
but the customer service here is just so grimy... It's like Julian and Ricky from trailer park boys running this place.
I don't want to bring down business, cuz they fill a solid niche, but I want to see some respect when it comes to pizza.
author: Libra J.

description:
Is everyone taking crazy pills?

I cannot get over how awful this pizza was. There is MINIMAL CHEESE, MINIMAL SAUCE. Its basically just bread. More of a bread stick than anything. 

Terrible. Order from North Beach Pizza, its not great, but its much better than this trash.
author: chris b.

description: Easily the most disgusting pizza I ever had.  Nasty crust, cheap toppings, bad cheese.
author: J S.

description: We ordered pizza from here for a late night snack. The pesto with olives was delicious. The pineapple with jalapenos wasn't really my kind of pizza, but still good. They were quick with delivery and overall an enjoyable experience.
author: Madeline S.

description: Their pizza is good, but the staff is even better. They always make me smile so after a while they just became one of my favorite place to eat out or order from. Wish them many more year in business.
author: Francesca L.

description:
Get the garlic bread! You get two huge slices for each order and they're toasty and delicious. It's not SO overwhelmed with garlic that your breath will stink for 4 years either. 

We got the Nazario Special and it was tasty, although the bottom of the crush wasn't very crunchy, since it was soaked up in the oil. 

We called for pick-up and our order was ready within 15 minutes, so great service. All in all, it satisfied our pizza-craving, but there are definitely better pizzas out there in the city.
author: Christine A.

description:
D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S
My all time fave pizza place... and I have been to many!!
Delivery is always on time, very pleasant. Love the crust of the pizza! 
It's a must to try!
author: Nicole K.

description: Worst Pizza in SF.. I don't care how drunk you are... there's got to be something better around even at 2am (which is when this place makes its nut)
author: Josh K.

description: Did me wrong. When did I decide to go in and order crust? I did not get sauce nor did I get cheese. I got a shit load of burnt pepperoni on my minus sauce minus cheese two slices of pizza to go. When I pulled up, there was a mindless girl outside who apparently works there and eventually helped me. Perhaps sweetheart, instead of smoking whatever it was that was illegal, you should be helping the business that you are supposed to be running inside. Just a note. I was not impressed by this business at all and will never be ordering from them again. It is trash.
author: Liz R.

description: If you're in the neighborhood late at night it's a decent place to grab a slice.  The guys who work here are great.  Super nice and suoer fast.  Being two doors down from Ireland 32 sure doesn't hurt either.
author: Laura L.

description:
This was really good when drunk.  I must have been really drunk though because I don't know why else I'd be drunk and in the Inner Richmond.  

That said, I don't know how accurate this review is going to be if I ever try it sober.
author: Erika C.

description:
The place to go after a long night of drinking and shouting in front of a Giants game!
They do basically serve all kind of pizzas and make it in front of you;

L'endroit idéal après une longue soirée à boire et soutenir les Giants!
Ils servent une douzaine de variétés de pizzas qu'ils préparent devant vous.
author: Mark B.

description:
My boyfriend is obsessed with sports, especially soccer. So this past Tuesday night, when the International Friendly hosted the US playing against Mexico, I knew there'd be beer and pizza waiting for me at home.  

Unfortunately, he decided to order from Nizario's.  The pizza delivery was timely, and service was friendly.. but that did not make up for the fact that the pizza was pretty terrible.  Not only did the pizza get delivered to us almost cold, but the crust was neither soggy nor crispy just almost partially uncooked... Also, we had ordered extra sauce (I'm a big sauce person and I am weary of new pizza joints) -- and it was nowhere to be seen. The pizza actually lacked sauce throughout, leaving a whole lot of luke warm dough with some toppings and barely any cheese! The toppings were fresh though, so the food wasn't inedible per say..

But let me tell you this: I love cold pizza for breakfast the next day-- love it. But Nizario's leftovers have been sitting in our fridge all week.. That says it all.

With Orgasmica and Escape from NY offering better pizza for delivery at a similar price, I can safely say Nizario's will not be coming up again soon.
author: Roxane W.

description: Pizza was fine, tasty in fact. However waiting 90+ minutes early  in the evening on a Wednesday night isn't worth any pizza.
author: Gregory F.

description:
Everyone giving this place a good review must be drunk! I do believe the only reason this place is in business is because there are at least 10 bars in the few blocks surrounding it, and it's one of the only restaurants open late night. 

I've tried very hard to like their pizza, I've had several different toppings and plain cheese, and its terrible. The crust is like cardboard and has these indentations on the bottom that lead me to believe they get it frozen and premade. The sauce is bland and the cheese doesnt even taste like real mozzarella to me.

The staff are nice enough, and the price is reasonable. But that doesn't make inedible food any better. I really wish it was good because its close to me house. To be fair, my 12 yr old son will eat it without complaint. But that honestly isn't saying much, he'll eat pretty much anything that even vaguely fits the description of pizza.
author: Venus S.

description: Nizarios is the Richmond dist. joint for the best quick slice pizza. Late night munchies? Drunk food? After work I'm too f'n tired to cook anything nights? Nizarios hits the spot. Crust is just right being thick yet not doughey. Ingredients are up to par and pizza comes out relatively quick. Staff is great because no matter how many drunk morons space out when they get to the register, they still have a great attitude and a smile on their face. For those boochie hipsters who clown on this place and find this place "beneath" them? Tell u what. Buy their garlic chicken pesto and light up a candleabra and now you have "fine dining"
author: Jas P.

description:
They're really friendly and welcoming. 
I accidentally knocked my bf's half-eaten pizza onto the floor, and the employee was kind enough to replace it for me for free. I already love this place, but that nice gesture makes me love you guys even more!

Lately, I've been getting their their pesto special: spinach, pesto, and feta cheese. Sprinkle some garlic and you're set.
author: Mandy D.

description: 5 stars for fantastic customer service. These guys are great, they treat you like family. The pizza is good and it's open until 2am. Their pepperoni is spot on. Can't fault it.
author: Ryan M.

description: Nizario's is cheap, quick, and easy - if only dates were this way! My friend from New York stopped by. After a drink at Ireland's 32, we were in search of cheap quick eats, and Nizario's fit the bill. I regret not getting the pesto, as my friend did, but with Nizario's prices, three bucks can remedy this error.
author: Marcus M.

description:
I feel like you don't find many pizza places like this anymore, its quaint and has the warm atmosphere. The people were very nice and smiled at me a lot and they were also very welcoming! 

Okay now i'll explain the fun part.. I'm a foodie! I love all kinds of foods but to be honest i can also be the pickiest person ever and mainly towards Pizza's and Burgers and certain things like that because those are the things i'll make at home for a typical dinner night.. This pizza was absolutely great, it was made right in front of us, it was quick and the dough was fluffy and thin crust and the it was juicy and lets just say their's a reason why all drunks end up there after a bar.. The greasy juiciness just takes over your taste buds.
author: Jessica M.

description: This is usually my go to spot when I'm craving pizza in my neighborhood. Maybe it's been a while since my last visit,  but it seems the pizza quality has gone a bit downhill.  Regardless, fast & friendly service. Their combo pizzas are quite good.  Can't say the same for the cheese pizza. Pepperoni still hits the spot though!
author: Shall P.

description:
Really good place, and yes I was sober.

Stopped in there and watched the final minutes of the 49ers vs. Saints game and had fun.

The people working there were extremely nice and into the game as well, made me feel at home!  Pretty good pizza too.
author: Caleb M.

description:
Instant gratification.  

Yes, pizza by the slice is waiting for you.  We walked in, ordered two slices of combination pizza and a Coke for $8, and had it in our hands almost before we finished ordering it.  

Back out the door, satisfied, in less that 10 minutes.
author: David D.

description:
Eating on the floor of a San Francisco hotel room is how I experienced Nizario's pizza for the first time.  That said, I can't forget it.  

Thumbs up to this place for combining several things I love into one delicious pizza, the California Special!  Dough, spinach, feta cheese, pesto and chicken?  Delivered to my hotel room?  Of course I'd give it a decent rating. :)
author: Kristen A.

description:
My wife and I were in the mood for some pizza delivery, but we were a bit tired of paying almost $30 for a large pizza, like some of the other places we've ordered from around the Inner Richmond.

Nizario's is great; they've got a lot of large pizza options for around $15.  We decided to mix things up a bit and order a couple of smaller pizzas; a pineapple/jalapeno, and a "San Francisco Special" with sausage, pepperoni, and ham.  I didn't want cheese on the SF special, and the guys made it a point to call me back and make sure they got the order right.  The delivery was prompt and the pizza tasted quite good.  The crust was especially good - a little bit on the thinner, softer side.
author: Tim N.

description:
Pizza is good.  Reminds me of NY-style.  I prefer this location over the one in Castro.  (Why? Because this the first one I went to and it'll always have a higher place in my heart. :-P)

Cheesy gooeyness.

Service = okay.  They're friendly. Although, they do tend to stare at females.
author: Fannie S.

description: Always quick and hot. Pretty good pizza with a decent amount of toppings and a nice crust. Love the San Francisco Special with pineapple and the Tijuana Special. It has become our go-to pizza place.
author: Danielle C.

description:
One of my Top Five favorite pizza joints!!

Only thing...same as other pizza joints, don't order the ones that been sitting there. That's why I always ask them what's hot?

Pepperoni & Mushroom
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/Q6iFzOkuULlVhHJH4NqKAA/l

Pepperoni & Pesto
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/C0srgRrTFkY5pxpf3hhGEA/l

(Sunday, February 1, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description:
This place is a sure thing.   Cheap, quick, and good - the best way to transition from a night at a bar/lounge/club to making the drive home to the South Bay.  This was a regular stop during my college days.  A recent late night trip reminded me of those good times and nudged me to finally Yelp it.

Big slice of pepperoni pizza with a cola, and in the company of friends.  Life is good.
author: Nathalie V.

description:
No, not the best pizza in the world - that would have to be a joint in Brooklyn - but I come here so often they've got to be doing something right.

It's all about value, you know? At Nizario's you always get more than what you paid for. The pizza is dirt cheap but always seems to hit the spot. Whether I'm drunk off my ass after bar hopping in the hood or I'm yearning for a late afternoon snack after hours of perusing books at Green Apple, Nizario's has a hot, cheesey, and crispy crust of a slice waiting for you.

Plus the guys behind the counter are always super cool and treat locals and non-locals just as well. 

4 1/2 stars, for real yo!
author: Art O.

description:
BOMB ASS PIZZA!!! probably the best pizza i've tasted in a long time (well minus cheeseboard in berkeley, or zachary's of course).

if you're ever partying out in the city, and need late nite grub...this is your spot! They sell pizza by the slice...very cheap, and the ingredients taste fresh..not stingy on the toppings, and the crust is crispy just how i like it. You have to try the garlic chicken pesto pizza aka castro special (i believe).....sooooo good. i wanna go right NOW!
author: Gina N.

description:
pretty cool pizza to go place
order by the slice
$3-4 per slice
8 different types of toppings/style: pesto, combo, cheese, usual stuff
my only quirk is i want more sauce. kind of dry 
dough is soft and crunchy at the same time
author: Andi I.

description:
Unbelievable pizza! Really big slices and pretty good hours. The 38 took me right there and right back to my place.

They even had pesto, and their credit card limit is pretty fair also
author: Jacob M.

description: 1) This place needs a health inspection - Saw the pizza maker itch his bare ass then to continue to make pizza. Found a brown hair in my slice (probably the sexist cashier)  2) This place will try to weasel every cent from you. I ordered a side of ranch ... when I asked for it, he showed me another person credit card receipt saying I didn't order it. 3) After all of that my girlfriend just wanted ranch so gave him 75 cents for some ranch then he slapped her hand saying, "its rude for her to give him money." and began asking me for money.  This place is a dirty place that needs to shut down! DO NOT GO HERE.
author: Eric F.

description:
