Every once in a while I come here for a slice of pizza because I'm too lazy to walk farther on my lunch break. The pizza isn't terribly good, but it is pretty inexpensive. I imagine if I had more drunk crawls along Geary I would wind up here more and like it quite a bit more. 

I always feel like I'm interrupting the people working here when I walk in.
author: Kyle K.

description:
2.5 Hours for Delivery? No thank you.

Yes this place is awesome and delicious if you are in the are. Are you thinking about delivery? Hell no, call someplace different. 2 hours at least. Worth ir? Nope.
author: Max W.

description:
Before heading home, we stopped by this place late night.  Great that they sold pizza by the slices at 2 in the morning.  
Pizza slices were warm when served, with plenty of toppings, whatever it is what you ordered, no skimping here. 
Great late night, after drinking stop.
author: Annie D.

description: Lived on this pizza during college, great late night snack!
author: Robert R.

description: Pizza is very good at Nizarios to eat there by the slice, but delivery is different. I ordered a pizza that took an hour and 45 min to arrive and came medium temperature. I was very disappointed.
author: Juan V.

description:
Out late? Hungry? In the Richmond? NO PROBLEM!

Nizario's offers a slew of tasty, cheap and yummy pizza...by the slice!!!

(Apologies for the excessive use of exclamation points.  Pizza gets me excited. [EXCITED!!!])
author: Valerie C.

description: A great place to eat at 1 in the morning after a solid night out at the bars. Great pizza, probably the best on Geary, with huge slices and a price that wont break the bank.
author: Will F.

description:
Two words to describe my feelings about Nizario's Pizza.....HEEEEELLLLLL NOOOOOOO!!! Actually let me make it three words for the full affect.....AAAAWEEEEE HEEEEELLLLLL NOOOOOO! 

Listen, I'm from the east coast and know about pizza. This place is ridiculous overpriced for the quality of food that they're serving. 

Let me break it down to ya Flava Flav..."Yeaaaa Boooooyyyyy!!! I began to order a Medium 1/2 Hawaiian & 1/2 Nizarios Special, which is basically Pepperoni, Sausage, Red Onion, Mushrooms & Bell Peppers. 

I also had a huge craving for buffalo wings so I asked the dude how many is in an order. Guy informs me 6, 12 and whatever else he said after 12. I didn't really pay attention cause my fat-ass shouldn't even be considering eating more that 12 wings before a Medium Pizza. Dude then tells me that a 6 piece was like $8 and a 12 piece was something like $14 or $15. That's when I almost choked from my own saliva. I said $15 for 12 wings. Holy Sh$#!!! 

So, my lack of a brain tried to calculate which would be cheaper...Ordering the 12 wings for $15 and getting a Small pizza OOOORRRR....ordering 6 wings and getting the medium pizza. My Mozaltof Ass wanted the wings more that the pizza so I decided to go for the 12 wings and a small pizza thinking that that would at least save me some big cash. How wrong was I! 

Vinnie rings it up and say...$25.68. Holy Sh$#!!!! If my old fashion Asian Grandfather was still alive and he saw me order this overpriced pizza and actually paid for it, he would have taken a couple of fortune cookies from his restaurant and cracked it over my head. 

WTF!!! Who in there right mind would pay $25 for a small pizza and 12 buffalo wings? Duh...Me...the Sucka!!! Maybe I'm use to going to Ceasar' or Domino's where they have 2 large pizza for like $10? The pizza at Nizario's sucked bad. Crust was not crunchy and the pizza was just okay. 

Listen my fellow Yelpers...Pizza should never cost a lot and you shouldn't pay that much either.... Unless....you're at a high end Italian restaurant where the ingredients are top notch and your date is either a super model with fake boobies or a Dude that has a big penis and drives a Ferrari oh....AND... will let you take it for a spin by yourself every now and then. 

I will never pay this much...Never Again!! Not from a damn pizza joint, using questionable ingredients, that sits right next to some dumb ass bar that has all the drunk idiots coming over to eat the crap cause they couldn't tell the difference between there ass and a good slice. 

Whoever gave this place 4 stars or higher is either Rich or Drunk! Or...maybe Drunkenly Rich! In either case, people who gave this place a good rating (you know who you are) should def have not taken all those shots of Tequila. Sober up, get into your BMW or hop onto your Vespa and go to New York or Boston for some cheaper...Kick-Ass Pizza! 

Sorry for the ranging rants about this place yelpers. I had to do what I had to do cause I think my Grandfather was giving me the evil eyeball from heaven.
author: Larry B.

description:
Nizario's had our pizza ready so quick! When we called for pick-up, they gave us an estimate of only 15 minutes! When we got it back to the apartment, it wasn't steaming hot, but it wasn't super cold either.

Try the garlic bread with cheese; they give you two big pieces for $~4. We ordered the Nizario's specialty pizza, practically their version of a combination pizza. It was a bit greasy in the middle, but overall the crust was very crunchy. What I really liked about the pizza was they don't skimp on the toppings at all. You can also order by the slice, so it seems like it'd be a great place to get a quick bite.
author: Ronald T.

description: Today I ordered a 14 inch California Special for the first time with a couple of friends and it was amazing! It was fast, tasty, and the best thing about this place was the service. They took real good care of us and even insisted on taking a group picture of us. Definitely my favorite pizza joint in San Francisco. Oh don't forget to IG their pizza's. #Nizarios
author: Mark Y.

description:
I had the perfect slice of pepperoni pizza from these guys yesterday. Seriously, guys. It looked PERFECT and tasted just as good. 

These guys have a really good crust. Crunchy on the outside, but soft inside, not too much dough. My mom and I actually came here once and ordered just the crust from them. No sauce, no cheese, just crust.
author: Lady V.

description: Horse-shit. 2:40 after we ordered it finally arrived. Grub hub gave us a whopping $3 off. Pizza was freezing cold and not very good. Shop elsewhere.
author: Weird B.

description:
Service: Does a long line count?
Food Eaten: Pizza
Price: Cheap
Would I come here again: No

I really have to say that the pizza here just isn't that great. Several of my friends love this place but I just can't stand it. I cringe whenever anyone mentions this place. 

I think my friends all like it cuz this is the place they go after they finish drinking in the Richmond. Its cheap and open late. When you're drunk, nothing beats it. However, I am hardly ever drunk so this just doesn't cut it for me. If you are in the area before 10 or so, you are much better off heading down the street a couple blocks to Bella Pizza.
author: Richard L.

description:
Stopped in at Nizario's on a friend's recommendation last night.  My friend arrived first and was finishing up when I arrived.

Hungry from a 4 mile skate, I eagerly ordered a Pesto Special slice.  

I sit down with my friend and wait.  And wait.  And wait some more.

The two guys running the show behind the counter were not paying any attention to what they were doing.  The guy who took my order was watching the Simpsons, and the guy making the food next to him was busy eating with his mouth open, directly over his product.  I even saw food fly out of his mouth at one point.  Absolutely disgusting.

After about 8 minutes of waiting, I decide that my slice should be done by now.

I mosey up to the counter, and ask the guy, "So, a Pesto Special slice?"  He looks awfully confused for a second, then the light goes on.  

"Almost ready," he remarks, as he quickly darts back to the oven to retrieve my now overcooked slice.

I ask for a cup of water, and am informed that they do not have any cups (which is ILLEGAL, they are REQUIRED BY LAW to provide you with water).  

I ask if they have a to-go soup cup or anything at all I can use.  His answer?

"You can use the sink."

Screw this place, their garbage pizza, health code violations, and terrible attitudes.  What happened to taking pride in your work?

For once, I'm really glad I didn't preemptively throw money in the tip jar like I usually do.
author: Anthony L.

description:
This is one of my neighborhood favorites. It's even better after a night of drinking. And even better when they pop in a fresh slice to be cooked. Sure it takes a little longer but it's well worth it once you take a bite out of a piping hot slice. 

My favorite is a pepperoni and sausage slice of pizza. And sometimes I get the pepperoni, sausage, and pesto. Yes, it's weird and not on the menu but they do it if they aren't busy. Prices are temperamental with that combination though, sometimes they charge extra, sometimes they don't. The guys working there are nice enough for me.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Luckily, this location is much much better than the Nizario's in North Beach. 

It's a great late night spot for some nice big, tasty slices of pizza. This one is significantly smaller than the one in North Beach, but their pizza was a lot better and I was quite pleased. Their combination is really really good and I also recommend the good old pepperoni. 

Nothing spectacular but a pretty good place for decent, late night pizza.
author: Denise S.

description:
**WARNING NOT A PIZZA LOVER** 

I am not a pizza lover. Maybe its the marinara sauce that turns me off from eating pizza but when I saw that they had Pesto Pizza, I was like..HELL YAH. Give me a slice of that Special Pesto Pizza please!! Immediately fell in love with this place. Being a pizza hater, its amazing that from time to time I would crave for a Nizario's Pesto Pizza. The BF would jump at any chance that I would crave for it and drive across the bridge, pay $6 for toll and take me to Nizarios. Totally worth the $3.50/slice + $6 bridge toll!
author: Esther M.

description:
03.17.10

Dear Nizario's,

Thank you for enticing my pub crawl gang away from the last bar and into your sweet, sweet embrace.

Thank you for not discriminating when they order incoherently.

Thank you for feeding them.

Thank you for being there for me all these years.

Your sincerely,
Jenny L.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Their pizza are DELISH! ...and affordable :) The guys that work there are super nice. I usually call in and order ...they have it ready in 15m or less. Crispy pan pizza...not greasy at all. 

Best pizza next to those brand name ones (ie Round Table, Pizza Hut, Dominos)
author: Serena F.

description: For those of you that are VEGAN and come across Nizario's on a Yelp search, they are not Vegan friendly.  I've gone in and asked and walked away sad and pizzaless.  Apparently the sauces have cheese in them so a non-cheese veggie pizza is no-go.  Village Pizzaria a few blocks away does do a vegan friendly cheeseless pizza though if you're in the mood for some 'Za.
author: Christopher R.

description:
Nizario's has always been there for me after drinking in the neighborhood

I hate to say it, but their pizza is just ok.  I love pesto pizza, and while I'll gladly eat a slice here, it's not my favorite.  The crust is too thick, the pesto is too much, and the taste is just average.
author: Tamara N.

description:
Well the guy who makes everyone else's "nice, big slices" must have been on vacation.  Because, um, these were regular sized pieces of pizza, that had almost no cheese, lackluster toppings, and crust that Dominoes would win over in a taste test.

I ordered a slice each of the super combo and the Californian.  The latter was far superior, but only because of the complexity that the spinach added.  I will say that I'm not a huge sauce fan, and that's one of the things that I did enjoy about my meal.

But I will not be stopping by after a night of partying, when I can't think of anything else to have, or if I happen to crave pizza so bad that I have to walk up hill to this place, in the rain, without an umbrella, wearing a windbreaker, on crutches.

Hey, I gave it a try.
author: Tamar D.

description:
This review is strictly about delivery. 
I do not recommend this pizzeria at all if your thinking about ordering in. it was honestly the most tiresome experience I've had with delivery food. 
We ordered 3, 12in pizzas and they confirmed this by telling us our total was going to be about $40 without tip. the delivery guy shows up with 3, 16in pizzas... he tells us our total is $64. when we told him they had made a mistake. he got very rude and was a complete ass to us. 
we're broke ass hungry college students just trying to get a good munchies and they ripped us off. really?

Amendment* Nizario's just called us the next day and let us know that they had indeed made a mistake. They apologized and even gave us 20$ credit for our next purchase!!! I really think the experience we had with the delivery guy was awful but today's call totally made up for it. Im a fan.
author: Jp K.

description: Pretty good pizza ordered a half combination and a half chicken garlic pesto sauce pizza it was a medium for $18.50 + tip, still had some leftovers to take home for the midnight munchies!
author: Rene L.

description:
like Biggie's "notorious" song, "NI-ZAR-IOS!" 

I love nizarios for their by-the-slice convenience and yumminess!  We ordered three slices for $11:  the pesto, the california, and the supreme combo!

The toppings were great on each one, but in retrospect, the crust may be a bit too thick for me.  Considering the price and quality of ingredients use (and freshness) I think that this is a STEAL for slice pizza in SF.

Note:  their pesto is a bit different from other pestos (like Blondies) because they still use their red sauce as a base and then smother on the beautiful green pesto on top.  if you're not a red sauce fan, then you may be a bit surprised by that!

Great for late night snack-attacks and they even deliver for FREE! Oh yea, and check their hours because i think they don't open till 3pm on some days!
author: Ali and Nick G.

description: If you don't know where to go late in the night, this is a good spot... but don't pretend too much. fair pizza.
author: Andrea M.

description:
I had a slice of pesto special (feta cheese). It reminds me of Pizza Hut pan pizza, which isn't a bad thing. It's less greasy and more crispy than Pizza Hut. It was interesting. I wished there were more sauce.

My largest gripe is that they don't have much variety for slices. It's either cheese, pepperoni, pesto something, or hawaiian. Still, I wouldn't mind sharing a pie.
author: Rahil P.

description:
The perfect late night delectable. Real ingredients, fast service, satisfying flavor, good price.

Nizario's does not pretend to be anything it isn't. There are about 4-6 places to sit inside and several guys behind the counter that pump out slices faster than anyone else I've seen in the States. Peak times seem to be early evening, late-dinner (8:30-10:00pm) and closing time (1:00AM -2:30AM).

They certainly know their market. I last stopped in at around 2:00AM after an easy evening out, along with hordes of USF students and 20-30 somethings hanging around Irish 32. From the moment the man at the register demanded "Next order!" to the time I got my slices was quite literally 5 seconds - done and done.

The food itself is what you might expect from a pizzeria with no real seating - nothing eloquent, just delicious and authentic. They use more yeast in the dough than other Italian pizzeria's with flat-crust so it's a bit thicker, the cheese is real mozzarella and isn't rubbery, and the size of a slice is decent - especially for a price of $2.50-$3.75 in the City.
author: Luke F.

description:
LOVE this place! 

This place is good for lunch or just a late night snack. 

I like their pepperoni, pepperoni and sausage, and even their pesto is really good. I like putting the hot peppers and Italian seasoning on the pizza. 

Sometimes I come in and they just make it fresh and put it into the oven. Then you can enjoy it hot and it's really delicious. 

When I get hungry during the nighttime hours, it's a really good snack to fill my tummy.
author: Jenny L.

description:
This is not a good example of pizza, but a trend in california is complete ignorance of good pizza, and actually taste for terrible pizza so I will let that slide. It is a perfect place for a quick slice if you are sufficiently inebriated, very stoned or just really want to watch what is on their T.V. The pizza has the consistency of DiGiorno's,if you think DiGiorno's is good, go buy one, and if your too lazy to make it for yourself you'll be right at home at Nizarios. 

In sum: terrible pizza to be eaten when drunk, stoned, lazy, or completely ignorant to what good pizza is.
author: M. R. C.

description:
Fortunately, Nizario's only serves pizza pie.  No humble pie.   A few weeks ago, I publicly poo-pooed Luke A's love of Nizario's pizza.  Do not feel bad for Luke A.  He was immediately and rightfully consoled with ROTD for his Nizario's review.  The review was really great.  It didn't give me a stomach ache the next day at all.

The other night I had an urgent need for pizza.  In keeping with my thoughts on the other location, that Nizario's is the pizza of last resort, I called two other places that had already closed before breaking down and calling them.  When it finally got here, I have to admit, I was in extra cheesy heaven.  There is the possibility that one of the stars could be the winning beneficiary of circumstance.  

I'm hoping that Luke A does not request that they add "crow" to the list of toppings.
author: P J.

description:
Ok, so it's not the best pizza ever b/c that's Brothers Pizza in the Sunset.  But, they stay open late past 2 which is perfect for those of us like that like a late night snack after a little drinky drink.  I won't lie.  I've never had Nizario's bone-dry sober. . . 

If they're not too busy, ask them to make it extra crispy and they'll leave it in the oven a little longer which means, more crunchiness.
author: Christina L.

description:
Eh.

It was good when I lived in the area and was craving a late night slice of pizza. Cheap, not oily, hot slices. Perfect to calm the hunger.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Open late, Nizario's is one of the best pizzas I have eaten in San Francisco. They deliver and have a variety of toppings to choose from. My biggest complaint is the pizza's bottom crust due to the texture. Eat it fresh, it's very good!

My pick: pepperoni, garlic, and artichoke. Winner.
author: Barrett I.

description:
So a colleague ordered a combo pizza (XL) from Nizario's today.  Knowing nothing about the place, I went in with no real expectations.  Yes, I heard it was good pizza, but then again, shit, Domino's can be good pizza.

It arrived in the 30 mins they said it would take.  $29 later, we had ourselves a MEAL!  Yes, $30 for one pizza?  Hmm.. definitely not diggin'.

Well, the pizza was great.  It was very well made, tons of toppings, and not too thin, not too thick.  I thoroughly enjoyed every bite... partially because I was painfully hungry, but mostly because it was actually good pizza.  

I see from other reviews that they sell by the slice.  Perhaps on another day, I'll check out their other pizzas and see what they're all about.  

For today, good delivery time, good food, but not the most attractive prices.  4 Stars.
author: Johnson N.

description:
It took me a long time to find pizza joint in SF that I REALLY liked. Nizario's fits the bill. There are three, and only three components to a good pizza: crust, sauce, and cheese. Most places can manage to get two right, but Nizario's nails them all.

I'll let y'all in on  a little secret too. Feeling a bit under the weather? Order up a pesto (no red sauce), chicken, red onion, and extra garlic. Eat half before bed, and the other half before breakfast. Works for me every time.
author: Dan W.

description:
Your love of Nizario's Pesto Spinach slice will outlast any- and every San Francisco romance you'll find. This place is also apparently effective as a SF hookup spot: it's always close to a bar, and there's plenty of sauced singles anytime after 11PM looking for a good time with all the toppings. Go for the pizza, stay for the train wrecks. 

Cheers.
author: Lisa L.

description: It's open late, but pizza is meh, and really only good because it's one of the few places open late.  The pizza dough is edible and easily forgettable.  I'd give it 3 stars, but I gotta knock it down due to 20 minute wait for a slice after ordering.
author: James Y.

description:
My favorite pizza in SF. Crust quality is unrivaled, IMHO. In my experience, Middle Eastern or Indian owned pizzerias make the best crust. I don't know what the smattering of bad reviews are on about with the minimal cheese, minimal sauce complaints.

  It's right on the money - for my money. Speaking of which, the prices for a whole single-topping pie are HIGHLY competitive with chain operations for a vastly superior product.

  I've had the delivery take incredibly little time and, on rare occasions, surprisingly too much time. The pizza kicks every conceivable shade of ass, though. So I can deal - forever. 

  In my youth, my brother, roommate & I ordered so much pizza from them one year that they sent us a Christmas card. Awesome.
author: Dustin M.

description:
I'm shaking my head at the sorry 3 1/2 stars given to Nizario's? What's wrong with this place? This is practically my favorite pizza spot in the city that's cheap enough for me to enjoy.  (NVM! it changed to a 4 star as soon as I sent out this review, haha)

I love how this place is open late at night (but if it's too late, then Seniore's here we come). Perfect for them late night munchies or just for a nice warm slice of pizza.

I used to get the pizza combo with chicken and pesto or something but I've made my own combo that for some reason, grosses everyone else out (cept the BF): Pesto, Pineapple, Mushroom. But we've also just recently made a whole pie combo of whole pesto, half pineapple, half pepperoni and it is by far the bessst pizza combo that I've ever gotten. And guess what? Nizario's makes it really, freakin good. (BTW, they probably have the best pesto tasting pizza as well)

I can leave happy with a slice of my combo and a slice of pepperoni without feeling as though I've paid too much for pizza. Or we can leave happy with a medium or a large of our whole pizza combo (that's about $15-$18 bucks of pizza heaven).

I hate crust. I hate it so much that I don't even feel terrible about wasting it... But for some reason, Nizario's crust is really good. It isn't doughy and it's not an overwhelmingly large amount of crust. It's not oily, it's not thick and it's not hella thin. It's perfect. 

We usually don't eat inside since it's too small but it takes 15 mins for our orders to get ready which is perfect cuz it takes about 10 mins to drive there and the remaining 5 mins is to look for parking and walking there.

They take both cash and card but there's a minimum of what I believe is $7 to charge. Parking is usually easy to find and they WILL be open during Christmas eve (enjoyed that bit this year :]) and usually, the people are really nice unless they're on the phone trying to take down other peoples orders. 

Enjoy Nizario's and quit it with the sorry ratings, haha jk. But for real though? Try out my combo, it's really better than most others think.
author: Clarizeyale R.

description: I hate to say it but Nizario's reminds me of a quality Pizza Hut. I thoroughly enjoyed my pizza but the crust and sauce reminded me of it. It's a perfect place to stop by after a night of bar hopping, but if you're trying to find quality pizza and are on the hunt - head to North Beach Golden Boy for a slice.
author: Celia C.

description:
Perfect place to grab a bite to eat after hitting the bars on Geary. 

They're workers are so friendly that in you're drunken state, you'll believe they're your best friend. 

They sell pizza by the slice and have little canisters of garlic powder so for all you garlic lovers like myself- pile it on! I'm a huge fan of their Greko pizza, which consists of pesto, feta cheese, black olives and garlic. I've also tried the California special with feta cheese, chicken, garlic, and spinach which is also delicious. 

Late night pizza problem? This is your solution. I definitely give this pizza parlor my stamp of approval.
author: Stephanie P.

description: The Nizario's special is always so good, and given everything else, it's reasonably priced. I've been there more than a handful of times, and the quality is super consistent. Also, the employees are super nice.
author: eric c.

description:
In person, fine. Delivery, bleh. 

I used to think Nizario's tasted delicious. That was of course after hours of drowning my tastebuds in PBR at the Buckshot next door. And after moving to the Richmond and looking for a cheap pizza delivery, it seemed like the jackpot. But, the few times that I've ordered, it has taken about an hour for delivery. Once, it took an hour and 1/2 and the pizza was cold. 

How does it take over an hour to go twenty some blocks? Not wasting my time here sober.
author: Jill T.

description:
The friendliest guys ever! The pizza is consistently really good (just mop the grease off the top), especially at 2AM. I like to alternate between plain cheese and the pesto special (or rather, my funds decide for me).

Also: they have been known to give away free pizza and free hugs on occasion. Just sayin'
author: Sam S.

description:
This is a longtime favorite for slices. It is really good. Crispy. And consistent. You don't get a delish slice one time then a grody slice another time - it is always exactly, precisely the same. you can count on Nizario's!

But they always look at me weird when I come in and sit by myself eating pizza and staring longingly at the people out the windows. So what Pizzaman, I have no friends!
author: Colin M.

description:
Pizza is delicious, prices are very cheap, and they're open until 4am. 

Far and away my favorite pizza place in SF.
author: Mike M.

description:
Perfect as a pit-stop while on a night out with friends.  Service can be slow on party nights when everyone's out, but it's worth every bite.  The pesto and California gets my vote, and did I mention they deliver fairly quickly?

I took a star off for their prices, and I think they could do better than charge $1 for a can of soda.  Dear Owner: Please get a fountain machine, charge $2 a soda, and call it even!
author: Sam W.

description:
Thought I should write this while I was still drunk and full.
Oh Nizario's, I am so full. And filled with garlicy fresh pesto and cheese slices to compliment the cheesy delight that was going down with the pepperoni...oh yes.

Sobering up, thanks to you...after all it is the lord's day and what better way to celebrate than say "oh god, this is best pizza ever" while drinking my miller high life (what can i say? i keep it real). 

so good, and i will definitely order from here again.
author: Lauren S.

description:
This Castro gem never gets their pizza wrong and in the city, it's basically an institution.  I've had their pizza for years and it never fails to hit a home run.  Okay, yes...it's usually after a night of partying up with the people in the hood, but I am usually sober by the time I get my pizza fix.  

The Castro special, pesto and pepperoni have always been solid.  This family owned business gets it right, there's usually a long line, but it moves fast and let's just say it's a colorful bunch =)  

You can expect fresh pizza that is really good and over the years, their prices are about right.
author: Desiree G.

description:
i typically dont give one star reviews but after ordering a pie from here, i have to, it arrived on time and looked appetizing, it was one of the specials.  it was hot as well, unfortunatly while it did have a decent taste i have been sick as a dog from eating it. I have no idea what the hell they did but it was no bueno! 

Also the garlic bread that i'd heard alot about was mediocre at best. normally i like to give a place a few tries before reviewing negatively but this place has about as much chance of that happening as a hooker not sweating in church. 

AINT GONNA HAPPEN.

I'll stick to Giorgio's
author: Cooper M.

description:
I love this place. I've been getting the Nizarios Special thin crust pizza for years.
In particular my girlfriend and I really really like Mustafa who delivers the pizza as well as the other guy. Super friendly, quick delivery.  It's a good deal and I'll always go here.
You'll love the food and the service!!!!
author: M H.

description:
You know you order from Nizario's too much when the delivery guy comments "Oh hey you moved to a new place! How are you doing?!" 

Always love Nizario's pizza...perfect cheese to tomato sauce ratio and amazing chewy crust. I personally prefer the pepperoni above all else but I've heard good things about the veggie as well. All the guys here are super friendly and accommodating. 

Unfortunately I have to knock down one star because when I tried to order delivery tonight...they don't deliver past Van Ness anymore (p.s. I'm 1 1/2 blocks past Van Ness...ugh!) which is ridiculous cause they used to deliver over here! Apparently the Castro location is too far away as well which is a major fail!
author: Tam G.

description:
Probably the best pizza place in the city.

Features:

- Delicious pizza with soft, cornmeal crust
- Open late until 2 AM every night of the week
- Accepts credit cards
- Sells by the slice
- Delivery
- Super-friendly staff
author: P A U L.

description: My friends and I love to go to Nizarios after a night of dancing at buckshot. It gets really crowded around 2 am when the bar next door closes. It always makes for a great way to end the night mingling with strangers while eating pizza and passing the Parmesan shaker around. Though usually intoxicated when eating this, I have to say its delicious pizza.
author: Kelly M.

description: Great, medium crust pie at a low price.  Not too greasy.  I like Nizario's better than more expensive joints.  They have a couple of tables and chairs, but not really a sit-down place.  Nice to know that Nizario's is a family business and has been in the pizza business for years.
author: David P.

description: I wish I could give a 3.5. This has very little to do with the quality of the pizza it was delicious and I thoroughly enjoyed the pesto, spinach and red onions on top. However, they told me it would be delivered in an 25 minutes and it took an hour which was not ideal. I'd definitely go there again but maybe I'll wait for a sunny day so I can walk over and pick it up myself.
author: Brittany N.

description: BEEF PEPPERONI!!! I love this place, its good pizza for a great price and they are open late. Its not gourmet so deal with it but definitely worth it.
author: Bijan A.

description:
I used to eat here.  USED to.
It's a hole in the wall pizza place, nothing more.
The pizza taste good and the people are friendly.

However...

The last time I ate there I had one slice of the meat combo.  Later that night I spent much time in the restroom.  I spent a majority of the next day and the next in the restroom as well.  It wasn't  pretty and it wasn't fun.

I admit that this only happened once of the many times that I had eaten pizza here, but once was enough for me.
author: Stacy Y.

description:
big slices of pizza...tasty..  

this pizza tastes even better when you come in after coming out of bar hungry and drunk..

the guys behind the counter are quite nice and you can joke with them well I guess since you are already drunk you might laugh at pretty much anything..

Combo...pesto...vegetarian...mmmmm
author: phillip w.

description:
The pizza itself is not too bad. It's just regular pizza. Probably deserved 3 stars. Then why does the review say 1 star? For mind boggling rudeness from the delivery person.

I asked for some damned pizza. Half cheese and half veggie. The delivery person was there in 45 minutes. For some reason he found the outer door too complicated and could not comprehend the concept of being buzzed in. Astounded, he shouts "Open the door stupid guy" in this broken English and with a weird accent. If I was not pissed, I would have been amused. I was oh-so-pissed.
author: Saurabh G.

description:
Figured I would yelp them since I've ordered delivery from them a dozen times now.  Always consistently good.  Won't leave you climaxing or anything like that but definitely better than average.  We usually get the Hawaiian and add red onions.  Generous toppings, right amount of sauce and perfectly sized crust.  It isn't thick and isn't too thin, just right.

I would stay away from the sausage though.  Its disappointing to find balled up little turds when you are used to having real hunks of sausage on your pie.  Everything else is fine.  They're friendly on the phone and at your door.  Definitely my go-to pizza place.
author: Pete M.

description:
Pretty good, nothing to write home about. If I'm going to order pizza, I'd rather go for Pizza Orgasmica or even Seniore's... at least they are nice!

I called here after looking for other places in the area and giving up; it only took about 45 minutes but when the guy finally showed up he was rude and didn't tell me he only took cash (in this day and age?? also he could have asked me over the phone before they arrived) and had to call it into his boss, having me sign a random piece of paper to act as a "receipt." 

Either way, working in the service industry as well, I know how it goes but expect a bit of respect in paying someone for their services. Next time, I'm calling P.O. and getting some beer in the deal!
author: Sarah C.

description:
My buddy and I ordered this last night for dinner. At the time, I hadn't eaten in about six hours and was pretty hungry. We ordered a chicken and pinneapple pizza. I found the crust to be only slightly better than Domino's cardboard-esque. For me, that's a dealbreaker as above-par sauce, cheese, and toppings can usually be overcome by an excellent crust. Besides the crust, the rest of the pizza was underwhelming. We nearly finished a large pie over dinner but agreed this morning to never order from this place again. Pizza being my favorite food, I'll move on and look for something better.

Kudos to Nizario's Geary location for delivering. I called several other places who wouldn't deliver to my area (Pac Heights). The guy who answered the phone was friendly, so that's nice.

The search for San Fran's best pizza continues.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Good Pizza. 
Open Late, Great if you are in the area drinking late at night.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Good, reliable take-out pizza.

Nizario's has been my go-to place for pizza delivery for a long while (and - when I want to splurge - for salads and sodas too...!) The service is reliable and prompt and the pizza is tasty in an old-school way. (The base is a little bit too doughy and thick for my genteel tastes, but in general, the pizza is verr-y satisfying.) Pizza is always delivered to my place by the same friendly, amusing Italian guy (something I like) and, at around 15 bucks for a medium pizza with a couple of toppings, it's a good deal.
author: donal c.

description:
I gave a 15% tip to the delivery guy and he stood at my door complaining for 3 minutes. 

The pizza is ok--but they have at least one dickhead employee
author: Gabe M.

description:
I didn't really eat that much pizza after moving to SF until about a year ago. That's when I finally met some people who ordered something other than Chinese food every night. And these people knew their takeout. When it came to pizza everyone had their preference. But as a group, nothing could beat Nizario's. Fast, cheap, and delicious.
I drive by them all the time but have never stepped foot in the restaurant. I've only had it delivered, and damn do they deliver. A hot pie, that's something great, not luke warm, congealed cheese, skimpy toppings. If that's your thing look elsewhere. The guy on the phone my come across as brusque, but never once has he messed up my order, cut me off? Sure. Sent me pepperoncini instead of pepperoni? Never. (Unlike that other place on Clement&Arguello.)
Oh, and the price can't be beat. If they raised prices I would still be calling them at least one a week.
author: Emily P.

description: This place hits the spot when you are drunk at 1:45am and are craving something to soak up all the cheap booze you just drank at the pub down the street. Lines can be long so timing is key. I have ate here sober once so it was pretty good then too. They take debit/credit too. Don't expect a fancy slice of pizza. The slices are overloaded with cheese and toppings like a pizza should be.
author: Darius A.

description: Started ordering from Nizario's a few years ago, and it is still my favorite go to spot when I'm craving pizza. Very affordable. Perfect for a late night meal when you want food delivered. They're open late. Will definitely be ordering from them again!
author: Kelsey M.

description: Castro Special is the best.  The pesto is a great vegetarian option too.  Awesome location and perfect for right after the night clubs.
author: James V.

description:
Nazario's is a great place to stop off to get a slice.  Its conveniently located on Gary and is right in front of a bus stop. 

The slices are large and taste great!  I usually stop off for a slice when ever Im in the neighborhood!
author: Henry S.

description: Very accommodating! Went late at night and requested a cheese free pizza due to a lactose intolerance. They were very accommodating and added the roping I wanted and even recooked the pizza. Great customer service and very friendly staff!! Definitely recommend this place for anyone wanting delicious pizza.
author: Colleen E.

description: A hot slice of greasy pepperoni and sausage pizza definitely hits the spot after a night of drinking on Geary!  And they take card, yay.  Not the best pizza ever but it still is tasty.  Service was good to us..but even if it was a little subpar like some people have mentioned, can you blame them with drunkies coming in until 2-2:30am?
author: Cat C.

description:
I am a huge fan of Nizario's. 

 It doesn't get better after midnight for pizza and good people.  I frequent the bars, Buckshot/Irelands near it so I am definitely a regular, but it seems it has basically become a staple to any night of going out because I always seem to be asking taxi drivers to stop by Nizario's before they take me home. 

 They are always friendly and know me by name and  the pizza is to die for.  If you haven't stopped by yet, go, I highly recommend anything with ranch dressing, because anything they make is going to be good :)  

PS. if you are in a hurry ask what they have ready, they won't steer you wrong.
author: Mackenzie B.

description:
Not much of a pizza guy. Or, perhaps I should be more accurate - I only favor very particular pizza from a small selection of places. As far as your neighborhood pizza joint, well, Nizario's is not bad; compared to the local competition, it's stellar.

I've only had delivery - the service was polite and timely.
author: Darrell L.

description: The pizza itself is nothing special. It's fine, perhaps a bit less than what I'd like in a slice.  However, it's open till bars close, and has a bit of seating inside.  Perfect way to absorb some alcohol after one pint too many....
author: Heidi M.

description:
Stopped in here one day for a slice...you know, to try something new.  I had just had my "down there" violated at Victoria's Nail salon down the street, and needed some comfort food to help me realize that the hair loss was worth it.  Man, this pizza made me forget everything that had just happened.  

Fluffy, crunchy crust, and heated up fresh for me.  Now, i ordered mushroom, and the guy didn't tell me that they had no slices, and had to bake an entire pizza...so i was there for quite a while waiting for my slice.  People who ordered after me were getting their pizza before me, and with a little communication this problem would have been alleviated, but in the end, they gave me my yummy pizza and threw in a bottle of water...for my patience.

I liked this slice so much, that i ordered a full pie the other day.  Delivery was right on time, and the pizza was awesome.  I think when ordering full pizzas now, instead of ordering from the place down the street that doesn't deliver..I'm going with Nizarios...its reasonably priced too.  Seriously....good stuff
author: Lauren F.

description:
(Warning: review made with dictation software, unedited) an inner Richmond classic. I know it for a late night slice but it is good anytime of day. When I get a slice of pizza I prefer to go super combination veggie meat everything I can get on there please add everything yes everything. Except pineapple. They have a good enough slices it is reheated slices they add toppings to whatever they have by the slice at that time which is generally cheese pepperoni or mushroom I knock em down a star because they owe me because of the ingredients ingredients are so so for example the sausages what I like to call a deer droppings sausage just a little round pellets spiracle pellets of sausage not the best otherwise good slice cheap as it should be I want to say 450 for the super combo not bad there are places out there asking 60 s days which is a total rip off I like mint Oreos wouldn't go out my way to go there its not blondies but it's good
 Okay I'm knocking a second star to reheat it slices is not the best way up pizza by the slice should be fresh pies all the time that's not always realistic I understand but that's a mix of 5 stars I knocked the second star because as I said then ingredients are sub par.
author: adam g.

description:
I love it here! Came here ever since I was in middle school since it was just a couple blocks away. Always open late and always a great late night place to go if you're craving pizza.

I wish their prices would stay the same. I use to pay about $2 for a mushroom slice and now, it's $3.00? 

Came here after a long 8 hour afternoon/night of work and hadn't eaten anything for almost 12 hours. Right before we went to the bar, we decided to stop by here and feed my grumbling tummy. 

Ordered a combo slice $3.50 and a mushroom slice $3. Of course I didn't eat it all but wanted to get one since I know I'll be hungry after a long night of drinking. 

The slices came out hot and super fast. I had the combo first and man was it loaded with mushroom, pepperoni, and olives. Definitely a great price for what you get.

Service is always friendly and delivery is always fast!
author: Juliane N.

description:
Oh Nizario's, I've only known you for a good slice when I'm up in your neighborhood. Until this weekend. 

Not many pizzerias will deliver 2 larges pizzas at 2am in the morning, even on a Saturday night. But Nizario's did. Not only that, but the pizza itself was fresh and tasty, made fresh, not like something under a heat lamp as one might expect at that hour. 

Here's to you Nizario, you made our night.
author: Nish N.

description:
I have to admit, I don't know much about the "best slice of pizza on earth". For those who have been following my reviews, my expertise is currently on Asian cuisine and sweets. Ironically, I grew up eating pizza pretty much almost every week if not more (hmm, more on that later). But, I came from a small town, too, so we had all the big-chain pizza places: Papa John's, Pizza Hut, Little Caesar's, etc.

There was one Italian place down the street in my hometown that made monstrous-sized pizza; I remember that pizza being delicious with warm freshly-pureed tomato for the sauce. That place was 5 stars definitely.

Aside from that background: Nizario's seems decent to me. Mellie P. and I got delivery from them last week and I didn't feel disappointed in the order. They actually delivered it relatively quickly, which is always a plus. We ordered half Hawaiian, half Pesto as our toppings; interesting combination, but it worked.

One thing about the pizza that made me feel surprised was the fact that it wasn't so greasy as most pizza joints are known for. The slices are large, and the crust was fresh. Unfortunately, by the time we got around to digging into the pizza (we waited a little bit because Mellie P. was preparing a salad for us), the pizza had gone cold. =\ 

So, in essence, I liked what I had, but I'll have to go back and try Nizario's again and get myself a piping-hot fresh slice.
author: Helene K.

description:
Admittedly I LOVE PIZZA!

The smell, the taste, so filling and delicious as it slides down my throat and dances in my stomach! 

This is a great pizza joint for all your late-night adventures. Fresh, hot and a good selection. If you are cruising around, I would not bother with delivery (esp not peak party nights) as it can take FOREVER to get ur pie. Instead, just pick it up and it will be right there! delicious!
author: Amy S.

description:
A good snack pizza. It's better than the cracker-hard pizzas in FiDi, but not as good as a NY slice or deep dish. The service is great, and they'll shout a big "thank you" when you leave.

$2.75 for a generous slice of pesto pizza. It was alright. Couldn't really taste any basil.

Being piss drunk also helps.
author: Keane L.

description:
I'm giving Nizario's 3 stars, only because of the delivery service. 

My roommate and I went to Outside Lands this last sunday, so on the way home we decided we wanted pizza, we looked up on yelp some good places that had late night delivery, but still had some good reviews as far as pizza went. Nizario's came up, and it just happened to be right in our hood. we ordered the California Special, which was amazing, the crust was perfect, not too thin but not super doughy. 

the nice man on the phone said it would be about 25 minutes. fine, great, that pretty good considering what was going on in the city (outside lands) ya know all that jazz. 

25 minutes later, nothing. 35 minutes later nothing. 45 MINUTES later, NOTHING. so finally i brake down and call them back,

me: dude, where is my pizza?!
guy: its coming, he should be right around the corner, it will be there any minute.
me: ok, great thanks.(click)

ONE HOUR later the pizza finally arrives. i could have baked the pizza faster myself if i knew it was gonna take this long. but really other than the crappy service the pizza was great, but next time i think i'll just actually walk in a get it myself than go through that delivery process again.
author: Vanessa A.

description:
Been a fan for a few years and I think it's time to yelp about it and make it official.

So what you're telling me is that I can do a Geary Bar crawl starting from Tradr Sam's on 25th and make my way down to Buckshot and then be able to stumble out the door after last call and get a slice of bomb pizza for $2.50?!

I'm sold.
author: An-Nhien L.

description:
Cheap, fast & easy, just like me last Friday night.  

Just kidding...but not really, cause I was 100% white trashing it up, that's how I roll on the weekends...

I definitely attended a "themed"(?) college party and Nizario's was the perfect pre-party alcohol sponge...Nizario's and cheese wiz, that was good too.  

There were 4 pregnant 21 year-olds boozing it up right next to me, the epitome of classy, right?  The best part was when a cop said to my "pregnant" friend: "You guys really need to calm the party down, your neighbors have little children, don't worry, you'll understand in few months." 

Back to the pizza...it was ok, pretty doughy and honestly nothing too exciting.  It did however, leave me and my wallet very satisfied.  Between 6 people we split an X-Large pizza and for about $3 a piece we all got plenty of food.  The pesto was yummy and so was the veggie.  

This pizza was a fine compliment to my alcohol, but on a less boozy night you can find me down the street at Giorgio's.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Have you been drinking late on Geary and need some food to soak up some of that alcohol? Nazario's is the late night grub food place for you. 

Entering Nazario's, I noticed a lot of drunk people inside. Some were belligerent and others were friendly. The staff was friendly and dealt with this people with huge smiles. 

They served slices of pizza or whole pizzas. The menu is concise and simple. The slices are New York Style, big slices, and the price is very economically friendly. I ordered the pesto pizza slice and the vegetarian pizza slice. I received my pizza within minutes and both slices were steamy hot.  The pizza was good and the food was very filling. 

Hot food and big portions after a night of drinking, perfect bliss!
author: Pete N.

description:
Nizario's Pizza is my signature slice when I come home to SF. I don't care if I've lived in NYC for over 8 years and had some of the best pizza here in NY, I still treat Nizario's like my long lost new style American girrrfriend. Oh sexy girrrrrrfriend!!! 

I still remember your phone number by heart, 752-7777. Wassup, can we kick it again? Let's catch up.

I miss you Greko, Italiano, and Nizario's Special. See y'all in September for a wedding I gots to go to. Take care of yourself and stay fresh, aaaight?
author: Geezy B.

description:
Nizario's, your super combo pizza is the best thing to happen to late night food since $1 for 2 tacos at Jack in the Box. I was tempted into coming here after a night of drinking by some friends. I usually like to refrain from eating late night foods since I regret eating so late at night when I wake up the next morning. 

As soon as we parked, we followed the smell of pizza and the long line of people to Nizario's. They didn't have many choices left to pick from since it was 2AM and they were about to close, but we took whatever was fresh out of the oven at the time. I'm glad we did! The super combo was delicious! It hit the spot. The pizza was a bit crispy which was perfect. It was just enough crispiness to hold up the pizza, but not crispy to the point where it was dry. It was loaded with toppings and plenty of cheese. I will for sure be back!
author: cindy w.

description: Nizario's is really good, but the last time I came here I was hella drunk and put hella salt on my pizza thinking it was oregano.  Put some labels on your shakers MAN!!  My slice ended up being inedible.  Mostly my fault for that, but Nizario's gets some of the blame.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Until recently, Nizario's Pizza has been a major staple of my San Francisco diet. I live only a block away, and just couldn't resist their kickass sourdough crust. Like Starla D said, it's a wonderful place to soak up the late-night drunk at reasonable prices...they are open til 3am.

Although a bit embarassed, this place is like the "Cheers" of pizza to me. The counter person & pizza cook both recognize me when I walk in, they've seen me at both my best & worst. It has even got the point where they shout my order to me while I stand in line behind other customers (yes, I feel like a fatmaster when they do that).

If you want the best of this place, order the "Tijuana Special". It isn't on the menu, but the mexican dude who cooks up your pie will know exactly what it is. 

What is it, YOU ask? It's damn good--Peperoni, Pineapple & Jalapeno. I have been lobbying for them to put in on the menu, but I want the name changed to "the Mex-offender". 

Nizario's can also be vegan friendly, you just have to ask.

Nizario's Pizza loses a point for a couple of things--they don't have a buy 10 slices, get 1 free card & the delivery driver dude hates life (of course, i probably would too if I was him).
author: matt m.

description:
...............delivers to Trad'r Sams!

If you want it to taste good by the time it gets there order a scorpion bowl while you wait.
author: Drue C.

description:
I had the Castro special, which was yummy.  The crust is crispy, the slice is hot, the pesto, chicken, spinach, and feta were just great.

I would give this place five stars, but this dude used his bare hands to pick up a slice from the pepperoni pie....

it's all good guys, coz Adam M. ate that slice.  Shhh... don't tell him.
author: Grace M.

description: I had a nizario's special or something after a wild night at Irelands32 and Buckshot. Nothing to end a night like a big fat slice of pizza. The guys were friendly and the slice was reasonably priced. What more can I ask for?
author: Joey W.

description: Can I give it 6 stars? If I could, I would, that's how much I love this place. I've this place since the 90's. First time I was in a Drunken stupor, stumbled in from Pat O'Shea' s at 2am and ordered a slice of Greko. I fell in love right then and there. All their slices, and whole pizzas are incredibly delicious! My kids get excited whenever I mention Nizario' s pizza!! My only complaint is that they open late in the afternoon. But pizza is always better late at night, right?
author: Robin S.

description:
It took me a while to figure out 
why the 'Combo' only had pep
peroni and cheese.  Just until
the 3rd time there I finally read
their menu on the wall.  So the
Super Combo was the one that
I've always wanted.  It is a small
place with about 4 tables.  The
pizza here is really good for some
reason.  The Super Combo is the
best.  They serve it fresh because
everyone orders this - so they 
keep making them bad boys. They
have about 15 people working at
the same time for fast service.  
They also have an old school Tv 
like arbys but in this case, they 
sport the news channel.  That's
good too.  damn I'm hungry.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
Dear Yelp,

I stand by my claim that Nizario's is the best pizza in the city.  Of course, just like with any place, you've got to know what to order.

If you go in for a slice or two, only get something that has just come out of the oven.  If nothing is fresh, wait for the next pizza to come out.  Sure, you might have to slightly adjust your eating preferences, maybe even break vegetarian edge, but it's well worth it.  The only kind I'll turn down is Hawaiian.  Pineapple has no place on pizza.  What next?  Bananas?  That wouldn't taste good either.  Hawaiians are bizarre. 

If you order for delivery, no matter how many people there are, always get an extra large.  For some reason, it tastes way better.  Besides, what you don't eat you can give to a homeless person.  Everybody wins.

Follow these simple guidelines and you won't be disappointed.  I'm not your dad though, so I can't tell you what to do.  But don't turn around and give the place a bad review because "the crust feels tough."  What the heck do you expect pizza that's been through the oven twice to taste like?

I give Nizario's Pizza a fantastic score of 5 out of 5 stars.

Love,
James
author: Cheryll M.

description:
YUmm!  This pizza always comes delivered fresh, hot, and cheesy... the slices are nice and big, with a thick crust.  The choices are nothing fancy, it's just good, simple pizza.  Every delivery I've gotten has arrived pretty quickly; plus, the delivery guys are always friendly.

It's a good place to go get a slice if you're ridiculously drunk and hungry, like the night I met my boyfriend :)  That's why Nizario's has a special place in my heart!
author: Laura W.

description: This is easily one of the best pizza places in San Francisco. The service is quick and the pizza is a good size. The pesto pizza here is my favorite. I like that they have garlic powder and oregano at the place to add on to the pizza. These guys work hard, tip them a buck or two, especially if you buy a whole pie.
author: Danny P.

description:
I've never actually been inside Nizario's but we've gotten it delivered twice recently. I have this sneaking suspicion that they secretly pull frozen store bought pizza out of the freezer and slip it into the oven when no one is looking. The cheese is about as good as little caesars (maybe not that good) and the pepperoni are these tiny little concaved puck things that are from every crappy frozen pizza that was put in front of me as a kid. I'd rather not eat here again but the GF likes it and its close. Apparently north beach doesn't deliver to inner Richmond. :(  

I was pretty drunk that last time I ate it too.....wasn't enough to add another star.
author: Chris D.

description:
Its 2:35AM on a Saturday morning.
You saw some drunk jock punch out 3 car windows.
You just left N.Beach and told the cabbie "Straight to O'Sheas" (Closed)
No drinks served.
Hit up NIzarios, and break your way through the crowd.
Get a mushroom or pesto slice.  Not a good full pizza, but an amazing slice.  It's all about the "slice" at this joint.

Grub that ish up and get another one to go for when you wake up hung over as ish.
Mmmmm...toss it in the oven and let the cheese melt perfectly,.

So I rolled in that place and checked this bitch trying to break me for the peppers.  (every condiment is shared).  Her height, 5ft on a hot day.  She called her hoe azz cousins to check me back.  Too bad, I checked  them harder and they couldn't handle it.  Granted, I'm 5'9", so them bitchez in for an azz whippen.  My brother-in-law swept them bitchez out the door it one swift hip check and I boxed them all in the doorway.  5 on 1.  No joke, I left them bitchez broke and getting arrested by the cops.  The owners loved me, and the pizza crowd cheered me on.   We laughed at them through the windows of the back seat of SFPD.  Who they gonna believe?  Best recognize. I went home a few blocks away and slept in a warm bed.  Haha...bitchez.

NIZARIOS ROCKS!  BEST SLICE IN TOWN...ASK YO CABBIE.
author: Adrienne P.

description:
This place is clutch after a night of booze. It reminds me of that pizza place on 19th avenue. The slices range from 2-4 bucks depending on toppings. I decided to load up and get a $3.50 combo with pepperoni, salami and mushrooms. It doesn't look very organized but  they get their stuff done and done fast. Since there are so many people coming in, you always get a fresh slice no matter what it is, even the pesto variants.

The staff here have the patience of a saint. They deal with the most drunk and highest people at night. I would go insane trying to serve these people. Big props to them.
author: chris c.

description: Good pizza when you are drunk
author: AL S.

description: I have tried their pizza by the slice and as well as large pizzas. The slices are big and the Combo slice rocks! It's a decent pizza place in the city for takeout or for a late night slice. The people are nice and they try hard to keep the customers satisfied - even the drunk ones! It has only a few bar-style small tables, so it's not good for sitting in. But I am a regular here for takeouts and it's good. :)
author: Lazeeb C.

description:
After drunken revelry known as 1015 Folsom, we made our way to Nizario's for a couple slices of pizza.  From what I remember the pizza was delicious, it featured a nice crispy crust which I loved.  And Nizario had a variety of condiments which I believe included Frank's hot sauce.

A great place to stop by and grab a slice or two, I'd go back just to have the crispy crust pizza again.
author: Eric L.

description: The staff is nice and the pizza is amazing. The crowd in the restaurant can be obnoxious because it's right next to a bar but that's why man made delivery pizza.
author: Bethany S.

description:
I ordered delivery from Nizario's for the first time ever last night.  When the pizza finally got here, the guy rang the doorbell, which I had asked the order guy to tell him NOT to do--on two separate calls.  I was also a little perturbed that the price at the door was higher than what the guy on the phone had said.

The pizza itself looked amazing.  It was thick and puffy and exactly how you want a pizza to look.  But after I started eating it, I realized it totally faked me out.  The flavor and consistency were on the mediocre-to-bad scale.  Plus, the fluffiness of the crust was mostly air.  It wasn't bad, but it looked much better than it actually tasted.

I finished the remainder of the pizza today for breakfast and lunch, and it did taste mighty fine the second time around.  That's the true test of pizza, so I'm giving Nizario's the benefit of the doubt and bumping them up to three stars for now.
author: John S.

description:
I would give Nizario's a five but my only complaint is the lack of items on their menu. The only side offered is Garlic bread with Ranch.

The Pizza gets 5 stars.  It is the best pizza around these parts, Outer Richmond and Inner Sunset.  My first hundred experiences with Nizario's was when they were known as Senories @ the 19th Ave location. I frequented the Shannon Arms around the corner and would come in for my drunk slice @ 2AM... this happened every weekend for about 4 years.  They would even deliver to my house on Twin Peaks when it was out of the jurisdiction. 

Now I get delivery from the Geary location and the pizza is just as good as it was years ago, hasn't changed a bit. They have the best crust, I love their sauce and it is just really good pizza. You can stop by either location for a slice or two as well as delivery.
author: Frankie F.

description: Ordered some pizza one night after a friend recomended this place. Not sure what all the rage is about, unless your drunk this pizza is no better than a frozen Digiorno.
author: Sean C.

description: Just not very good pizza. Super dry and no toppings. Its ok when you've been drinking but there's better around the city.
author: Jaydee C.

description:
I just came from Nizario's. The guy took my $3 and then proceeded to stand there for 10 minutes while my 1-year old was screaming her head off. I figured they must be making a new pizza or something. 

Finally, my nerves were shot. I demanded a refund and he said he had never sold me a slice, but that the other man (believe me, there was no other man) must have done it. Five minutes and a bunch of shouting later, I had a slice, my daughter was thoroughly traumatized, and I was determined never to go back to one of my former regular dives. 

Up yours, Nizario.
author: Cate F.

description:
After reading reviews I was definitely having to try this place...

It's aight. 

Very Pizza Hut-esque, but then again, most of the positive reviews came from the late night, sometimes drunk, munchers. This pizza is great for a random night of pizza and friends, but I'm still on the hunt for the GREAT pizza in this neighborhood - preferably, the great NY hand tossed.... oh well. Nice delivery man, weird awkward person taking my order. All in all, A-ok.
author: Sam T.

description:
hmmmmm, Nizario's! I often like to stop by here on my way home from going out drinking on Clement Street...it's right on the way...and oh so tasty! Located right by my house....can't go wrong with that! I like that the crust comes nice and thick, standard, and the pizza is just greasy enough...

Lately, I've also been ordering delivery from Nizario's, and I've been extremely happy with the service...I guess maybe because I live so close, but they have never taken more than 30 minutes to get to my house, and that includes all sorts of different times of the day...

Also, the night I met my girlfriend, we went here all drunk and got some pizza slices...ahhh memories....

More ASCII art, cause this workday will not end!  (supposed to be a pizza slice!)

author: Matthew S.

description: I really enjoy the pizza from this place but till last night never ordered one to be delivered.  Since I had had them by the slice after drinking and the pizza is not bad nice crust that doesn't get soggy like most places in the city I decided why not try them for delivery.  I took 2 stars away because I was paying with my credit card and added a $1 for tip since it was under $20.  The guy said does this say $1?  "I said yeah for tip" then he took it and said just cross it off and write zero"  I said but I wanted to tip you a $1 and he replied it's not worth it for $1. I won't be ordering from here again I'm sorry I'm not going to tip more than $1 for a medium pizza and I also live a few blocks away.  If a  pizza place want to make more they should start charging for delivery his attitude ruined this place for me back to Irving pizza I guess at least they are friendly.
author: Nirea S.

description: 2 slices (pepperoni and pesto) for $6 (no tax is good). Not bad if you happen to be around the area. Not a knock out pizza, but if you're hungry, happen to be around the area, and need something to eat, this is the place.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Nizario's pizza is cheap, quick to pick up, the employees are friendly and it's open quite late. Just eat it already.
author: Em L.

description:
This place is good for one thing: filling your tummy with greasy food after a drunken night out. That's it.
If you're looking for a good place for pizza, you're not going to find it in the Inner Richmond!
author: Kate Y.

description:
So it was either Nizario's or Video Cafe. Maybe I would've been better off if I just had a slice of cardboard, but instead I decided on Nizario's. I had never been here before, but pizza sounded good to me. It was like 10 o'clock and I was kind of tired and a bit cranky so Nizario's it was. Oh did I mention sober? Yeah I was sober too. In fact I think I was too sober to enjoy the whole concept of this pizza place.

The concept: Late night pizza by the slice, great for soaking up some of that alcohol, super fast service because they re-heat the slice of pizza that was made around noon that day. 

So yeah, the place was cheap and fast. Cardboard! Yes, cardboard sounds about right.  Crossing this place off the face of the earth sounds good to me!

Oh yeah, did I mention that one of my traits is that at times I can be a bit too honest.
author: Cellina B.

description:
Here are some tips to ensure that you maximize your enjoyment of Nizario's.  It is a must read.  

Mr. Nizario is one of the most friendly people in the world!  I've been coming here for over a decade now...and it's a love hate relationship.  I love the pizza, but it makes it so hard to keep to my clean diet.  At night you'll find an overflow of people from the bar next door, but the line moves very quickly.

Tip #1  You must try the PESTO!! This is the place that introduced me to the green side.  At first I thought, "Green stuff on my pizza?  It's like that green ketchup gimmick they came out with a few years back.  No thanks!"  But pesto is simply a mixure of basil, pine nuts, parmesan cheese, and olive oil.  And it is DELICIOUS!

Tip #2  Also, I highly reccomend that you get the slices.  For some reason they taste infinitely better than getting a whole pie.  Some of it may be due to the fact that they are baked, and then heated again when you order.  It comes out to a crispy convection of perfection.  I also reccomend the Greco (feta cheese, GARLIC, and olives), but only if you carry a toothbrush on your persons.  

Tip #3  The former guy, Pablo, who used to make the pizzas has now gone on to culinary school.  Good for him!  He was the best at making your pizza.  Now it seems Mr. Nizario's sons and relatives have taken over the position.  The pizza is still good, but they tend to not heat it long enough so it comes out luke warm.  Not good!  Just make sure to ask them to heat it a bit longer, and it comes out perfect!
author: Joe O.

description:
Nice and simple.  And sometimes all you want is nice and simple. 

There are some great pizzerias around this part of town - Giorgio's, Orgasmica, Gaspare's, and even Round Table.  But every once in a while you just want a slice of something warm and gooey and saucy - fast!  Nizario's is where you can get that even well into the witching hours.

While Nizario's seems clean enough (at least on the surface) it by no means has any atmosphere.  This is a place to get your eats and go.  While you wait for your piece of pie you can be awe-inspired by the few vintage poster-size photos they have of San Francisco.  Be transported back in time to when the GG Bridge was literally hanging by threads (or cables if you must) or see the city build-out from 190-something to 1950-ish.  Pretty cool.

Apparently started by a trio of brothers in the 80's, Nizario's is good for a quick slice - plain ol' cheese is recommended but if you order otherwise make sure they heat it up good so it tastes fresh as can be!  On take-out they include red chili flakes without even being asked.  Cool.
author: Rashmi N.

description:
You're drunk.

Its 1:30am.

You're hungry.

get your ass to Nizario's for a nice warm slice that will taste so good in your drunken haze. 

p.s. I've never actually had a slice here when I wasn't drunk so that rating might be a bit misleading.
author: Patrick B.

description:
We stopped at Nizario's after leaving The Saloon. The pizza was ok. The service was sorta ok. They appeared to have forgotten about my second slice. But they were open and it was nearly midnight. 

I'll go back for a nearly midnight slice of pizza.
author: Kevo M.

description:
I guess it all depends on what your idea of "good pizza" is.

If pizza available at 1:30 in the morning is good, Nizario's is good pizza.
If pizza that costs about $3 a pop is good, Nizario's is good pizza.
If pizza that fills your stomach after a night out drinking is good, Nizario's is good pizza.

The three of those work for me so Nizario's is good pizza.
author: kate r.

description: The pizza is very good- fresh and never greasy. Also the service has been nothing less than friendly. Out of all pizza spots in the area this is the one that I always go back to.
author: Sunni B.

description:
Picked up 2 slices to go on Sunday- got home, opened the box and saw ONE OF THE SLICES THEY SOLD ME ALREADY HAD A BITE TAKEN OUT OF IT. 

I've put up w/ the drunken 20-year-old tools screaming inside Nizario's and puking all over the floor...  I've put up with them having every conceivable combo slice ready to go, but no plain cheese... but I simply cannot put up with Nizario's SERVING FOOD THAT HAS ALREADY BEEN EATEN. 

So, if you enjoy food that someone else has already enjoyed before you, by all means go to the toilet known as Nizario's- or save yourself the $3 and dig a pre-eaten slice out of a filthy garbage can, because I'm sure that's what Nizario's sold me this weekend.
author: Steve M.

description:
Don't know where to go after a night of drunken debauchery and tearin' up the dance floor? The is THE spot to be if you want the best pizza in SF. It's good. Like...oh-em-gee-drop-your-panties-and-twirl-them-around-your-head good.

Pesto pizza & garlic cheese bread @ 2AM is one of the greatest feelings in the world. The slices are deliciously huge and greasy and even though I know they'll send me to the toilet the rest of the night due to my intolerance for dairy products, I'll gobble down 2 slices without any hesitation. "Pain is weakness leaving the body..."

If I didn't live so far from Nizario's, I'd make a trip out here every single week for late night grub. Heck, now that I think of it, the 45 minute drive might be worth it afterall.
author: Michelle W.

description: They are open late, their pizza is delish and they do delivery. What more could you want? Highly recommend the tijuana special!
author: Meenaxi P.

description:
I've tried several pizza places in the Richmond. Then I tried Nizarios' "San Francisco Special", and I've never ordered anything else anywhere else since then. That pizza is simply amazing. If you like a thin crust and don't like meat on your pizza then you definitely won't enjoy it, otherwise you should try it at least once!

It's not very cheap but it's not terribly expensive either.

They do take a long time to deliver though: they usually say "30 minutes" or "45 minutes" on the phone, but it's pretty much always around an hour so be prepared to wait (I live fifteen blocks away).
author: Michel D.

description:
Nizario's is so good that I nearly kicked my lame friend (Nate S.) in the nuts for stealing half of my slice before I was able to savor it myself. In fact, I had to buy another piece to share with my friend to curb the pending hunger after I was left with only 1/2 a piece of pizza because my lame friend apparently couldn't wait for his 1/2 cheese, 1/2 cheese- less pizza to get out of the oven. Whatevs.

Regardless of my company, this place is great because they're open late into the night. Until 2 am to be exact. Their pizza is phenomenal; nice and greasy and filling and just really damn good. I'd recommend the pesto slice...quite delectable. The staff were very accommodating and friendly as we have a lactose-intolerant friend (LT) whose stomach simply can't handle the cheese. So, they made her a pizza with no cheese! How nice. 

Verdict: highly recommended. Can't wait to be drunk in the Inner Richmond again so I may enjoy another piece of Nizario's!
author: Kristin R.

description:
One of the best pizza-by-the-slice places in the city.  The combo pizza is the shit.

One of the best experiences of my life.  Sitting in Nizario's at about midnight after just coming from seeing Iron Man (rock!) and Leno was on the little tv in there.  Have you seen the dog popping balloons?

http://youtube.com/watch?v=6jff2-skikU

This came on and eveyone in the place stopped and watched.  Watch the timer.  When the little dog popped that last balloon there were about 4-5 people in Nizario's just cheering...including the pizza dudes.

Only reason they don't get 5 stars is because I personally like thin NY style pizza.  Nizario's has a bit of raise to it.  Not that it makes it bad, it's pizza forchristssakes!
author: Josh L.

description:
I love this pizza. The Richmond delivery service is speedy and terrific and FREE.  In my opinion, it's way better than Orgasmica, which takes foreverrr. 

We always get the Italiano special with artichoke hearts, tomatoes, bell peppers and mushrooms with extra sauce. And the delivery guy is always friendly, despite having to hoof it up our three flights of stairs. 

I do have to say that I've never actually been INSIDE this establishment, but for all delivery purposes -- it's fab.
author: Sapana S.

description: To put it simply, it's kinda crappy.  The pizza was passable, but when your hungry it's good enough.  Top it off, no napkins and a min $7 charge if u use a debit card?  Really?  Get real.
author: Eddie B.

description:
This place is a great late night slice of pizza. Better than when we ordered one the last time.  Ordered the slice with olives, feta and garlic and thought it was good.

BUT the pizza did seem dry and probably sat out for awhile.
I can't say it was horrible, but i have definitely tasted a better slice even if it was 12:30am on a Thursday night.

For the price, who really cares anyway....

BUT i have been back in recent times and when that pizza is served fresh it is infinitely better!!!
author: Susanna B.

description:
I had heard this place was good by the slice, so I ordered delivery on a lazy Sunday afternoon. I ended up very disappointed. The pizza was bland, which is amazing considering I ordered pepperoni and jalpenos. Not enough cheese for my taste, and the sauce was nothing special. 

But what really bothered me was the delivery guy. My total came out to $17, so I gave him a $20. He took my money, said thanks and walked quickly down the stairs. No offer of change, nothing. I was caught off gaurd and just stood there holding what I would soon find to be a shitty pizza. It's not like I was going to stiff him when it came to a tip, but I would have liked the option.
author: Nicole T.

description:
Nizario's is a simple, yet solid pizza joint. I'll start with their pizza quality... The pizza here is tasty. It's not the best in the city (for sure) but again, it's tasty. As a pizza connoisseur, Nizario's Pizza doesn't really match up against places such as Patxis or Little Star. However, as a "pizza by the slice" joint this place has my respect. The grease content on the slices is very minimal. The only thing I hate more than grease dripping on my clothes is grease grease dripping all over my face. I'm sure many of you pizza lovers out there have had issues with a grease-overload on your damn pizza. I automatically take a star away if I have to do that nasty-ass dabbing thing with the napkin. I really start to reflect on my life and all the bad decisions I've made whenever I have a handful of greasy napkins. You don't have to do this at Nizario's. This place DOES reheat their pizza. As far as that is concerned, I'm alright with it. When it comes to "pizza by the slice" places, I actually think baking the pizza a second time makes the slice taste nice and crispy. Pepperoni and cheese with a little crispiness added to it actually tastes pretty damn good.

Now the customer service. The workers here have this attitude like, "yeah, I work at a pizza place". They are kind enough, but you are not going to really be blown away by these guys. They are there to pretty much just give you pizza that taste good. That's it. I could understand that. 

In conclusion, if you just finished getting wasted at the bars and are ready to get your grub on then come to Nizario's. They are open until 2am but most importantly they've got good pizza!
author: Greg S.

description:
They deliver late at night, even on Sunday nights, which is rare. They called twice to check before delivering, and the driver seemed to have a hard time finding my place, which is weird since it's (a) basically just down the street from them, and (b) on a major intersection.

My small Nizario's house special was tasty. My first thought was that the eight kinda tiny slices looked cute. It's not my favorite pizza, but it's a surprisingly good late night option.
author: Timothy O.

description:
In the interest of honesty, I must disclose that I've never had a slice of Nizario's pizza in an uninebriated state. But while it's true that food standards go down after a few pints, it's not like they go away, and Nizario's is the slice of choice when medium-crust by-the-slice pizza is the order of business. 

Tasty sauce, decent quality cheese, several vegetarian options and nice people working there. Years ago, my friend's paycheck fell out of his pocket at Nizario's -- the employees tracked him down and called him about it. Good pizza, nice people, open late, five stars.
author: Trisha W.

description:
I often stop here late at night, heading out toward the "Outer Richmond." It is very helpful that they are open late. So, I am always guaranteed a great late-night snack, a slice of excellent pizza. Yummy!

I also get the sense that they truly appreciate my business, and I like being TREATED LIKE A CUSTOMER, not a "number."

Highly recommended!!!
author: John H.

description:
Hot and Fast. This is GOOD Pizza. I ordered the Nizario's Special with a thin crust. It was here in 15 minutes. The delivery guy gets extra props for using the door bell and coming upstairs, That's better than 90% of the other delivery guys that come to my place. About the pizza. It was really good I liked the sauce and my only comment was that I wished that the thin crust was a bit crisper. 

I'll be ordering again!
author: Alex T.

description:
