Pizza these days are a treat for me.  Being Lactose, I always pay for it a few hours later.  However, it is well worth it for the Super Combo or as my friend calls it, the San Francisco...  For some reason, one day he walked in drunk, called it the San Francisco, and that's how he orders the super combo.  

They stay open late and are always in a good mood!  If paying with a credit card, keep in mind you have to order at least 2 slices to use your card.  That bugged me at first, but I got over it once I tasted their pizza.

If only they served a lactose free pizza...

Anyways, good place to go late night or if you just need a good slice of pie.
author: Victor n.

description: SUUUPER  COMBO!!  Combo.. yummm!  The owner and employees are  nice here at Nizario's.  There is an assortment of toppings, and they accept credit card (which was the appealing since cash only next door at the bar).  I savored each bite of my slice.  Locals and those that are drunk obviously come here.  My rating is pretty accurate b/c we ate BEFORE drinking lol.  The pizza is not overly greasy, and they are not sheisty on toppings.  Great, quick snack or dinner.
author: Steph W.

description:
This is my favorite pizza place in my neighborhood. Its open late, its great for takeout, and its probably one of the best places to get fresh pizza that hasn't been sitting around. Its next to a bar so its sometimes crowded on friday and saturday nights. But the fact that its open until 2a.m. is definitely a plus. The only flaw I have had was one time. I wanted a whole mixed pizza and a pizza came out of the oven and I ask if I could buy it and they charged me per slice so the pizza was $28 dollars. I was with my girlfriend, we were already late to a party and she didn't want to wait so I had to buy it. Its so good that I still go back even though this happened. The pizza speaks for itself.


Pros: Freshly baked, quick service, tasty
Cons: Can't mix and match and have to pay per slice, No Combos, and discounts if you buy multiple slices
author: David L.

description:
My room mate and I eat here so frequently that I think we should be given 51% ownership. Ya hear that Mr. Nizario?? I'm the one who paid for your utilities in '06! 

Open till 2 and friendly service. Pizza slices are sorta thick crust with tons of toppings. 

If you get change back, probability is pretty high that it came from my wallet.
author: Michael N.

description: I am not a HUGE pizza fan, but this place rocks my socks off!  Decent wings with good ranch!.  I will skip their salads...and they deliver and they accept credit cards too..awesomeness..:)
author: Ami J.

description: Yummiest, quickest pizza for any drunken night. Or, for any sober night for that matter. You line-up and get a slice, then you're out. They also deliver, too, and have a website, so it's super convenient. The crust is nice and thick, and the pizza is never too oily.
author: Monica M.

description:
Good for a late night slice.

There are always the bar folk around waiting, if you're lucky not smoking.

Good greasy slice of pizza, nothing amazing and if there are people occupying the few seats inside, you're going to have to stick it outside in the cold.

Simple.
author: Angel L.

description:
Pretty darn good, I'd have to say. Definitely worthy of 3.5-4 stars.

My boyfriend and I ordered a large half-cheese, half-San Francisco (Pepperoni, Canadian Bacon, Black Olives, Feta Cheese, and Sausage), as well as garlic bread & a couple of canned sodas. Total was $26 -- not too bad. 

The delivery seemed to take forever. I called our order in at 5:20 and as I was bemoaning my hunger an hour later, we finally heard a knock on the door. Really, an hour delivery, especially during dinner hours on a chilly day, is nothing to complain about. In the suburbs, that's generally the norm. 

As soon as we started nomming the pizza, I realized that all the reviews I read were right - this would be the perfect drunk pizza. It's a lot like Costco pizza (which I am a big fan of). It's nothing gourmet, but it's definitely yummy and I'm not going to lie - after one slice, my tiny tummy was kind of packed. (But you better believe I'll continue to eat it throughout the night & for breakfast too!)

The garlic bread is just ok. It's delicious, but nothing special - basically it's toast with butter & some garlic on it. For $3.20, I wouldn't recommend it if you're super budget conscientious, but if you need that "something extra" with your meal, go for it.

As for my boyfriend, who ordered the "San Francisco" half, he said, "It was good. It wasn't particularly amazing, but it was very satisfying. I'd definitely try something else (from them). The garlic bread is good."
author: Christine K.

description:
It'll take you a while to get there (middle-city dwellers should perhaps head to the just-as-good Castro location instead), but think of how great it'll be to eat a damn good slice of pizza.

I've never been very into pizza-by-the-slice, but this place would have me coming back day after day if it was closer. The moral of the story is that if you like pizza by the slice, especially after that hours-long bar outing, you will like Nizario's.
author: Tara R.

description:
I like Nizario's. I really do. But, I think it operates in the zone of totally adequate pizza. Good enough to draw in the late night bar crowds for cheap slices but not really outstanding.

I used to get their delivery quite often but not recently. It was a delivery experience that kind of killed it for me. The pizza was fine but we got salad (that was not totally cheap) to supplement and all it had was a iceberg lettuce and a TON of olives. So many olives that we could have recanned them and stocked our local grocery for a good week. Since then I've stuck to slices when I am nearby.
author: Peter F.

description:
This place has never disappointed after (or before if I'm using my brain cells that night) a night of drinking and pool at Ireland's 32.  Right down the street you will find some of the best pizza slices in the city.

I don't know if anyone agrees with me, but the dough makes the pizza pie.  This place has some great tasting dough.  Maybe it's my drunken palate, but I would never miss an opportunity to stop at this place.

Plus, the guys who work there are always nice!  Thanks Nizario's!
author: Chris M.

description:
There was a point in my life where I believed in time travel.  I thought that with the power of my mind, I could bend the space time continuum and go from A to B in an impossible small amount of time.  At this point in history, I believe CD's were only just invented, DVDs did not exist and Britney Spears was still working for the mouse.  

When I order pizza from Nizario's, I experience real, live, honest to girl scouts time travel.  Let us examine the timeline: 
9:03pm I call and am put on hold.  Twice.  They were really busy it sounded.  In order to not get some pre-fabricated pizza, I order something unique.  I get 1/2 pepperoni, 1/2 mushroom, 100% delicious.  
9:07pm I finally get to order.  
9:25pm i get a phone call from the frazzled sounding delivery guy saying that he had a lot of deliveries right after me so if I could please come downstairs and meet him at the gate/door/front of the building.  
9:27pm I get a fresh hot just-for-me pizza.  

What the--it takes me about 20 mins to drive from where the pizza place is located to where I live.  How did they do it AND have time to bake the pizza?  I will never know.  It's one of those magic things, like flushing the toilet, where running water comes from, Santa Claws, and Easter Peeps.  

The pizza itself was delicious.  The large 1 topping (or was it considered 2?) cost $16.10.  And it was delivered.  The cheese was just the right consistency, had just the right melting temporature.  Something that one reviewer said which struck me as ODD but I confirm is completely true: it's not as greasy as other pizza places and i don't know how they do it.  Seriously.  It's like everything good about delivery pizza without any of the drawbacks.  

I like this place.  I like it alot.  Do you think my BF will like it too?  Remember, he makes a fussy 6 year old look like an easy going laid back cat.
author: Christina C.

description:
You can't find pizza by the slice better than this place. Not too thick, not too thin and the slice is crunchy; not floppy or greasy. Back in the day (mid-late 80's) Blondie's Pizza by the cable car stop on Powell was the s#$! but it's now crap.

A definite favorite.
author: David D.

description:
Mmm... I love pizza. Hot pizza. Cold pizza. Thick pizza. Thin pizza. Greasy pizza. "Healthy" pizza. Loaded pizza. Plain pizza. And thankfully, this place lands roughly in the middle of all of these contrasts, perhaps leaning ever-so-slightly more in the direction of hot, greasy, and loaded.

Awesome pizza by the slice and quick delivery.
author: Anna S.

description:
Sometimes you just can't motivate to venture out into the cold dampness that is nighttime in San Francisco.  So you order Pizza.

In my ongoing SF pizza-quest, I decided to try Nizario's based on the positive reviews.  After waiting about 1 hour 15 minutes for my pie to arrive, I found Nizario's sorely lacking.  Their dough is the Achilles heel.  And that, my fellow pizza lovers, is the heart and soul of a pizza.  This dough is as vanilla and forgettable as it gets.  On the bright side, Nizario's offers some interesting toppings but I can't see how this pie could ever rate higher than 3 stars.  

Regrettably, there seem to be no great delivery options in this city.  The best pizza requires braving the fog and wind.  But when I can't do that and I'm ready to settle for less, Nizario's will still be low on my list.
author: Eli B.

description:
Best damn drunk-ass pizza place for drunk-ass people who are drunk at one in the drunk AM, or night PM, all drunk and shit when your DRUNK, an' talkin' smack about Luther Vandross lyrics, thinking of drunk singing Karaoke of Leonard Nimoy songs, and whether Newton ever shoved the apple up his gravity testing ass drunk like pizza like...and all .... BURP slice..best damn....and you've gotta purdy mouth and BURP we're like drunk, like run on sentence drunk good pizza...burp again for the last time before passing out pizza drunk.

Really though, if you happen to be drunk, anywhere near Geary Blvd, late at night, and craving pizza, this place seems to tolerate just about anyone!!

4 duckets for late nights at Nizario's!
author: Johnny C.

description:
Yummy --- Nizario's you saved me from dying of hunger so many times :-) That's where I stop if I'm close to Richmond District after many hours of partying! 

I love your pizza...whatever I have there (usually involves pepperoni) it's very good. I'll try you next for delivery :-)
author: Katja S.

description:
This is THE perfect after-hours spot for a quick slice.  After a night of partying, any mention of Nizario's is an instant pick-me-up!  The pizza is GREAT and the guys there are pretty cool, and I've observed them serving pizza past closing time!  ( This location is better than the one near Castro IMHO).
Keep in mind, it's not a sit-down, bring your date, gourmet pizza place -it's strictly for those done partying for the night.  You stand around with everyone else, laugh and listen about everyone's night, and just enjoy your pizza.  YUMMY!
author: Francine S.

description:
Hubby and I were watching some show with P. Diddy and he's eating a huge slice of pizza while talking about how he's blown his diet. That gave me an idea- I'll blow my diet by eating pizza!!

Lucky for me, Nizarios is cheap, delicious, and delivers FAST! Pretty much the perfect combination for diet destruction. Get the Nizarios Special. It's delicious! The staff is super friendly as well. They destroy your diet with a smile.
author: Kayla N.

description: A slice of Nizario's Greko pizza at 1:00am! Is there anything better? Not really! There is a reason why this Nizario's is ranked as the best in San Francisco- its located right next to a bar! And everything taste better when you're slightly buzzed :P But that is besides the point, my slice of Greko pizza was honestly one of the best I have ever had. Much better than I expected!
author: David D.

description: O emm gee!  This pizza is one of the BEST I've had in my lifetime :)  Night after the club... The ULTIMATE!  Lol
author: Yisel F.

description:
On our first attempt here, the place was not open yet....they open at 3pm. 

Second attempt on the following day, we were able to grab two combos by the slice...and a seat, granted it was still early in the evening.  I'm a big fan of the crispy and crunchy crust, and my slice definitely lived up to that.
author: Lisa C.

description:
You would think that any food consumed during the onset of the medical condition known as "Munchies" and after having had a couple of drinks would be near ambrosia.  The two stars are for the pizza, which was kind of crappy.  Tasted like something that comes from a safeway freezer by way of your oven.  The crust SUCKS.  I think it is pre-made, in China.
If you are drinking in San Francisco and/or get the munchies late at night, you are screwed and forced to do with one of the handful of places open past 10 pm for a bite!  I have to give them props for being open late and for efficiency.  But come on people, make a good crust.
I would not go back there again while sober.
author: Nilu r.

description:
I don't understand all of the stars - the pizza here tastes like Digiorno's Pizza - which claims they taste exactly like delivery. I guess Nizario's is the baseline for that taste test.

The crust was fluffy, but not really in a good way. And all the veggies were diced really really small. I want to be able to taste the veggies individually, not just a general "vegatable taste."

With all the little veggies on it, I could hardly taste any cheese. Isn't this thing suppose to be a pizza!?
author: Bonnie H.

description:
Cheap Slices, Great Family business!
the guys behind the counter are always friendly.
Pizza never fails, consistent and delicious!
Open late, usually get the Greek, Hawaiin, or Pesto.
From tip to crust... its good all the way through!
author: JASON L.

description: Been going to this spot for the last 15 years in the richmond on geary street and not much has changed in that time.  Can get by the slice or the whole pie.  The Pizza is always hot and tasty and the guys working there are always good for small talk while you wait for your Pizza.  Could not have made it through college without their Pizza.
author: Steve R.

description: I love to come here after a night of boozing it in The Castro! The food may not be as good as the scenery; the people watching is to die for! From transgenders dressed as Wonder Woman to homeless dudes wearing leather harnesses; I've seen it all here. 2am Pizza by the slice is a nice change from the usual California Burrito that I get when I'm at home in SD. Something tells me that I probably wouldn't eat here when I'm sober but the pizza is great when I've had a few and that's all that counts as far as Nizario's is concerned....
author: Andreena S.

description: For this review I had the pesto for $3.  Though still too thick, high marks for tasty pesto and crust done just right.  I like this location better than the 18th street version.
author: Jeff J.

description:
First time I tried it, it was late and I was starved.  I got a slice of pesto pizza and thought it was AMAZING.  Then I tried it again and wondered why I liked it so much the first time.  Then, I gave it one final try and realized that I have had frozen pizzas that tasted better - I think I was just really hungry the first time.  

So - the advice - if you are hungry and it's late - get a slice.  But, limit it to that.
author: Cara C.

description:
Probably the worst pizza in SF.  Its exists only because it is near bars and when you need something after a night of drinking, it is often the only place open.

To be fair, i would give Nizario's 1 1/2 if you are absolutely wasted and you need something in your stomach.

But sober, there is absolutely no reason to eat here. Which is the mistake I made tonight.  As a USF student, I ate here a couple of times after a night out.  Always bad, but at least if u went around last call, the pizza was fresh because of the customers leaving the bars.

Tonight, I walked into Nizario's before going to see a band at Ireland's 32.  I wanted to get something in my stomach before having a beer, so I went in and asked what was fresh.

The slimebag behind the counter said, in the most used car salesman manner, "everything is fresh out of the oven."  So i ordered a slice of the special.  I was handed a piece of what tasted like cold cardboard which had been sitting around all afternoon.  I took one bite and threw it away, thinking only of writing this review.

I can excuse poor quality food.  I can even live with pizza that tastes worse than the generic frozen pizza from safeway.  But don't frickin lie to me and tell me day old pizza is fresh.  

If they will lie about the freshness of the pizza, there is no reason to trust them about anything. What they call fresh means day old, so what they call sausage might just as well be rat.  

So if you like rat pizza (maybe), try Nizario's.
author: John H.

description: I stopped by my last trip to san fran and boy am I glad I stopped to get pizza here! we ordered the tijuana special which had pepperoni, jalepenos, and pineapple and 2 slices of the pesto spinach and feta cheese pizza. They were both amazing!! I really liked the pest pizza, kind of wished we order a large pizza of that instead of the tijuana. Not much to complain about here. The prices were fair and the services was fast even though there was only 1 person behind the counter. Im defin. going to get my pizza from here next time im in san fran!
author: Melissa C.

description: Good stuff...I always grab a slice when im in the City...keeps the belly full ..also, they use beef instead of pork...helps with the health issues.....
author: Arden C.

description: Do you love pesto pizza? Then come here whenever you want pesto pizza, by far the best pesto I've ever had in the city (there other stuff is pretty tasty as well). They put it on as a topping instead of a the main sauce and it's awesome. Ive also gotten delivery from here and it was pretty quick. Very reasonably priced as well. Also the staff is always super nice. This place Is totally my favorite pizza right now. Also prefect if your at buckshot and need a after drinking snack!
author: Dominique D.

description: Perfect place for post-alcohol binges! Nothing can compare to the Castro Special!
author: Bernardo M.

description:
A friend recommended this place who lives in the neigborhood.  My roommate and I were hungry, so we popped down here to grab a slice while our friend was getting some stuff together.

My roommate and I both ordered Nizario's special which wasn't too bad.  It satisfied our rumbling tummies.  

Small place with only 2 high tables and a counter along the wall with some chairs.  It's cool if you just want to grab a slice and eat really quick.

The guys who work there are nice and friendly.  Watching futbol!

Next time, I'd totally try pepperoni as that's my favorite and what I normally get at pizza places.

I'd come here again.
author: imelda j.

description:
I have a lot of love for Nizario's. Mainly because when you call them up at 2am (closing time) and beg them to deliver you a pizza, they just might do it. They said "All we have is 3 slices of x, 2 slices of x, 1 slice of x, etc." and we said "Put it all in a box" and they said "Sure, be right there".

And they were. And it was amazing. A bona fide smorgasbord of yummy pizza. And somehow everyone's favorite kind was included. The next time my lame butt actually stays up that late, I know who I'm calling for my late night cravings.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Let me start off by saying, Ive never had Nazario's while in a sober state of mind. That being said, this is the best pizza Ive ever had. In my life.

Boo to the minimum purchase on credit/debit. Because usually by 2am Ive spent all my cash. 

On things like, groceries and aiding the poor, I promise Mom.
author: Erin F.

description:
Nizario's, I love you so! Whether mid-day, or middle-of-the-night, you never fail to satisfy my pizza needs. You've got veggie options for me (more than one, even!!) and my boyfriend loves your pepperoni pizza, too. Bonus points for being easy to locate, and still open when I'm drunk, hungry, and unable to process any kind of information. Extra bonus points for being RIGHT in front of a 38 Geary stop, especially on the night when I went drinking with co-workers for the first time, stopped in for a slice before getting on the WRONG 38 bus, and then drunk-dialled my boyfriend (well, now he's my ex... but he was my boyfriend at the time) to profess, "I love you! ... I think."

... yep. Great night.
author: Elle Q.

description:
Nizario's, ahh many a drunken night has ended with me shoveling a slice or two of Nizzy's down my gullet.  Let's face it, the pizza is average.  But you're not coming here because you're a pizza snob, you're coming here because you're a drunken degenerate like me.  If you're looking for a specialty slice, I recommend the Greco.  It's the best of the bunch, but don't plan on kissing anyone that night since you will smell like 4 or 5 cloves of garlic.

Conveniently located next to the Buckshot, they have a very quick turnaround at even the busiest times, so the most you have to wait is maybe 5-10 minutes.  Even then you're probably drunk or herding drunk friends so it goes by a lot quicker.  Prices are cheap, it's about $3.75 for the most expensive slices and you get a good amount of food.  You also get what you pay for, if you've been drinking PBR or Tecate at the Buck all night you are going to be regretting it the next morning.
author: Jason R.

description:
A fast, cheap, and fulfilling late night craving hot spot! 

Pizza is pretty decent for a late night joint. A few choices to select from, and not too pricey...roughly $3-4 per slice. 

Each slice has been pretty fulfilling to me. I love adding the peppers and oregano to it. A great place to grab food to sober up with, or just for a late night snack. 

Service is friendly and fast. Not much to ordering pizza by the slice. 
The usual small dining area like any other by the slice pizza joint. Plus they have a small tv in the corner you can watch weird late night infomercials on! 

I tend to stop by here only late nights, and will continue to do so! :)
author: Catherine O.

description:
Walk in and order what's hot. 

It's tasty, greasy and delicious. Especially following a visit from The Bitter End or (dare you ended up there on a Thursday eve) The Abbey Tavern. 

Me likely the pesto variety the best. Because basil garlic breath is so hot right now.
author: Kelly R.

description:
When I use to live on 5th and Geary my boyfriend and I would often come here for a slice of cheese. I would really reccomend just ordering a slice because the few times we ordered an entire pie we waited soooooooooooooo long for it to be delivered that both times we actually fell asleep waiting for the pizza!

All the drunkies wonder here in the late hours looking for greasey food to sober up on.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Would be five stars, but their delivery service is terrible. (Pick it up! you'll save a half hour)

GARLIC CHICKEN PESTO PIZZA

enough said. it's awesome.
author: Dan N.

description:
I thought this place was called "Nohan's" Pizza.

"Romes...Across the street is Rohan's"
author: Romes K.

description: What's up with the 3PM-2AM hours? I was devastated, but then I came back during business hours, and man o man was I satisfied. Slice of combo for $3.50, can you beat that? If you can, show me! The crust on the pizza was good. Next time will try the pesto.
author: Can L.

description:
This place is definitely the best pizza in the area- hand down!  No frills, no bullshit, just good hearty toppings-a-plenty pizza.

My personal favorite is the Nizario Combo with Pineapple.  It's a heavy pizza but heavy as in how much it weighs because it's loaded with toppings.  As a matter of fact, all their pizzas are loaded with toppings.  Either you're waiting in line or ordering for pick up, they're super fast.  Like 15 mins for a pie from ordering on the phone and picking it up.

Delish!
author: Sally T.

description: Pretty decent pizza, especially the Tijuana. Unfortunately, the younger delivery guy with the beard is churlish, curt, rude, unpleasant, and mean. "Always the same here," was his response when my girlfriend apologized for a $1 tip last time he delivered. I'm sorry, I didn't realize we were obliged to heartily supplement your costs for driving four blocks to our house. Next time, it's the nice older delivery gentleman or no more orders!!
author: Peter M.

description:
it's 1am and you need something to soak the acohol. Nizario's to the rescue. 

the staff is surprisingly nice considering the hoards of belligerent patrons. the pizza is hot but not very cheesy. it's also conveniently located on Geary where all the cabs drive down. if it's late at night, look for the happy people spilling out the door and you'll find it. 

better here than the ghetto jack and the box down the street.
author: Rina C.

description:
I have a serious problem. It's not drinking, or drugs, or even fine prostitutes. It is greasy assed pizza from Nizario's. 

Sometimes I really need a fix. Like that one time I was in Tacoria Cancun after drinking and dancing at Beauty Bar. Yeah I could have gotten a burrito, but I had the most epic of cravings. One that could only be fixed with the taste of pesto garlic pizza from Nizario's. I spend a good 16 bucks on a cab ride to get a slice of pizza. That's how good it is.

I woke up the next morning with half a pie in a box next to my bed. I am such a fat shit.
author: F B.

description:
Wow - I'm not even drunk and I heart this place. 

Although, I am pretty damn hungry and tired, dare I say approaching "drunk-end-of the-night-hungry"? Been out backpacking around with Mom in the granite and I have to say I'm ready for a few slices of mushroom pizza washed down with a cold coke, a toke or two, my soft bed (hurray goodbye thermarest), a movie and a cuddle with the mow. 

Life is good.
author: Katie D.

description:
So when I was in college, I use to come here for 2 reasons... I was really piss drunk and wanted to eat some very delicious pizza OR because I was hungry and wanted to eat some good ass pizza. Either way, Nizaro's is a very inexpensive place to buy pizza with top of the line owners that are very personable and friendly. If you go there enough they hook you up with slices or discounts... that's how cool they were. If you are curious and want to check the place out, this is what I would order....

The f*cking pizza and shit.... what else is there.

So come by either drunk, high, sober, or naked and eat some tasty motherfonking pizza. And if you like it... write your own damn review on the place so they can get more props and sh*t.
author: Miguel B.

description: Pizza crust is a definite 'meh'. Will not order again.
author: jay C.

description: Delicious pizza!  It's not a very convenient location, but late at night, it might just be worth the extra taxi fare.
author: Wendy L.

description: They have weird hours, but it is a great place for a late night slice.  The hawaiian pizza was to die for.  Crispy crust and perfect amount of toppings.  Absolutely delightful, especially after a night of drinking.
author: Pia V.

description: I've been ordering from this place for about a few months atleast once or twice a month minimum. I usually give a tip of $2-$5 on a $21 delivery order, but one day i forgot the price of the same order i usually get since i was gaming and in a rush. So i got $21 dollars and the same guy who i tip all/majority of the time got pissed and was likes its 21!!!! and im like my bad and gave him $5 tip, and when i closed the door i can hear/see him crunching up the money in his fist. To me, this kinda pissed me off, since that is somewhat very rude and it can affect my next order with bad service. That was the last time i order from them which was first week of July.
author: Simon C.

description:
Nazarios is one of my favorite pizza places in the city.  It tastes good, has fast service and comes through after a long night of drinking.  Lines form out the door once last call hits and there are only a few small tables to sit at.

The best choices are the veggie or the pesto, but they are all good.  I usually ask what's fresh so that way you get your slice faster and you aren't eating a piece that got cooked 2 hours before.  

One star off for somewhat rude (but usually fast) service and for the fact that they have recently started closing there doors shortly after 2am.  They used to stay open until the last person went home.  Now they're like "you don't gotta go home, but you can't stay here."
author: Thor M.

description:
I absolutely love this place..beeen going here since i could remember.  

The owner even let me go behind the counter one time to make my own personal pizza! What a cool guy.

Love the mushroom pizza to death and the crust is amazing..so tasty and crunchy.
author: Brad N.

description: Just a regular slice of pizza. I wouldn't go back to pay $4 for it. It definitely got me full, but for 4 slices--$16? Kinda ridiculous. You could've at least told me with that price I can get a whole pizza, jerk.
author: Jenny Y.

description:
The taxi cab driver looks at me and says, "I know you..."

Turned out he was the nephew of the Nizario's owner and used to cut me pizza deals for my dorm. This was USF Lone Mountain dorm's staple food. They'd give us pizza for cost and we'd feed the building things like artichoke pizzas with feta cheese. Surprised he recognized me, especially since it's been 10 years. Try to stop by there for a quick bite every now and then. Always handome guys hanging out especially after a scrimmage at GG Park.
author: Tanya P.

description:
Great pizza, especially when you're toasted. I had bites of the pesto and pepperoni and it was YUM, especially since some pies had just come out of the oven so they were piping hot. Price was a bit expensive ($3/slice), but maybe you won't realize how much you're paying if you've had one too many.

The place is small...two tables and counter seating but most people eat their slice and then head on out so turnover time is fast. Even at 1:30 AM, the place had a line forming from the cashier to the door.
author: Janel Y.

description: I think Nizario's Pizza should be re-named Crack Pizza. It is so damn addicting! Who can resist huge $3 slices of delicious pizza right next to the Buckshot? Even if its not 1am and you're not drunk, this pizza is the s&*$#! The Greko and the Hawaiian are my favorites although anything you pick is sure to please. I do have 1 complaint though, I wish they would heat up the slices more, I always seem to get a lukewarm slice, and I know it would be so much better if it were piping hot. Maybe I'll just ask next time....
author: Stephanie W.

description: After a night at Buckshot I usually head on over to Nizario's for their pesto pizza! OMG, thee best pesto pizza ever.  I love how the pesto is put on top of the pizza opposed to being mixed in with the sause and cheese.  Simply delicious!  I can't help but tell the guys who make it how much I love this pizza.  For $3 bucks a slice they give you a lot.  Definitely give this place a try!
author: Rosa L.

description:
Nizario's is a saint.  Bless the man who opened his pizzeria to 2 am to help the lost souls, booted out of clubs and bars, a warm place by the hearth and a slice of pizza.  Every 21+ who has set foot in the Geary district has been to this place.  You do not even need to know the address...you will see a drunk mob flocking around it like giggling hyenas upon finding a carcass.  The rating I give it pertains to a drunken setting so please make a note of that and it is: 5 stars, 5 wifives and 5 wadDUUUPs.  Nothing beats a night out then opening your slutty slit eyes just wide enough to still remain in a REM state near that of sleep yet conscious enough to find the cheese and sprinkle it upon your pie.  Nothing beats the feeling of having that hot cheese burn your tongue to where you frantically dig in your pocket for loose change for a cola but only come up with lint and implore the cashier for a water cup.  Usually at night, they do not have much options.  Its either a. cheese  b.  peperoni  c.   combo  d.  gtfo

I would give this another star if I could as it was the first date/quarrel/debacle my then soon to be girlfriend and I had...aptly codenamed...the cheese dandruff/spilt water debacle.
author: Brian V.

description:
Nizario's Pizza is great. This place is fast delicious and pretty well priced. It's around a bunch of bars, which is good. It's walking distance from my house, which is so much better. Slice o' Hawaiian, slice o' cheese -- loaded with Parmesan and 2 doctor peppers and you're good to go kid. eat in the extremely small dining area or walk while you chomp.

GOLDEN, go forth and consume this place - It's worth every visit.
author: Tyler W.

description:
I love Nizario's, and Lou's right, before you even hand them your money, they're shoving a slice of pizza in your face.  It's great.  Their pizza is solid.  They have a good number of choices, but nothing too overwhelming.  Basic, cheap, and good pizza.

Eating inside is not the best, but it's the same as any pizza slice joint.

Also, I just always find the ruckus of 20 guys behind the counter amusing.  I always feel like there are 3 guys just standing around at the register --- also wondering..is this Nizario's related to the Nizario's in the Castro?!  I'm going to figure that out right now..
author: Liz C.

description:
UPDATE - It's confirmed, I was on a Tijuana high when I gave them 5 stars. I still really enjoy Nizario's, and they're consistently good, but I don't want to inflate my rating.

---

Nizario's is the issh.  My boyfriend and I have only ordered (at least a dozen times) the half vegge/half Tijuana Special, always for delivery.  But let me tell you!  It's always hot and delicious, always super fast, and always with courteous service.  It might be that because I'm coming down from a Tijuana Special high (cuz I just ordered one tonight,) that I give them 5 stars instead of 4... but a hot, scrumptious pizza with a crispy crust in only 20 minutes at 7:30pm is awesome!
author: Christina M.

description:
My go-to spot for when i dont want to cook dinner, which makes me want to cook dinner more.  dont get me wrong, i love nizario, but my heart and waistline would loath me if i eat here all the time :(  gooey gooey cheese

Great spot for a slice of pizza to sober up for heading home (prevents hangovers!) or bring a couple of pies to a party (always appreciated).  Service is really quick and the guys behind the counter is really nice.

Great place to grab a slice and go!
author: kate y.

description:
I feel like by now the "roof of mouth Nizario's blister" must have worked it's way into the official Inner Richmond lexicon.  

Cheap, hot, delicious pizza by the slice and open until 2.  What's not to love?
author: adam c.

description:
Were it not for Nizario's, I may have starved in college. And by starved, I mean not gained 20 pounds.

Decent and open late.
author: Megan W.

description:
Planned or unplanned, Nizario's always delivers.


 Ok, I'm not sure if they have delivery, but what I mean to say is that they will provide you with some of the most consistently great pizza whether it's a late night drunken stumble-in, or a ginormous order placed a week in advance.


 The unplanned scenario: You've had a load of pints, a few shots of Jameson, and maybe someone convinced you to participate in a Sambuca shooting race at one of the many bars in the Richmond. I'm not saying this happens often, but, you know, it could happen. It turns out your ego is bigger than your tolerance and you need some soakage. Pronto. Nizario's is there, offering up tasty slices of good pizza that are crusty enough to soak up the booze, but not greasy enough to make you paint the sidewalk.


 The planned scenario: You and 49 of your closest friends hire a bus to take you to see Journey and Def Leppard at the shoreline. You're all decked out in your best white trash rocker outfits, doing jello shots, taking swigs of Jack Daniel's, and the friend organizing the trip shows up with around 20 hot, fresh pies. All due to the diligent, fast work of the folks at Nizario's.


 Nizario, you rock my world, whoever you are.
author: Omid T.

description:
Surprisingly, it wasn't as bad as I was expecting.  It's a little dilapidated storefront in the inner Richmond.  I stopped in when passing by, simply because I was starving.

It's a california-ish style pizza, which I characterize by a crust that's much thicker than NY style (but not quite Sicilian).  I liked that the bottom was coated by cornmeal; it made the slice.  Sauce, cheese, and peperoni were fine but nothing to call mom about.

The pizza guy told me he just got a ticket for using his cell phone in the car.  He said that he was glad it was only $25, because in his Morrocan hometown it's an offense punishable by chemical castration.

Gawd I love America!
author: Rocco B.

description:
Like everybody else only had it while drunk.

I remember it looking crappy, probably the non selling goods from hours earlier, but when you are rocking beer goggles does it really matter?

The disgusting grease never tasted so good or at least I think I guess it was good? Its a no hassle place that you know will be there when you need it.

I shall stumble back again.
author: Cliff S.

description:
Open late night, they deliver late night ... I love their combo and Nizario's special.

Great for after a night of drinking on Geary and Clement.
author: Alex C.

description:
Great delivered pizza. With a creative stoner mind, you can have one helluva monster pizza delivered fresh to your house.

Great place to grab pizza by the slice if you've been going bar hopping on Geary St. I've had countless amounts of drunken nights where I'd order THREE SLICES. I'm a monster!
author: Andrew W.

description:
Large slices for about $4.  Try the California (also called the Castro)-- it's a break from the normal cheese or pepperoni.  

You might have to wait a little for your pizza, but it's worth it.  Conveniently close to Buckshot.  Great for late night!
author: Jason R.

description:
Awww yeah baby...

I stopped by Nizario's this weekend and some great great grrrrrreat! Pizza. Fluffy bread with a crispy crust. 

I order two pies Saturday night on cheese and one Chicken Pesto that was awesome with a capitol AWE.  I think Nizario is going to become my new Saturday stay in and chill pizza. I just have to make sure I have plenty y of Netflix to watch
author: Karim R.

description: I've ordered pizza here on more than one occasion (we'll leave it at that).  It is ALWAYS hot, tasty, on time and delivered with a smile (seriously, they are so friendly).  We always order half California Special (yum!) and half San Francisco special.  If you want to pay by credit - make sure you mention it on the phone.  I've ordered from several pizza places for delivery and this is my favorite so far.  Good pizza for a good price.
author: Natasha T.

description: Really good pizza and they sell by the slice.  Excellent quality of ingredients, excellent service and pizza I have never been unhappy with.  The best you will find late night also.
author: Sir Paul L.

description:
As a self-admitted pizza-holic, I've been known to grab a slice in all parts of town.  To me, Nizaro's is the best pizza in SF (Little Star & Gaspere's are fighting it out for the silver).  I've only been to the Richmond location (about 100 times over the years) and the guys in there are great.  
Ray is the man - he's super chill and always gives you your slice or pie with a smile.  There's also a shorter guy  with a mustache, wearing a hat who is always working his ass off on the pizza oven.  He has been there every single time I've ever stepped foot inside Nizario's (been going there at all times of day the past 5 years)!  He's quite possibly the most dedicated employee of any business establishment in the western hemisphere.
Do yourself a favor a stop in for a slice... And sign their petition to let the city allow them to stay open past 2am on the weekends.
author: Murray H.

description:
Pizza is delicious.  They are open late and you don't need to wait for your order.  They are extremely fast.  

Although I did just get out of a bar with friends so it might just be my drunkeness that made it taste so good.  But it sure is an excellent place to go to after a night out drinking.
author: Benjamin H.

description: I have been eating pizza from here for many years. Today I went and ordered a slice and it was much smaller than ever before. Could our slow economy make the pizza slices smaller and more expensive? Anyway,I think next time I will just order the whole pizza pie. I wont go in there for just a slice anymore as it does not seem worth it paying $3.50 for a small slice of pizza.
author: Sydney A.

description: One of my favorite places to get a slice of pizza.  For me, it's all about the crust, and Nizario's gets it right.  The thing I can't stand about most pizza-by-the-slice places is that their crust is limp and soggy, and the toppings end up falling off.  Nizario's crust has a crisp exterior with a light dusting of cornmeal on the bottom and a chewy interior.  Nothing fancy here, just solid fast food.
author: Anthony H.

description:
Mmmm...
Pizza delivery at one in the morning.
When I'm too drunk to cook.
And have a card- no cash.
With super friendly people even though it's so late.

But only decent.
Craving satisfactory, so five stars.
Hoorah.
author: Keegan Q.

description: I must say that the pizza is bomb... but 90% of the time that I order it, I am under the influence of fun things and it's usually after midnight. Regardless... it tastes delicious, they deliver at ungodly hours, and they're super nice!!
author: G S.

description: This used to be a taqueria years ago, so I was skeptical at this no-frills pizza place.  Surprisingly, the pizza was decent and the food was good.  It was perfect drunk food.  I'd come back!
author: Ankur P.

description: I gotta say whenever Im in the neighborhood or passing by. I don't go to Round Table, I go here to pick up some good pizza. Not only this area but also in the North beach location as well. Good pizza by the slice. Mainly because I can't stand really greasy pizzas.
author: Anthony P.

description:
This is the closest pizza place to me that had good reviews.  I ordered a small pizza with vegie ingredients and paid $16 total on Halloween night.  

I give them four stars for relatively quick delivery on Halloween night (which fell on Friday).  Didn't get to eat the pizza till an hour later when I finished handing out candies and it was very delish.  The crust was still soft enough to eat without heating it up.  The next day after microwaving the leftover pieces, the crust was not hard.  

I think I will make this my default pizza joint from now.
author: Mrs F.

description:
I just like this pizza and you should too.  I crave it everytime I go somewhere foreign without pizza...I usually have the driver stop on the way home from the airport when I return to SF.

Just try it!
author: Lulu B.

description:
To celebrate my birthday, a couple of my friends and I got dressed up, got our hair/make up did, rented a limo and went club hopping in downtown SF. We rode across the golden gate bridge, stolled along broadway, but before the night was over, we had to make a stop at the BEST pizza place in San Francisco, Nizario's!!

My personal fave: pesto, sausage, and mushrooms. (I usually tell them to leave out the tomato sauce)


Their pesto is the best-o!! No joke.
author: Melissa S.

description:
I love this place, they have kicken pizza.  It is like 2$ a slices and they are open till 2.  Pizza guys are always super nice and they have fast delivery.

Try the nizarios special and also the pesto.
author: Nicole F.

description:
People can argue that this pizza is only good when you are drunk, but that is not true. Nizario's is great for delivery. It is good cold the next morning. And especially by the slice!

Nizario's isn't just about the pizza but the memories. If you have been there, you know what I mean. What more can you ask from a hole in the wall pizzeria. 

Call me crazy, but when finding a new place in the back of my mind there was always the question.... how many blocks will I be from Nizario's. Seriously.
author: Lee M.

description:
Well it's been many many years since I've been to Nizario's. My cousins don't live too far from here so usually when i was over at their place and wanted pizza it was from Nizario's. So after a trip to the mall decided I was craving pizza, so I was debating between Nizario's and Extreme Pizza. Decided to bring back some childhood memories and ordered a Nizario's special to go. 

All I can say I was a happy camper and Nizario's satisfied my craving for the evening. The nice thing about Nizario's was that the crust wasn't soggy from grease you might find in other pizzas. The toppings were fresh and tasty. Definitely will be back when I'm hungry for some pizza.
author: Kevin L.

description:
This is one of the best late night after-bar/club spots(in Geary area)! The guys and I usually end up here for a slice after going to Fizzies. 

Get a slice, sit at the table near the window, and watch fellow drunk-in-publics flock by.
author: David D.

description:
Finding a decent pizza place that delivers in the Richmond was harder then expected. All the really good ones don't deliver and then there are the shitty ones (I'm talking to you Victorias).
Nizario's is pretty good. Nice assortment of toppings, good price.
However-
A little light on the sauce, and delivery time is usually longer then quoted (like 40 minutes becomes an hour)
Not a deal breaker.
author: Lauren T.

description: Ok at first I thought ya'll were cool, you know, like down? But tonight after a bottle of wine we really wanted some pizza. Yeah we knew that it wouldn't be Escape from New York or anything like that but we were willing to settle. Don't get me wrong, ya'll do ok at what you do but ya'll ain't all that. Tonight I called with such anticipation of some gooey cheese all in my mouth. But the guy on the phone said they don't come to my neighborhood. How come they came last time? Yeah we live in the hood but we ain't no thugs! Just some slightly tipsy peeps with a late night craving. So, I'm mad at you, Nizario's! I'm mad that you let me taste your mediocre somewhat goodness and took it away, lickety split. I'm hungry, man. WHY?!
author: Erica A.

description:
i stumbled into this place by the guidance of my buddies.  my vision didn't get pass about 2 feet.  

i walked out with an extra slice.  ready to go out again.

this place hits the spot when your not sober...

not sure what my review would look like if i was sober....

i will just stick to this...
author: bountypix c.

description: If you're a NY'er and miss good thin crust NY pizza, you can get it here. This is not a restaurant, it's a NY pizza joint, just a tiny lobby. It's mainly for takeout or delivery but when I need my fix for NY pizza, I get a slice of thin crust with cheese only (no toppings even- I want to taste NY) and I'm set. There is garlic powder on the counter- this is one of the tests to see if a place is really NY style- no garlic powder, don't bother looking for NY pizza there. The lobby is not pretty but the pizza passes muster for a NY'er. (Others raised on what I refer to as California cheese crust food may beg to differ, as they grew up with different tastes but hey, everyone is entitled to their brand of cheese food.)
author: Ira H.

description: delivers late, there's something to be said for that.  pizza is too thick and bready, hardly any sauce, and the toppings are of sub par quality.  probably better off just passing out.
author: howdy d.

description:
Anything less than 5-stars for this place and you've obviously not been drinking.

You must eat a slice AT Nizarios.  Don't screw around with ordering delivery and thinking it's the same thing.  It isn't.  Also, you don't get the pleasure of talking with the guys making your pie.  If you're lucky, you'll get to chat with Nizario himself.

Avoid the 2am slobbering drunks from USF & Clement.  Hit it around 1am and you'll be golden and not end up in a pizza brawl.

This pizza should be judged on its own merits.  It's not NY style.  It's not Chicago style.  It's Nizarios.  If I make it to heaven, there will be a Nizarios there.  I'm convinced of it.

BTW- I watched O.J. running from the cops on the T.V. at this joint.  Ah...memories.
author: Kash-money K.

description:
Nizario's is awesome. Maybe even 4.5 awesome. I can't quite go 5 stars, it's really not much too look at, but maybe that's part of it's charm? I love any pizza place that writes signs on paper plates.

Anyone, the pizza is really good, and I always want more than one slice because it is so delicious, but I am never quite hungry enough for two. 

If you go late, there's always something good to watch. Drunks are funny.
author: Kristen H.

description:
It was really  late. And this was open. 
 
The guys in there working were nice. 

Not the absolute BEST pizza I've had, but definitely not terrible.

The crust was thicker and breadier than the kinds I have been eating elsewhere. Not at all doughy. 

The sauce had a bit of zing to it and didn't just taste like tomatoes. I liked the blend of spices. 

I wasn't even hungry, but I ate the whole slice and thought it was good.

So. This is kind of a mediocre review. That's just how I feel about it. Mediocre and unimaginative.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Best pizza in the city without doubt.  The crust is what separates Nizario's from its competition.  It's fluffy but not too doughy.  This isn't thin crust pizza.

The pizza is greasy, but that is why its so good.  Best eaten at 1am after a good night of drinking.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Average pizza and slightly above avaerge prices!
great for late night munchies and the crowd can be interesting too.

Dig the shrooms and pesto slices...but 3.25 for a SF size slice?  A little steep no?

NY pizza lovers....followers of Lombardi's steer clear.
author: Spanky M.

description:
2:00am ... Best pizza after drinking all night.  Walk on over there from your Geary or Clement Street bars, order a slice and a soda or water to sober up.  Watch all of the other drunks show up and stand in line for their slices, then grab their cab.  Nothing fancy here.  Thick crust for absorbing the booze.  Nice, patient guys doing the money and pizza exchange.   They do a pesto WITH tomato sauce, which I find very strange.  I just stick with the pepperoni.

Ode to my friend, Jen, "Nizario's is the best pizza on earth!"
author: Lily C.

description: This place is great! Late night treat or just an awesome pizza. California special is my favorite. Leave a tip--even a small one--and you'll make these guys' day!
author: James W.

description: Ok for late night. The only thing is one or more of the guys on the line are kind of skeezy. Either way that doesn't matter. It's all about the pizza and they're open late. I will eat there if I'm at Irelands 32
author: Jay C.

description: Great for after stumbling out of Buckshot next door and when desirous of greasy and fast food. The line is literally out the door sometimes and it's got a good mixture of drunk as well as sober people. The pizza itself was just okay. The crust was kind of like cardboard and the toppings were just meh. I've had better.
author: Christina B.

description:
THIS is what I miss about living in the Richmond! Damn I miss Nizario's.  They have the BEST pizza when you are drunk.  I mean, we would actually leave a bar early so we could get to Nizario's before they closed.  (Note: they close at EXACTLY 2am these days, no negotiating - I think neighbors complained, so the cops make them do it!) You have no idea how many nights we jumped in a cab and told them to drive faster because we had to get to our destination before 2am.  This place was worth walking 10 blocks home afterwards (or paying $5 for a cab to drive us the extra 10 blocks home, haha).

On a more sober note, I did actually go in one afternoon and order a whole pizza to go (as opposed to the late-night slices). And let me tell you, it was still damn good!   I miss you Nizario's!
author: Katie J.

description:
This place RULES!
The guys are really nice and the pizza does a good job of soaking up the liquor that I purchased next door!
author: Mike H.

description:
We were hungry after a day of heat and booze at the Polk St. Blues Festival and ended up here. I had low to no hopes, but that was a fine fine slice of pepperoni pizza. Do not expect a NY style slice - and that's fine by me, I don't get the attraction of a foldable cheese delivery mechanism - but if you like a great pan style crust (which seems to be the least "raved about" crust style), Nizario's delivers. 

I'll be back.
author: r g.

description:
Ahh Nizario's, how I miss being nearby.

I used to live on Geary blvd a few blocks from this precious pizza gem.  It was a regular spot while I was a student in school and remained in my eating pattern shortly after moving further down the block to Divisadero.

Nizario is a great man and has never forgotten me.  There pizza is top notch, always hot, and the crust is delicious.

Customer service is awesome, they accept CC, and they deliver late night.

-1 star for not being able to get Nizario's in the Outer Sunset!!
author: James G.

description: Late night pizza delivery any day, YES PLEASE! One of my favorite things in the world is pesto on pizza and Nizario's Castro Pizza is delicious! Chicken, pesto, spinach, and feta on one perfectly cooked pizza pie! I'm hoping Nizario's delivers to Cole Valley because I'm moving and don't want to lose this gem!
author: Amber E.

description: Pizza is average. The service is horrible. The guy gave me attitude! ME! ATTITUDE! Who the FUCK do you think YOU ARE? Plus the place doesn't look very clean. Yuck.
author: Alina S.

description:
The pizza's good - and it's just a little hole-in-the-wall place - but what really makes this place great is how nice the guys are. It really makes it fun to go in there - and also get deliveries. They're not cold or stand-offish like other pizza places. Very personal and great service. Definitely recommend.

Update: Just went in again today and the guy wasn't nearly as nice this time. Oh well - I'll have to drop a star for inconsistency: 5 to 4.
author: Matt J.

description:
MMMM. Nizarrio's.

Enter picture of Homer with his head tipped back and drooling.

No better place for a quick slice or a fast-delivery order. Try their Pesto pizza with chicken. Oh, man. My friends love the Special. We always order one or two for a party, and it's always gone in 5 minutes.

Nuff said, but I will continue:

Crispy crust, always arrives steaming hot, plenty of hot pepper included but I wish they'd add another parmesan. I have yet to have a bad slice when I'm walking by. Late night destination to settle a alchohol-overdosed stomach after a session at one of the nearby bars too. Is it haute cuisine? Definitely not. Is it great food when you need something quick and fairly cheap? YES.
author: Patrick G.

description:
When I was living in the Outer Richmond and doing most of my drinking at the Pig & Whistle, Nizario's was invariably the place that my munchies got taken care of on the long walk home. Two good-sized slices for around the price of a beer, and it never took long to get served, even when there appeared to be a lengthy line.

They don't always have everything available toward the end of a busy night, but there's a generally a decent selection of toppings and most of the pizzas being kept warm at the counter look to be fresh. 

I had an odd experience at Nizario's one evening when I was pretty drunk and attempting to order a couple of pepperoni slices. I was told that there were no more slices available but that I could order a whole pizza instead. I was drunk, I was hungry, I had enough money in my pocket...I ordered the whole pizza. Fortunately I had company, and between the two of us we quite happily finished the whole thing once we got home.

On at least one occasion I've eaten pizza at Nizario's sober, incidentally, and I'm pleased to report that I enjoyed it just as much.
author: Justin C.

description:
Nothing beats Nizarios after a night of drinking or when you just don't want to cook. Consistent quality pizza.

They have your standard pizzas, served fresh and hot, into the wee hours. Nothing mind blowing but definitely always consistently good. Plus they deliver too.

The guys that work there are great and very nice. Get your pizza to go because they have very limited seating inside.
author: Josh J.

description: I would gladly give my first born for a lifetime-supply of Nizario's.
author: Sachi T.

description: Meh, this place is alright. I feel like their pizza is too doughy, and not enough toppings. They do give nice big slices and they are open really late, which is always a plus. I've just had better tasting pizzas.
author: Lisa B.

description:
I really wanted to give this place only two stars but because they're open past 1 AM I had to give them the third. 

One time I ordered for them and asked for bacon and got ham. I was so pissed. I hate ham on pizza. I had to call and teach them what bacon is, they were pretty nice about the whole thing. 

But they always say they're gonna take just 35-45 minutes and it always takes just over an hour. I hate that. I would still take it if they said an hour, mainly because few places are open that late. If you can, try ordering from Piccolo's, downtown. They may deliver to the richmond, they usually do for me but I have to spend around 20 bucks. 

Other than all the logistics, their pizza is ok, occasionally doesn't arrive piping hot, which is how we like it. It's not really GOOD pizza like everyone seems to say. It's more of just drunken pizza.
author: Ramy S.

description: I came to eat here last night after enjoying the day walking around the old buildings at the Presidio and on Golden Gate Bridge. I was so hungry and I really wanted pizza, so my fiance and I ended up here. This place is great! Don't let the small size of the place fool you. The staff is super friendly and greet everyone who enters/exits. The pizza itself was really good. I am a fan of sauce, and it didn't have enough for my liking, but it still tasted good so I couldn't complain too much. Plus they are open really late, which is great! I am sure I will make my way here after bar-hopping or after another trip scaling the Presidio..
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Not a bad place for pizza by the slice.  To be honest, I prefer the slice to getting a whole pie from Nizario's.  Yes, I prefer the slice that has been sitting there for awhile to the fresh out of the oven slice.  I think it's because when they reheat the slice the crust become really crispy, which it is not when fresh, but not geasey like at the other pizza by the slice place a few blocks away.

Also doesn't hurt that they're open late for the after drinking munchies.
author: Deb S.

description:
I live nearby and like a slice or two to go, now and then.
It's decent, but not pizza perfection. I find if i pat the top with a paper towel (at home) and put it in a 350 degree oven for 5-10 minutes more, it becomes a 4 star pizza
author: angelique b.

description:
haiku for nizario's:

good when drunk or if
delivery desperate
it's no New York pie
author: Steph P.

description: I have to say, i did not actually enter the restaurant, nor did i have delivery service.  What i had was left over from my bf's dinner the night before, and it was DELICIOUS!! Hands down some of the best pizza i have ever had in the city.  I don't usually like pepperoni pizza, but this was so good, so cheesy, the sauce was perfect, and the crust was delicious!!!!  Wow.   I really have to make a trip down there and pick up a pizza.  just thinking about it now makes my mouth water.  yum!!!
author: Marley E.

description: Great pizza for late night delivery. After calling 6 places at 2:32am, (including the Nizario's on 18th) these guys came through and took our order. An hour later I was summoned to call back and ask what happened to our pizza. It turned out one of our friends had gone out and told the driver to bring the pizza inside (through a dark alley into the middle of the block). The driver freaked and sped off thinking he was going to get jacked. So I sweettalked them into returning with our pies. They drove up 15minutes later with some heavy hitting backup, to find my punk white ass wearing a white tuxedo with cash in hand. That must of created quite a hazing back at the office.  You were scared of that little pansy cracker! What the hell is wrong with you? By that time we were already  laughing our asses off and enjoying the great pizza pies (early breakie at 4am).   Thanks Nizario!
author: Phil M.

description: This is the best pizzeria in the Inner Richmond. I went there with my girlfriends at about 2 in the morning, trashed, and I asked them nonchalantly if they had any vegan pizza. They said no, but then about 10 mins later, brought me a piece of pizza with no cheese, mushrooms and sauce---all for free! they are so sweet, so nice, and so accommodating.Definitely make it a point to stop here at one point in your San Francisco-life.
author: Devon Y.

description:
decent place for a slice of pizza when i am smashed & hungry after a long night of dance offs at buckshot.

i would never go here sober, that's what Giorgio's is for.
author: Lizzy L.

description: Nicely spiced sauce and abundant cheese on a sufficiently thick crust add up to one of the better pizza options in the city. That it's open late is an added bonus.
author: Gourmet G.

description: This is a decent quick stop pizza shop, ideal for late night drunken excursions where taste isn't a factor.  Not that this pizza is bad, it just isn't that great either.  I've eaten here a few times, each time the pizza comes out scaldingly hot, and the dough a bit thick and chewy.  Just don't rush into the first bite and you'll be fine.
author: Tony L.

description: Nizarios is like that pair of shoes that you never throw away.  They might not be your coolest, or the ones you wear on a date, but they are the ones you wear when you are running out the door to move your car before you get a ticket for street cleaning.  I have been going to Nazario's for 10 years now.  It is not the best pizza in SF, but when I am drunk at the end of the night, you could fool me.  You never have to wait long for your slice and I swear when you get it delivered, you will never say, "the pizza is sure taking a long time."  Also, they deliver until 2.  Big Plus.  Slices are cheap and the guys that work there are real nice.  Nizario is always down to talk with his customers.  If you need a quick bite to eat, this is your place..
author: David C.

description:
Note: I babble here a bit at the beginning.  If you want the Nizario's review, skip down a bit.

My feet touched the ground again in this fair city just 2 weeks ago after 4 years in NYC.  I've given up TV for a while and so I've decided to replace that time spent with, amongst other things, finding a decent pizza place in SF and reviewing all the steps along the way.  Lucky you. 

While in NYC, the phrase "good Mexican food" was oxymoronical.  As I remember from my first stint in SF, the same could be said for pizza here.  Like fog in the summer or snow in the winter, after a while it was something that I just accepted with quiet resignation.

But every once in a while, I head back to the well of frustration and anger and ask "Why the f*#k can't people get this right?"  And really, it is a fair question.  It isn't as though we're asking for brain surgery.  Why can't people figure out what a thin crust is supposed to be?  Or why I could possibly want avocado IN my burrito and not a little plastic thing on the side? (People who have lived in both places know exactly what I'm talking about.  People who haven't would be offended by both.)

Hence the reviews.

The elements or review are simple: quality of ingredients, quality of sauce, thinness of crust, crispiness of crust.  The last one only applies to single-slice orders since that crisp crust can only be achieved on the re-heat.  The quality of ingredients and sauce are straight foward elements.  Crust depth is always an issue of contention.  Some people love their bread.  Personally, I think it screws up the bread to ingredients ratio.  There are plenty of other ways to get more much bread that don't involve screwing up a perfectly decent pizza.

I remember from my first stint in SF that Nizario's wasn't a bad option.  Without any food in the house and needing something quick, we ordered up a pie.  Delivery time was an unheard of 18 minutes, which was certainly appreciated because we were starving.  But even our starvation couldn't get us past how average this pizza was.  

ingredients: 4 out 10.  Probably canned.
Sauce: 3 out of 10.  Also likely canned - a little too sugary.
Crust depth: 4 out of 10.  Too fluffy, but not the worst I've seen.  Think Pizza Hut.
Crust crispiness: NA - full pie delivered, so crispiness not applicable. 

All in, it ranked somewhere between mildly disappointing and rather underwhelming.  But hey, we were hungry and the delivery was quick.  So speed saves them from a single star.
author: A K.

description:
the yelling and screaming of some singer at ireland's made us want to eat...something..anything...so, we decided on this place.

this niche is  lovable, dependable and has a limited space (but it really doesn't matter)!

the vegetarian slice i had was nice,huge, piping hot with good amount of veggies & of course, cheese!!!..they also bring  over the pizza to where you're sitting or standing, unlike other places they just holler!

so after we chow down the heavenly slice ,we were so ready to go to another pub somewhere in clement........

a must place to sober up!
author: Nelle A.

description: Nizario's pizza is the best pizza for late night cravings. It is open to 3 on weekends for those bar hoppers! I love it! The pizza is amazing!
author: Katie H.

description:
to tell you the truth, i don't really know for sure if the pizza is actually objectively good. 

anything is good when nothing else is open after the club and you're high as a kite or drunk like a skunk.

i give them 3 stars because anything that prevents me from yakking publicly or in a vehicle is alright with me. :)
author: Vanessa D.

description: Tasty pizza! Flavorful sauce. Great timing on a Sunday night delivery order. We're satisfied :)
author: Amy J.

description: 3.75 with potential for the full 4 in the future, so I decided to round up.  Pizza is pretty good.  This place definitely does the trick when you're craving a big slice of greasy pizza.  The prices are great: $3.75 for a big pepperoni slice and a coke. Great deal.
author: Angie C.

description: Decent pizza. Had a pesto with feta, onion and garlic. $22.75. Not to bad. They chopped all of there ingriendients instead of putting on whole pieces. More like it was chopped in a blender and tossed on there. Still not bad pizza. The delivery was in a timely manner too.
author: Chuck G.

description: Gimme a Greco!!! Even though your breath will stank like no other for days, you have to get a Greco slice at Nizario's. Yes, Nizario's did save me when I only had 2 bucks in my pocket and was broke as a joke. And I miss the jolly fellow who would always have a smile on his face. Even if I forgot my wallet, he would take pity on me and hand me a slice.
author: Beth W.

description: God bless the delivery man! He must think I'm crazy because when I answer the door & see him with my pizza I would want to cry! Nizario's Pizza at 2:00am is true love! Amazing!
author: Jessica O.

description: Seriously?  Who the heck gave this place 5 stars.  Sometimes I think that people on yelp just give everything 5 stars or people in san francisco have no idea what good pizza tastes like.  I can tell you without any doubt that this is terrible pizza.  The dough was bad, the sauce was bad, the cheese and pepporoni tasted old and the pizza took longer than they said it would.  And today I am experiencing some of the worst gas I have ever had in a long time.  Please dont eat this pizza if you have a choice.
author: John G.

description: I think Nizario's IS THE best thicker slice non-chain pizza place in the entire city. Before I worked at Nizario's during my first year of college I used to eat the pizza there with my family every weekend since I was 9 years old. Nizario (the owner) knew me and my mother for a long time and once we had to move in the area I lived in blocks away and ate pizza almost every day after school, and after HS he asked me if I'd be willing to work for him which I did and they've always been SUPER nice and friendly to me, even got free pizza and deliver as well as PEPE the Mexican guy who's been making the pizza's there since I was little was always a joy to work with and made the time just fly. It's all about family hospitality there and while working you just felt like part of the family. I highly recommend it especially on a student budget when your pockets are nearly empty and your schedule doesn't allow for home cooked meals. ;)
author: Petra S.

description: Awesome pizza, open late, within walking distance of several bars, and they actually delivered 2 slices to my house the other night.  SWEET!!  if you're in the richmond and need a late night munchie fix nizario's is the way to go!  their pepperoni pesto is the best!
author: Shanti G.

description: Thank GOD you are open late.  The desperation for greasy food after a night of drinking increases by the minute as you drive past diner after greasy spoon diner that has closed by midnight.  I tend to forget you exist until I'm on my way back home, and I pass by you and see your lights on and your usual late-night patrons.  You've really saved me a couple times.
author: Emma K.

description: It was a Tuesday afternoon. I was in an unfamiliar part of town, so I decided to choose a random restaurant for a quick lunch. I was drawn to Nizario's because of its large window and faded green awning. Plus Nizario is sort of a cool name. The crispy, piping hot slice of Hawaiian pizza hit the spot. The dough wasn't too thick and toppings were just right. The owner smiled and joked around with some people in the neighborhood. In light of the other Yelp reviews, Nizario's is a great neighborhood joint. The pizza is really good and they're open everyday until 2 a.m.
author: Evelyn B.

description: Their pepperoni and jalapeno pizza is delicious. For only $3 it's a deal when an extra topping is only $0.25 more. I've seen places that charge almost a dollar for another topping. Someone needs to put a Yelp sticker on their window. They're also open late night until 2 AM 7 days a week.
author: Armstrong B.

description: A step up from Domino's, but not by much.   I could see how it hits the spot when drunk due to the high grease factor, but as a sober person ordering delivery on a Sunday evening, my stomach was not very happy.  That being said, they do deliver (unlike Giorgio's) and are fast n' friendly.
author: John H.

description: After hitting up Buckshot, my friends and I immediately head to Nizario's.  I admit: I've been partial to going to Seniore's for a late night bite but Nizario's is giving them a run for their money.  Only downside is that I live closer to Seniore's than Nizario's. Darn...
author: Jillian J.

description: Nizario's defines an all-around great pizza.  Their cheese is cheesy, their toppings fresh, the slices are big.  It gets a bit pricy once you add toppings, but it's quite worth the price.  Inner Richmond residents will fall in love with Nizario's delivery - they are quite fast (usually 30-40 minutes) even on weekends. I usually get the Greco - feta, olive, garlic, and pesto sauce.  The location is literally a hole-in-the-wall, bearing a few stools and an old tv set.  If you want Nizario's call delivery and let the goodness come hot and fresh to you!
author: Scott G.

description: Pretty damn good pizza, although the staff is a bit creepy.  When i was there, everyone from behind the counter was watching BBC world news on the tiny TV.  Durring the coverage of rioting in Egypt, a rioter was hit by a missaimed molotov, and the staff erupted into cheers.  Aside from that unnerving moment, the pizza was good, if not excellent.  Especially considering its humble exterior, its good bargain pizza.
author: Herbert S.

description: Think of this place as a household staple when hunger strikes. Quality pizza at very reasonable prices that's logistically positioned near the deep inner Richmond scene. I've met folks coming straight from Abbey Tavern, Rockit Room, The Bitter End you name it they all love the Nizario's pizza. I highly recommend the greco slice if you're not allergic to olives.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: My favorite pizza on Geary, and one of my favorite "slices" place anywhere. Pesto veggie with extra anchovy on top. That's whats up.
author: Johnny O.

description: I thought the slices were a bit thick but overall not bad if you're drunk and in the Richmond. Slices are HUGE!
author: Gina R.

description: Nizario's is the bomb. Perfect after-after-party pizza or have them delivery if you're feeling lazy. Nothing fancy schmancy but if you want solid pizza, this is the place to go to. I also think it's better than Orgasmica (although O will have more specials and toppings if you're into that).
author: Jane C.

description: Good place to go if you want a bite to eat, but in no way it's made for a meal. Pizza is usually not so fresh if you order by the slice but it will be baked fresh if you order a whole. I've been here for 15 years and it's still a great late night place.
author: SF N.

description: Definitely the place to go when you need something to soak up all that alcohol you've been drinking or even go to before you drink so you won't be so shitfaced later. We normally get a slice of pesto and the special. Sometimes, the Hawaiian. We also have them toast it extra long so it's extra crispy. It always hits the spot but then again I've never really had pizza here when I haven't been intoxicated. I most likely wouldn't choose to eat here otherwise.
author: Lee N.

description: I remember coming here after a long night of drinking. The pizza was cheap, big and good. But I came back another time when I wasn't so drunk and it wasn't as good. That, right there, is living proof Remy Martin compliments ANY meal.
author: O'Shea J.

description: The only thing really go this place was that it is open late. I went here after a night of bar hopping and was crazy hungry when I got there. My slice of cheese pizza was fresh out of the oven and it was not memorable at all. You would think that being really hungry would make anything taste like filet mignon but the pizza did not do it. I am really big on crust flavor and this crust was pretty bland.
author: Richard C.

description: EEW! My pizza was cold and it looked like they just microwaved it for 2 seconds and then gave it to me. There is no where to sit and the pizza doesn't taste very good either. There are many better pizza places. The pizza isn't fresh and the staff is very rude.
author: Nikita K.

description: Great pizza...here's why: Hot piping out of the oven with strings of melted cheese.  Bottom of pizza is crispy, making a nice contrast to bready, chewy crust.  Generous topping portions, flavorful sauce.  And the number one reason...if its been a week since you last had a slice and you're still thinking about how great that pizza is, then we have a winner folks.  But seriously, this is one of my fav pizza places in the City.  I highly recommend going for a slice when you're in the area.
author: Swirls L.

description: Um....this is only good really late at night  and if you are drunk...greasy and dough....but hey at 1 o'clock that is okay.
author: Nikki W.

description:
came here due to great reviews here on yelp.

we didn't like our service very much (order was messed up with only 1 out of 2 pizzas ready)

toppings were ok, but were not spread around evenly. and i didn't think it was saucy enough..

the peppers and cheese that came with each box were super tiny [not a big deal, but we like our peppers :)]
author: Wendy T.

description: I'd only go here if i was a block away, drunk, and if it's still open past 2 am.  Other than that, you could find much better pizza in the city.  The cheese and sauce doesn't work for me.  I like the variety of toppings, but you'll probably never find me back here.
author: Louie N.

description: By far the worst pizza I have had in the city (good pizza in this city is an anomaly). I don't want to sound harsh, but this place blows. Granted it's CHEAP, but the pizza is hard to stomach (how can you screw up pizza??? (i.e. you know the pizza is bad when you offer a slice to a homeless person only to have it come right back at you as a potential harmful projectile). I will now only eat this pizza under certain circumstances including: A. if i massive earthquake hit the city and there was no other source of food. B. I was on the verge of blackout and got the munchies C. if I was suffering from starvation.
author: Cameron R.

description: Your basic hole-in-the wall pizza joint. Nothing special. By the slice is nice, but the crust always feels tough. Not very fresh veggies, either.
author: Bee H.

description: Nizario's made my penis disappear under a ballooning waistline.  During the awkward transition from the structured insanity of college to the surreality of professional living, I stomped the grounds of the Inner Richmond and succumbed often to the angina inducing slices of burnt Hawaiian pies: less than perfect ratios of Canadian bacon to pineapple pieces sprinkled over mozzarella and tomato sauce.  I paid a visit after every alcoholic binge at Bitter End or Last Day Saloon or Fizzee's.  I needed my fix.  Nizario's was my Blue Magic.  I have been clean for three years.
author: Michael K.

description: My boyfriend ordered takeout from Nizario's so much the delivery guys knew who he was.  That's how much we loved it (or how much I loved it and made him order it).  Basically, Nizario's makes the perfect pizza.  If you want a straight-up pizza that doesn't sag from grease or tout all the ways they're redefining pizza (like that stuffed crust crap that one chain does), then Nizario's is the way to go.  You simply can't go wrong with them.  They know what they're doing and they do it right every time.  And believe me, I've eaten a lot of Nizario's pizza.
author: ashley w.
