description: Not bad, not great. Goes well w/ a tasty Duff. I usually find myself ordering Nizario's from bars at 12:45, they'll arrive b/w 1:30 and 2am, and I can either take my pizza home or share it w/ the last callers and a friendly bartender. Hey, it is what it is.
author: Duffman D.

description: What the hell is up with this place.  I know, I know... it's an oldskool SF establishment... but admit it -- YOU WERE DRUNK WHEN YOU ATE THERE.  On a sober stomach, it doesn't compare to other pizzerias.  (Oooo.... I'm gonna catch hell for giving this one 2-stars, huh?)
author: Matt W.

description: This pizza is the bang for your buck pizza in the area.  Slices are always ready and they deliver.
author: Joel M.

description:
me:  "can i get a slice of pepperoni please, togo..."

pizza man:  *nod*

sliced, boxed, $3.00 transaction.

no tricks or gimmicks here.  it is wat it is.

cheap, quick stop for greasy but surprisingly good pizza!  8D
author: Ethan L.

description:
The pizza here sucks.  Ingredients are weak, the crust tastes like cardboard.  I would compare it to frozen pizza, but I would be insulting the frozen pizza.  At least you only pay $5 for frozen.  Here, you pay $15 and it is crap.

You have benn warned...
author: E H.

description: hahahahhaa niggzarios is what you eat while hammered on your walk of shame. decent at best but tastes reaaly good when you have a small distilery at work in your tummy.
author: aidan m.

description:
open late night & right next to the buck shot! a winning combo!

mediocre pizza but its "to die for" when your drunk muchies come along...

the truth is... there is much better pizza out there...
author: c e.

description: Awesome for the late-night munchies. Get the pesto pizza. It's amazing! If you're looking for atmosphere and service, don't even bother. It's all about the food.
author: Natalie T.

description: Niz-Naz is the shiz-naz.  Nowhere better for late night pizza (open til two), tasty greco and combo slices.  Great delivery pizza is massive and generally hot and quick (like JCarr's mom).
author: Aaron F.

description: I used to live a block from Nizario's and probably had Niz-Naz at least twice a week.  I still drop in whenever I'm in the neighborhood... the smells that drift down the street can be pretty hard to resist.   The pizza isn't amazing, but it has a good, crispy crust and the ingredients appear to be at least somewhat fresh.  The employees are usually friendly too.
author: Andrew E.

description:
hmmmmm.... what a delicious slice of pie all drenched in oil! 

this is my idea of good pizza after hitting the bars/clubs. MAN... those people over at Marina/Union St. should be heading over here afterwards. Pizza Orgasmica is overatted! Plus I got stepped on lining up in that stampede line of belligerent drunk people! 

BARELY A LINE at Nizario's =)
author: Sue Y.

description: Nizario's is hands down my FAVORITE pizza place!  By the slice, or by the pie...anyway you slice it, it's awesome pizza.  Nice that they are open late, super quick (they always have a slew of pies ready and fresh), and consistently good.  My sister who moved to New York (where pizza is king) always has to make a pit stop to Nizario's when she's in town cause to even to her, it's the bestest!
author: Marie B.

description: The pizza is as good when you're sober as it is when you're drunk. Now that's saying something! Hot, crispy slices quickly made to order for 'sheep sheep.' They keep it basic, they keep it real, and unlike the big O, I've never seen anyone start a late night fight in line 'cause they didn't score at the bars. In fact, Nizario's once had a saying on their door...'If you didn't score a piece, you can at least have a slice.' I think that says it all. Rock a piece, or a slice, today.
author: Christopher S.

description: A quality slice from the pointy end to the handle part.  Not greasy at all.  Not too floppy, hard, crunchy or runny.  Thick enough to fill you up.
author: Dan C.

description: I think I was pretty drunk when I came in here, but I believe the pizza was good. ++++ for being close to USF.
author: Irvin David U.

description: Drunk or sober it makes no difference, this pizza is BLAND.  Good thing they have so many red pepper and basil spices around the store for you to spice it up.  Even after you put tons of it, it still tastes like SHT.  Anyway for about four dollars a slice of any of their specials, i'd take my money else where.  You might think I'm giving this review after one try, but no I've had it quite a couple times, and each time it gets worst and worst.  I'll give it two stars instead of one because its actually a decent sized slice.
author: Mike L.

description: Three chairs and two high tables create the not so impressive store front of Nizario's pizza. That being said as far as pizza by the slice goes in SF, I was impressed. I will definitely have their pizza again, but I think it will become my favourite delivery place instead of an eat-in venue!
author: M M.

description: The past few times I've gotten a slice here have merely left my slightly intoxicated self satisfied that my hunger was curbed. Maybe I'm more picky or maybe it's sobriety, but the pizza doesn't taste as good as before. Also the other day I tried ordering the Greko, and the owner tried to give me one with a tomato base - every time I've ordered it in the past, it's been pesto-based. I also tried the veggie pizza, which left me disappointed.
author: Jane K.

description: Forget all the other pizza joints! Nizarios is my favorite Castro District pizza place. I went in one night during Pride week, expecting chaos and raised prices. I was impressed beacuse they had an efficient system nailed down, getting people's orders pushed out almost immediately like a well oiled pizza making machine. Unlike everywhere else in the Castro, they kept their prices the same. Soda is only a buck. The slices are cooked to perfection and the staff is super friendly. When you're out and (maybe?) a little drunk and hungry, make this the place you go to refuel.
author: Natalie N.

description:
it's even delicious sober.

one might wonder why it took me four years to eat nizario's sober.

well, one might need a smack in the goulie.  Stop asking questions and go get me another beer.

jeez.

and another slice of nizario's, cause its that good.
author: clever u.

description:
Took a stroll down Geary looking for something to eat at 12:30am, and came upon Nizarios. I came up short because i accidentally forgot a dollar in my apt - i got a nice big slice of pepperoni for $2.65. I returned shortly with the dollar i owed and a credit card and asked for a slice of pepperoni and a slice of the greco. They were having problems with their credit card machine, and i had to chill for about five minutes while they figured it out. Eventually, the guy working the register told me to take my pizza and enjoy it, and that he was sorry for the delay.

Outstanding customer service, generosity, and pizza. Would recommend to anyone.
author: Scott M.

description: This place is AMAZING. Their pizza crust is fluffy. Can't explain how it is fluffy, but you just have to try it to see. I am not a pizza fan at all, this place is one of the only places that I have ever had pizza I truly enjoy. I get the pesto pizza with roasted garlic and pineapple it's great.
author: Jessie E.

description:
i have been stricken with a case of march MADNESS, and therefore have been unable to stop watching the ncaa hoops tournament to prepare food for myself.

i called nizario's and ordered a thin crust pie, and a side salad. 

ordering food for delivery on sunday, at noon, AND during the playoffs is a recipe for disaster with most restaurants, but not nizario's. the perfectly-cooked, piping-hot pizza arrived at my house in 25-30 minutes. 

amazing.

i have so much love in my heart for nizario's, i took a break from the game to give them kudos.

p.s. the delivery guy was very sweet and friendly.
author: Andy P.

description: Not only do they open late, they'd be my first choice even if I had other options bright and early in the day. Nizarios pizza is NOT oily. The crust is probably my favorite out of all the pizza parlors. The price is reasonable, toppings are generous, and cheese is fresh. My favorite pizza joint by far.
author: Anderson L.

description: I was all stumbly and bumbly when I happened on Nizario's. I had stepped outside a bar for a smoke and then I saw satisfied looking customers walking down the street eating pizza and I thought to myself, "self, you would very much enjoy pizza as well." It was not in the mood for an argument so I let myself win and I'm glad I did. After going back into the bar to finish up a couple drinks Nizario's became the goal. I had a Combo Pizza and it was just what the doctor ordered. To compare, I had a Mystic Pizza at Mythic Pizza and Nizario's blew it out of the water. I appreciate what Mythic is doing, cooking a slice to order each time but my bell peppers weren't cooked. Nizario's was delicious in their prepreparedness. Yay drunken pizza eating.
author: Don L.

description: I LOVE this place.  Have been going here since I first moved to San Francisco.  The people that work there are really nice and it's great to support San Francisco independent stores.  Great pizza, great price, and buy it by the slice when you're on the go!
author: Iliana C.

description: Pizza ain't bad, but not fantastic either. Slices are good for the Coronet lines. Open late.
author: Don H.

description: This place has a great crispy crust pizza. I use to go here as a kid with my dad and the food is still just as good. They do pizza by the slice and by the pie. They make an awesome pesto pizza.
author: Kameelah R.

description: What do you want after a night out?  A good piece of pizza in a hurry.  That's just what you get at Nizario's.  It's literally a hole in the wall, but if you're craving some late night pizza, it's the place to go.  Right off the 38 bus line, you're in and out in a couple of minutes.  Unless the place is pretty empty, don't bother trying to create your own pizza.  The Vegetarian and the Combo are my favorites, but the Greco is good too.
author: Ixchel F.

description: I take it back.  The staff work hard, they are friendly, and they like locals.  Good people, and decent pizza.
author: Sanjeev B.

description: Good crust, sauce and toppings, but overly light on cheese. It is a good slice and late night hours can be convenient. The to go slices are a bit on the smallish size.
author: Mike L.

description: The service is always good at this place but I just don't like the amount of grease they put on my pizza.
author: Jasleen K.

description: Yummy!  I love going to this place after drinking or clubbing in the richmond district.  The pizza is always fresh, affordable and tasty! There is a small sit down area if you wanted to eat there but we usually get it to go since it's always crowded.
author: Anna L.

description: This is a good place to go after you hit the bars or club. The pizza taste really good after you have that good buzz going. Get a nice big slice of pizza for a good priece.
author: Keoni U.

description: I'm not a big fan of San Francisco's pizza delivery options, but this place serves a good pie, and usually pretty quick.  Also good for late night slices if you are awkwardly on Geary at 1am.
author: Andrew R.

description: Bomb ass pizza when drunk... chicken pesto...
author: Jose S.

description: One drunken post Velvet Lounge night in North Beach circa three years ago, we realized all the pizza places in North Beach open @ 2am SUCKED. So we talked our only sober friend and DD to drive us all the way to Nizario's for pizza. It never disappoints. NEVER.
author: Dee I.

description: Based only on late night eats cause I have only ordered pizza here afterhours.  Actually, more specifically slices.  Not sure how good their pies are.  Hits the spot pretty well after some drinks.  Better than some other late night pizza spots I have had.
author: Mark W.

description: My boyfriend got me hooked on to Nizario's. It might just be the best pizza in town. First off, the pizza is great. I like the thin crust pizza with jalepeno and sausage. Second off, the prices are very reasonable. I think it's like 12 bucks for a medium sized pizza and 2 or 3 dollars for a slice if you dine in. Third, everyone there is really nice. It's really a no thrills pizza place that is open super late ( I think till 4am). Delivery is also super fast. Everytime I've order Nizario's, the pizza gets to my house within 15 minutes still very hot.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Nizario's delivered...and sooner than they promised (they said 40 minutes, but a mere 20 later, we were eating piping hot pizza)...I am a huge fan of their pesto (add chicken if you need protein!) pizza
author: Alisa S.

description: For some reason, I always get the munchies after drinking. The trek back and forth from Buckshot built up my appetite. So at about 1:30, I tell my girls we should bounce because I wanted a slice from Nizario's next door (they close at 2am). So we flee Buckshot with the quickness and I go in to place my order. "Slice of mushroom and a bottled water please!" Order is up in less than 30 seconds, and I'm in post drinking meal heaven. However, I tasted more crust than sauce in their pizza, which means 1 star short of 4.
author: Rhia R.

description: Good place to get a slice of pizza. Service was quick. The pizza was ok, I got a combination, but not as fresh or hot as I like it. I give this place more like 3 1/2 stars.
author: Leon C.

description: To us college students up at USF, Nizario's is the gourmet pizza delivery option that we can take advantage of!  I really enjoy their "Nizario's Special," which is a combination pizza with diced and thinly chopped up ingredients.  With each bite you get a taste of ALL the ingredients, and that is what I really like about it.  The delivery man is very friendly, service is quick and fast and this place has great specials.  Support this instead of a big chain like domino's.  Plus it taste's better!
author: Tony T.

description: I have friends that rave about this place, so I knew I had to try it eventually. It was not quite as good as I had expected, but the price makes up for a lot. Anytime you can get full from $6 worth of food and drink (the cost of my two pepperoni slices and a bottled water) you can't really complain.
author: Alex C.

description:
decent pizza that's open very, very late

good crowd, usually people who just finished barhopping in the area

main thing i remember was that they get your pizza, even a whole pie, a hell of a lot faster than any other place i've been to

after a long night of hanging out at the bars on geary, or if you need to waste a half hour in the richmond because a friend of yours wanted some alone time with a girl at a nearby party when it was originally time to go, it's always good to come here
author: Charles C.

description: Quite possibly the best pizza to ever have graced my mouth.  I long for you when I can't have you.  Everytime I drive by, I think of how you belong in my mouth.  Alas, thank you for all the post night out parties in which you stole the show....and my heart.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
delivers to my place. check.

hot upon arrival. check.

pesto to die for. check.

i have to thank my roomie for turning me on to this spot after many a disappointed night spent with weeeeeeeeeeak pizza choices.
author: M M.

description:
late night...last call...left over change...craving for food...don't want a dui? walk down to this place. love it. good pizza for a great price. after the bars or clubs, i can guarantee a line, but honestly still worth it if you're in the area. The guys who own this place are extremely nice and friendly and will make a pizza to your specs...just remember to tip cause this needs to be open forever...

I also heard a good rumour that the sausage and pepperoni they serve is beef, not pork. So another plus to how good this pizza is.
author: robert b.

description: On a bad lazy day to prepare another health concious meal, I decided what the hell, Pizza its gonna be. And you bet it was, today unlike other times, delivery was within 30 minutes...( I normally order super late at night... so I shouldn't whine about delivery, there are lots of hungry studying students or hung-over people out there). Anywho, my pizza was super fresh, and so were the toppings on it, I enjoyed a mushroom, tomatoe, and pineapple pizza. I know many are not fans of pineapple, but they have various selections of toppings. I have tried their house special, good as well. By the way they also serve slices which are always absolutly delicious, and fresh. By the way if you pizza is late, they will accomodate you with a discount, these people are great. As for the ambiance its a hole in the wall.
author: yana Z.

description: This is one of the best pizzas by the slice places in the city. I've been coming here for almost 10 years. The slice sizes are well porportioned, it's a bit hard to believe they were about 25-30% bigger before, but they were. The pizzas come out really quick, I don't think I've ever waited more than a minute for a slice or two. And they come hot. It's nice and cheap and it is without a doubt the best place  to get food after a long night of partying.
author: Calvin L.

description:
this place gets tons of late night business! i stopped back here and got some slices along with a salad on a ride home from work. yum!

alpha bar used to be next door, and afterwards i'd visit.
author: Ameer N.

description: Let me start off by saying that I've never been here sober. It's a great late night place to get a couple slices of some greasy pepperoni pizza. From what I remember about the pizza here, it no way compares to other places in the city but unfortunately those places close early, Nizzies is one of the great late night options to soak up that alcohol before passing out.
author: D J.

description: I love Nizario's!  Granted, I've never eaten here sober but the next day, my leftovers still taste good.    The real reason I love them is that even though they technically close at 2, frequently they will still deliver a pizza after 2 if you live nearby and they are still in a pizza makin mood.  I've only stopped in for a slice once, but it was really good.   Only one negative thing: the pizza is kinda bready.  But who cares when the service is fantastic.  They are always super nice and patient even while I'm ordering my pizza in drunken gibberish.
author: Isi C.

description: Read the Yelp reviews and was looking forward to the thin crust. It was okay but not as thin as I would like it. The pizza is decent but nothing special.
author: Wendy B.

description: Deliciously delicious pizza! The crust is the best part of the pizza.  Nice thick crust, that's not too soft, not too crispy, but just right.  The sound of the crust when you bite into it, creates just the right crackle.  The pizzas aren't loaded with cheese (which is the case with some places and the pizza ends up hanging on you because of the weight), the amount of pizza sauce is perfect, toppings are always fresh, and they aren't greedy about the amount topping they add to each slice.  I've been coming here for the past 5 years now, and Nizario's is still #1 on my pizza list (this is a worldwide list).  They never fail me.  Melt....
author: Mellie P.

description: lackluster at best.  sorry kids.  i came here after a full night of pub crawling, which usually breeds an easily appeased palette, but i could hardly finish the single slice i was gifted.  the crust was oily and spongy, very pizza hutesque.  the flavors were flat, and without compliment.  i felt unreasonable but was reassured by my comrade who purchased my slice.  please step your game up.
author: Ryan H.

description:
Drunk? Want pizza? Bar tab kill you? Go to Nizarios on geary and order the Greco. Just make sure any strange person you make out with is aware of the garlic. Not like the stench of alchol is scaring them away.

Sober? Lunch Break? Hungry? Go to Nizarios because they make really great pizza even if you are not inebirated. Again order the Greco and watch your wallet be happy!

Staff is always very friendly and plenty of seating to eat your slice, talk with your fellow people or watch the tube.

Plus cheap eats.
author: David B.

description: This should be a Three Star pizza place, the food is great but its not a sit-down kind of place, and there's no way I'm going to drive to the Richmond to stand up and eat pizza. But it's open until at least 2:30 in the morning on the weekends, making it my number one "sober-up" joint in the city.
author: Matt C.

description: Most definitely not the best pizza i've ever had, but after a long night of binge drinking followed by some binge greenage, I must say Nizario's is almost a godsend. Good pizza, good prices, good service, what more could I ask for?
author: Oscar M.

description: 2nd best pizza joint in the City, next to Senores. Great pizza, and the people that work there are friendly, even if you can barely put together a sentence. Slices are ready to go, and if they've been sitting around for a while, they'll pop em in the oven for a few minutes to heat them back up. They also remember who ordered what so you're pizza isn't stolen. Nizzario's Combo is the way to go.
author: Rod M.

description: Good pizza, friendly employees. Nothing too amazing but a couple people I know swear it their favorite pizza. It serves slices and delivers until 3 i believe, which is a real perk.
author: Zach D.

description: Delivery is always fast. The people are always nice. The pizza is always hot and tastes great. Nizario's is the best place in town for late-night pizza.
author: Shannon M.

description: I used to go here all the time on my way back to the TL after a few tiki drinks at Trader Sam's. I'm picky when it comes to pizza and I drool when I think about the things I would do with a slice of the Greko Special (garlic, black olives, feta cheese, and pesto), some lactaid pills, and strong mints.
author: Nancy B.

description: Pretty good for the price, and conveniently located if you're on your way to or from one of the bars in the area.  There's a small sit-down area in the no-frills 10x10, flourescently-lit space in front of the register where you can nosh on your slice.
author: Deb T.

description:
I've definitely grown to like this place. The first time I had the pizza when I moved close by, it was almost forgettable. However, over time, I think the quality has improved. 

The pizza is decent. When the place is not as busy, I've struck up conversations with the chef and owner and they're really nice. This always makes me like the place more because I can connect with the person making my food.

This place is open until 2 a.m and this is itself worth it!! There have been so many times I've stopped by for a quick bite on late nights.
author: Rahul A.

description: 4.5 STARS. Best pizza I've ever had hands down. I read another review about bad service, but I've never experienced that myself, because I always eat there. When you're there, the service isn't bad. The best slice there has got to me the "Chicken, Mushroom and Jalepeno". After you try a slice of this, it'll make you want to order another one. TRY IT!
author: HENRY M.

description: Delicious pesto in huge slices. Always nice and hot, especially on crowded nights (even though it's a total pain in the ass to wait in line -- but at least you can creepily stare at everyone else in the mirror). The delivery is pretty fast, usually 10 minutes fewer than the time they tell you when you order, and the people are friendly unless agitated. Like everyone else.
author: Jordan S.

description: Nizario's is only worth it if your looking for Pizza by the slice! Don't bother getting a hole pie here. Head down the street to Bella's, Much better pie for a few dollars more!
author: Dr. L.

description: OK this pizza is the best in the west! haha It was cool because it wasn't too far from campus and served as a great late snack to go along with the 23 shots you had at the Alpha Bar. Pretty cheap too for a starving college student. Yay! I'm a fan.
author: Sharmaine I.

description: Great inner Richmond Pizza joint when you are done with the bars. For any fellow USFers of the passed, we remember when the crust used to be 10 times better. Nonetheless, still greasy goodness.
author: Venney B.

description: To Nizario's on Geary Blvd: You guys are work - a - holics! everyday till 2am pretty much. Always with a great attitude and fast service.  Your pizza is good and I bless you for the long hours you put in. Good Job to all involved!
author: Fernando B.

description: Nizario's was a mainstay in my diet when I lived in the Inner Richmond, and I still think it's the best pizza in SF. I hear a lot of bitching about the lack of good pizza in SF, which is probably generally true. But listen, Chicago deep dish pizza is awesome, but not even in the same category as any other city's pizza. And New York style pizza can kiss my ass. Nizario's is a pretty damn good slice no matter where you are. I recommend the pesto.
author: Lou M.

description: This is another one of my favorite pizza places to grab a bite to eat after 10pm in the richmond district. The slices are crunchy and the price is cheap!
author: Pudgy G.

description: Nizario's taste best after going to a bar or a club. Good place to see friends after 2 a.m. when everyone is jolly!
author: Michael L.

description: I'm a fan for local pizza. Tho RT gourmet veggie is amazing! This place has great pesto pizza.  I think it's better because I had a few drinks @ Abbey first...
author: Jen C.

description: I've never ordered from them but have often walked over to get a slice or two. The pizza's always decent; not my favorite but not bad either as the crust is good and it's not too greasy. The guys behind the counter are always very nice to me too so that's a plus.
author: Rachael E.

description:
Good pizza. The place looks like a hole but they're friendly and quick.

You know the kind of pizza that fits your expectations and satisfies? That's what Nazario's is. It won't blow your mind, but it fills a void in your speed dial list.

Oh, and there are four metered motorcycle parking spots in front.
author: Randy D.

description: "No real person should go to bed the same day ya wake up."  And when you're looking for that late nite bite in the Richmond, Nizario's by the slice is ready (closes at 2am).
author: Cliff L.

description: Is it me or has this place gone downhill?  The slices are so small for the price.  You can get way better elsewhere.  I only go here as a last resort due to the convenience factor.
author: Quyen Q.

description: I go out of my way to go here -- the pizza is soooooooooooooo yummy!  The crust is not too thin or too thick and each slice has a generous amount of sauce, cheese and other toppings.  No, you can't sit down and its kind of a dive, but I love it and it keeps me from having a nasty hangover the next morning!  I've also had it delivered -- they must have taken it directly from the oven to my house because -- I couldn't believe how fast they were!
author: Mandy M.

description: Clearly, Nizario's doesn't need another review but I think it is the best pizza I've had outside of NY. I trek out on that Geary bus every time I'm in the city to get me some. They only get four stars cuz the last few times I was there they had no anchovies, WTF? Pesto with fishies is my fav and they do it the best. Sac has nothing to compare, makes me kinda sad. BTW, the Nizario's in the Castro sucks, don't know why but the pizza there is a 1 star.
author: Justin S.

description: I can't even begin to explain the joy that is brought to me by a late night slice of Nizario's pizza...Do It!
author: Aubree B.

description:
I have 10 words for you, "Large half nazario special half veggie and half pesto special."
That's 3 halves?
It's a big pizza!
author: Snow B.

description: since i live in the area i cant help but sometimes go here. the late night hours work well for me and it is cheap pizza. but certainly nothing close to delicious. very mediocre and sometimes the wait is a bit long. but all latenight places come through.
author: Andrew D.

description: mmm. little salty fish. that's right: i like the anchovies. the pesto is good too. they're open til forever-o-clock smack in the middle of the loudest bars this side of. we like that.
author: jane y.

description: i'm happy that nizario's is open at 2am... and  there was still a line out the door at that hour! pizza there is pretty spiffy, but they only take atm/debit if it's over $7. that kinda sucked. otherwise, they would've gotten 5 stars from me. i used to come here all the time, after we got out from (high) school. definitely, a better pick than eating kfc everyday.
author: Nathan J.

description: My favorites are the greco and the pesto.  What can I say?  This place is a hole in the wall with emphasis on damn simple and damn good pizza.  In fact, I like that there aren't enough chairs, that the interior is dirty and unkempt, there's always a line stretching out the door at 1:00 am.  I might be in the minority here but,  I also think they have excellent service(give them your money and they will satisfy your pizza cravings guaranteed).
author: SJin K.

description: Forget the Haters on Yelp. W all the bars close by on Clement, this is the perfect place to grab some drunk grub. Best pizza in the inner richmond. 5 stars. NasaFast
author: Cam K.

description: always a great excuse for a meeting to be over lunch: let's call nizarios! good pizza that is always consistent and comes over with a quickness. i'll probably never walk up to get a slice, but hey, at least I know where to go when I'm feenin'. Yes, I said feenin' I'm from the hood, yo!
author: Charlene L.

description: i love this place!!!!!!!! they are open late and they have mushroom pizza ready for you.  you don't have to wait for them to make it.  you go places and they have the proverbial pepperoni, sausage, or vegi pizza always available but mushroom............my favorite.  slices are huge and pizza is still good the next day.  you know that is key.
author: junie k.

description: Orgasmic and we're not talking about pizza orgasmica either. The perfect treat when your on your way home after a night out on geary.
author: andrew j.

description: Always stop into Nizarios for a slice when I'm in the neighborhood or for a late night snack.  I love the pizza.  Something about the sauce is great.  If you're gonna order 3 pieces or more consider just ordering a whole pizza.  I usually call it in 15 mins. ahead of time and just swing in for a quick pick up.  You can always take the rest home.  Service isn't necessarily their strong suit.  It's hit and miss there.  Still one of my favorite pizza spots in SF for sho.
author: Dirty S.

description: it seemed like yesterday, but several years back, my buddies in the city would take me to this hole-in-wall after a nite of clubbing. now that im here, i stop by for my pesto slice every now and then.
author: Sha A.

description: in the early 90's their slice was triple of what it is now. but i do show my face here after a late night out, and i always seem to run into someone i know. great place for pizza and to see friends from high school.
author: Nida O.

description: This is my 4 year old son's favorite pizza anywhere! And he's got very particular tastes.  We love to pop in on our evening walks and grab him a piece of pepperoni.  The staff always greeted us with a laugh and kind words for our children.
author: Eyedoc H.

description:
one of our favorite places for pizzas-by-the-slice.  their pizzas are always consistently good.  good prices too.  if you like pepperoni you should definitely try theirs.
it's more of a to-go place though.  not much seating(and i wouldn't think one would want to hang out there anyway).  parking sucks but that's just another *perk* that comes with the Richmond!
author: kristina h.

description: I haven't been in San Francisco for too long but I must say, this is by far the best pizza spot that I've discovered. I enjoyed that it was pizza by the slice, but that only prompted me to pick up a whole pizza to take home for the roomies to enjoy as well. The staff is very friendly and down to earth and when you talk to the owner, he talks to you as if you've been friends for some time. I'll definitely be returning
author: Chris P.

description: I love this place , their food is really yummy, they deliver and take credit card, another reason for me to enjoy the delivery experience.  Not to mention the cheap prices & delicious pizza . Thanks Nizario's Pizza
author: Kristen E.

description: Crap. You'll notice most people who give favorable reviews mention they are drunk. This pizza stinks. Puffy crust that makes it seem like you are eating mediocre sauce and cheese off a cut up futon. This is a city where Round Table gets 3.5 stars.
author: Arptro H.

description: 1 thing is good about this place: the speed of service. the pizza was good. but it was tiny! itsy bitsy! I go to pali pizza (napoli pizza) and I'm stuffed after a slice. this place, i need 2. plain & simple.  this place: mediocre excitement, OK pizza, small slices, but quick service.
author: Victor B.

description: this place is really but i orders from the other one man that shit is nasty as fuck its like its to different stores
author: ricky r.

description: not the best out there but it definitely hits the spot. they don't skimp on the cheese and the slices are decently big. i'm a cheese pizza type of gal but i've had their greek pizza with feta and olives and that was pretty good too, especially after a night of drinking.
author: kristin e.

description: delicious, GIGANTIC slices, verrrry decently priced (especially when one slice can last two meals if you have some will power), and open late-ish.  delivery is also fast.
author: asia c.

description: adore the pizza here! i believe it is the best pizza in the city. I happen to be a lover of thick crust and lots of cheese and this place delivers. Definitely must try the nizario's special!
author: Ashely J.

description: greco, greco, greco= garlic, garlic, garlic!! and i LOVE it!  no matter what time of the day, it's always a good idea to stop in for a hot slice... whether it's to whet the appetite for your next meal, satisfy a drunken craving or kill time... you can't go wrong.  i've never been there when they have their infamous long lines stretching out the door, thankfully, but i'd understand why.
author: becky f.

description: if u r in the mood for something more crusty and cheesy, this is the place to order from. the slices are a good size, but the last time i went here they started to get shady with the toppings. delivery was always quick, but i did only live 3 blocks away (yes, i'm lazy).
author: Brokester C.

description: i must admit that they only times i ever go to nizario's i had maaaaybe had a few frothy beverages. these frothy beverages maaaaaay have also contained alcohol. that being said, it is possible that my taste buds and urgency for pizza could be jaded due to said frothy beverages. HOWEVER... regardless of that... i have always always always been satisfied with their pizza by the slice! especially being in the rich, it can be a tad rough getting the late night eats. *thinks to self* ya the only other semi-decent late night spot is the walk up jack in the box. so my review is strictly for those who are in search of yummy, after lots of frothy beverages, eats. :D
author: Kristin Y.

description: went in for a slice later at night. had the pesto, which was good, hot, and filling, but not spectacular. the guy at the counter was really nice though, and they gave me a miniscule complimentary cup of water.
author: Lisa M.

description: This place is conveniently  located to some bars and my place, so it's my go-to spot to soak up that ETOH.  I love the Pesto.  I will always remember watching the Lakers lose the Finals on their TV while waiting for my pizza... ah, good times.  This has to be some good pizza if I like it even when not inebriated.
author: Christine H.

description: Nizzies. Like patriotism it is the last refuge of a scoundrel. It is hallowed ground for my drunken debauchery. I have fended off impending blackout or nursed myself back to buzzed since before it was legal for me to drink. Their slices are delicious and perfect. Their whole pies are wholly mediocre, but who gets a whole pie drunk anyway? Like real Belgian Frites this pizza needs to be cooked twice. So treat yourself to fa(s)t food and get some.
author: Elias R.

description:
i love nizarios.  the pepperoni is cooked perfectly.  its crispy and tasteful. not soggy and tasteless.  the prices are good, they tend to be open past 2 am to cater to those who've been out drinking... delivery is one time and their delivery men are always very nice. 

the place is super small, but i've always enjoyed the pizza there. in fact, if it weren't for nizario's, i'd say that i would have starved a long time ago...

off the top of my head, i think they have odd hours on fridays for lunch.
author: Mary B.

description: not the best pizza you can get but it hits that spot. cheap price for a good size slice, open late and the people are nice.
author: william w.

description: Always friendly service, cheap prices, and delicious pizza.  The mushroom slice is a wonderful late-night booze sponge, and the service is good even for drunken fools at 2AM (a marvel).
author: Corinna R.

description: The BEST pizza by the slice in the city, hands down!!!!! great people, good times, open late, awsome!!
author: Chris K.

description: Oh Nizario's.  You call to me.  You call with your fine Greco slices (carefully excluding the nasty black olives) and you used to sing me to sleep as I passed out on a greasy transparent slice plate.  But I was younger then and lived close to your fine eatery.  Now, when i order you for delivery, I miss barely being able to stand while in line what with all the grease on the floor and the drinks in my blood.  Still, I pass by you sometimes and the siren call distracts me as I try to drive West on Geary.  Were it at all possible to park in your neighborhood, I might stop by to say hi, but you don't want that.  You never wanted that.
author: Robb K.

description: The staff is fantastic and you gotta love the hours. I'll stop by at 1am and am usually satisfied with the good not great pizza. Prices, service and hours are the best and the pizza is good. If only the slices were up to the same amazing standards as the intangibles.
author: Sam G.

description: We ordered delivery to our daughter's birthday party.  The venue was in Presidio and it was rather hard to find, but they did.  They came on time and very good attitude.  We loved the mushroom and onion pizza.  The pepperoni was ok-ok.  The crust of the pizza was very good and not very oily.
author: Miinno N.

description: OK, I know this isn't saying much, but Nizarios is by far the best delivery in the Richmond district.  Sure,  If you want to get off your lazy butt and pick up your pizza yourself, there may be better options like giorgios or gaspares, but for delivery, Nizarios is your best bet.
author: Nicole M.

description: took forever to get late night delivery but pretty good pizza
author: Erica L.

description: Nizario's has always been so good to me... especially after ten too many shots. I've been coming here since middle school and it's always the same great pizza. They always have their pre-made pizzas ready to order, but I'd rather order my own special pizza with all my favorite toppings :) YUM! Totally worth the wait. The dough is thick, chewy and a little crunch, just the way I like it. Cheap and super yummy. Much better than Round Table and those other chains. It's a small place so don't expect to fit a large group of people in there. There's a small counter for you to sit and eat at along with 2 other small tables and maybe 5 stools total :P But a lot of people end up taking the food out or eating it outside anyway so not a big deal. One time me and my girlfriends went in to order some slices and instead got two large pizzas for free!! Well, we took a picture with the workers and told em we'd send the pics over so they could post it on their website... I wonder if my friend ever sent the pictures, or if they even have a website haha :P Oh well, try it out... so worth it :)
author: Haim C.
